title: Data Engineer, Pay Equity
description:
Overview

Please note that you are limited to one application during the recruitment period as we ask you to think ahead of what office and service line you are most interested in.

At KPMG, you‚Äôll join a team of diverse and dedicated problem solvers, connected by a common cause: turning insight into opportunity for clients and communities around the world.

Do work that matters, supported by a community that values difference and cares about you. Gain learning that‚Äôll last you a lifetime and be recognized for the impact you make. With a focus on encouraging employees to come as they are, KPMG provides its employees with a variety of unique tools and support systems that ensure they thrive and make their mark in their career and in their communities.

Why KPMG Pay Equity?

Pay equity metrics, policies and practices are viewed as key elements of an ESG strategy, and one that employers are being tasked to adopt with a sense of urgency.

The implementation of the Pay Equity Act is an important commitment by the Government of Canada to close the gender wage gap and help ensure workers receive equal pay for work of equal value. Regulatory frameworks for pay equity compliance have already started to be applied across many countries globally. Additional regulations are expected, as the concept of pay reporting becomes more widespread and normalized.

The Canadian Pay Equity legislation stipulates that all Canadian employers subject to the Act must post a final pay equity plan by September 3, 2024.

KPMG in Canada‚Äôs team of experienced professionals have the capabilities to help organizations understand their legal and compliance obligations as it relates to Canadian Pay Equity legislation, at both the federal and provincial levels. We can help guide you through the multi-step pay equity process with the help of KPMG‚Äôs proprietary pay equity tool to support your businesses in developing a pay equity strategy that aligns with corporate objectives to support and enable your workforce.

Ensuring your organization is paying women and men equally for doing work of equal value is crucial and allows you to correct systemic gender-based discrimination in compensation. Our KPMG advisors can walk you through a step-by-step plan to ensure you are carrying out the requirements laid out in the federal Pay Equity act.

We are seeking talented and energetic candidates to join our Pay Equity team in 2023.

title: Senior Software Engineer (3D)
description:
Senior Software Engineer (3D)

SeeSpine is a telehealth application combining 3D imaging and artificial intelligence in scoliosis management. From a video taken on any smartphone, SeeSpine recreates a scaled 3D model of the torso, quantifies the deformity, and predicts progression of the disease. By leveraging radiation-free, remote software, SeeSpine allows for more frequent assessment, decreasing the probability of requiring surgery and the incumbent breast cancer risks. SeeSpine offers employees the opportunity to put their talent towards helping millions of children across the globe.

We‚Äôre looking for a software engineer to join our team. As one of the first engineers you have the opportunity to work on the core of our product and take on a great deal of responsibility. You will oversee the development of the software that analyses point clouds to detect scoliosis.

About you

  • 2 to 5+ years of industry experience, and you are comfortable working and thinking in 3D.
  • You are proficient in Python and relevant libraries like NumPy (experience working with point clouds is preferable, but not required). You strive to write elegant and maintainable code and are comfortable picking up new technologies.
  • You have broad knowledge about transport and API protocols like REST.
  • You have a product mindset to understand business needs and develop scalable engineering solutions.
  • You always look for opportunities to simplify, automate tasks, and build reusable components across multiple use cases.
  • You have strong communication skills.
  • You are curious and eager to work across various engineering specialties (i.e., 3D analysis, machine learning, cloud infrastructure).
  • You have an eye for detail and like to spark joy amongst your partners with well-documented high-quality products that are modelled and easy to understand.
  • You are comfortable working in the most agile environments with vague requirements and rapid iterations. You are nimble and take intelligent risks.

What we can offer you

  • A competitive salary.
  • Flexible work week.
  • Work from home as often as you like.
  • The chance to build a product that will benefit millions of children with scoliosis worldwide.

Our culture

You love working independently while also collaborating and giving/receiving candid feedback. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: DATA & ANALYTIC: BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE & REPORTING ASSOCIATE(GRADUATE)
description:
Company Overview

All companies are not the same. What makes TD special as a business is also, what makes us special as an employer. Why TD?

TD‚Äôs Colleague Promise: A better you. A better us.

A more confident you means a stronger us. We empower you to grow your skills, gain new perspectives, and create impact at work and in your community. That‚Äôs our unique and inclusive culture.

Department Overview

Our Associate Programs offer new graduates the opportunity to work in one of TD‚Äôs many lines of business, and the chance to work on challenging projects and assignments, alongside experienced colleagues, and receive coaching and mentorship from business leaders and the Early Talent Experience team, to set you up for success in your career at TD.

Associate Role Profile: 1-year in-depth experience, complemented by programming, coaching, tools and support.

As an Associate, you will also have access to programming, tools and a community of support for your pursuits and interests beyond the 9-5. This includes leadership talks, lunch and learns, self-development workshops, TD sponsored conferences, socials, team challenges, volunteer opportunities, career coaching and more. You will be part of a cohort along with other TD Associates from across Canada! If one of our over 20+ Associate programs is of interest to you, please read on and apply today.

Job Description

The Data & Analytics Associate Program is a 1-year enhanced development opportunity in analytics and data. The Business Intelligence & Reporting Associate will perform a variety of activities, which may include:

  • Develop and understand business drivers, definitions, and metrics to interpret findings, take-action, and provide meaningful business direction
  • Develop and maintain specialized reporting packages and dashboards utilizing data from various systems including localized data-marts on SQL Server, HOST/Mainframe Systems, Enterprise Data Warehouse(s) on DB2, and external data sources utilizing PBD&A reporting tools (i.e., MS SQL BI Stack: [SSDS, SSIS, SSRS, SSAS], Alteryx, Tableau, MS Power BI, Python, etc.)
  • Manage the repository of all reporting assets including and not limited to development scripts and objects, documentation, etc.
  • Adopt, implement, and effectively evolve report automation standards
  • Validate the quality and integrity of the data included in all reporting
  • Lead project and partner discussions to understand business requirements and associated value in support of overall business/function strategy

Requirements

  • Must be graduated between May 2021 and May 2023 with a Graduate degree in Business, Management, and/or Data Analytics or related.
  • At least 2 years of professional experience, which can include work terms during completion of studies.
  • Strong statistical and analytical skills and interest are an asset.
  • Experience with analyzing large data sets, drawing insights and inferences, and communicating outputs.
  • Experience with telling a story through data visualization
  • Strong technical knowledge and experience with one or more of: SQL, SAS, MS SQL BI Stack: [SSDS, SSIS, SSRS, SSAS], Tableau, MS Power BI, Python, PySpark, Alteryx, Bitbucket
  • Technical knowledge or experience with Hadoop, Spark and Cloud is an asset. Must have strong leadership qualities including demonstrating initiative, establishing priorities and using strong communication, analytical and problem-solving skills to add value to each initiative, project or team assigned task..
  • Must have the capability to dive into a business issue, understand the route cause and to help partners to understand how to leverage data to tell a story that will solve for the issue

Additional Information

  • Application Deadline: September 25th, 2022
  • Anticipated Start Date: January 2023 or July 2023 (pending academic completion)
  • Applications must include a transcript, cover letter (one letter-sized page or less) and a resume (maximum of 2 pages).
  • We welcome all applications; however, we will only contact qualified candidates chosen for an interview. Thank you for your interest.
  • TD requires employees to reside in the country where the role is located, irrespective of remote working arrangements
  • TD is committed to providing you with the best candidate experience in these unique circumstances. As such, work location and start dates are subject to change.

Hours

37.5

Start Date

‚Äì Winter

Inclusiveness

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

description:
Company Overview

All companies are not the same. What makes TD special as a business is also, what makes us special as an employer. Why TD?

TD‚Äôs Colleague Promise: A better you. A better us.

A more confident you means a stronger us. We empower you to grow your skills, gain new perspectives, and create impact at work and in your community. That‚Äôs our unique and inclusive culture.

As an Associate, you will also have access to programming, tools and a community of support for your pursuits and interests beyond the 9-5. Our vision to be the Better Bank is grounded in our purpose-driven and forward-focused strategy. Amidst a rapidly changing landscape, we know that technology plays a critical role in achieving this vision and delivering on our strategy. To accomplish this, we‚Äôre evolving our Platforms, introducing key enterprise practices and re-imagining our customer Journeys as part of the Next Evolution of Work (NEW).

NEW will empower colleagues to make decisions faster, work more efficiently and quickly identify and address customer and market trends to deliver innovative solutions at an unprecedented pace. By joining NEW, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to be part of a new way of working while making an impact on the future of banking in ways you‚Äôve never imagined.
Introducing the Data as a Service (DaaS) Platform! This Platform will develop a centralized data strategy and roadmap to enable TD to shift to a data-driven organization and help us extract value from the data we create, collect and consume. The Platform will include applications responsible for the creation and management of data lakes, standards, analytical tools and governance. DaaS will consolidate over ~110 assets and ~200 applications, aggregate our customer data, and bring together data subject matter experts from Practices, such as Data, Software Engineering and Quality Engineering

The Data & Analytics Associate Program is a 1-year enhanced development opportunity in Data & Analytics. The Data Engineer will perform a variety of activities, which may include:

  • Experience from a statistical, mathematical, computer science, financial background or equivalent
  • Experience in data programming languages, patterns and design principles
  • Expertise in using analytical software tools, data analysis methods and reporting techniques
  • Expertise in data storage and movement, including relational and big data
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • In-depth knowledge of competitor and market trends
  • Ability to analyze, organize and prioritize work while meeting multiple deadline
  • Ability to work cooperatively and independently as part of a Scaled Agile pod
  • Effective communication skills (oral and written) with the ability to build positive relationships across teams

title: Senior Power BI & DAX Developer
description:
Group Description

At Magna, we create technology that disrupts the industry and solves big problems for consumers, our customers, and the world around us. We‚Äôre the only mobility technology company and supplier with complete expertise across the entire vehicle.

We are committed to quality and continuous improvement because our products impact millions of people every day. But we‚Äôre more than what we make. We are a group of entrepreneurial-minded people whose collective expertise gives us a competitive advantage. World Class Manufacturing is a journey and it‚Äôs our talented people who lead us on this journey.

Role Summary

The Senior Power BI & DAX Developer will be responsible for interpreting the business needs of stakeholders and for documenting and developing the reporting analytics that meet those needs. This includes the design, development, maintenance, integration and reporting of business systems through cubes, ad-hoc reports, and dashboards.
The selected candidate will work closely and effectively with internal stakeholders and business analysts to provide support and expertise in data management, reporting and underlying infrastructure. This senior position will also need to cover oversight and guidance on deliverables provided by external partners as well a supervising & leading role in the team.

Key Responsibilities

  • Work with the business to define report requirements and translate those requirements into reporting deliverables
  • Design complex business intelligence and analytic solutions based on functional requirements.
  • Translate data results into written reports, tables, graphs and charts
  • Ensure the availability and performance of the solutions and reports
  • Participate in and lead functional and technical specification reviews
  • Research technical solutions to business problems
  • Develop/train on company standards and procedures to support self-service BI
  • Provide training and technical assistance to other team members and users for generation of various types of reporting

Key Qualifications/Requirements

  • Completion of University Degree
  • 3 to 5 Years of Work Related Experience
  • Minimum 3 years experience in the development of Business Intelligence solutions based on Microsoft Tabular models including Power BI visualization and complex DAX expressions
  • Experience in designing and implementing data models both on Tabular and SQL based storage solutions
  • Solid understanding of ETL processes and Data Warehouse concepts
  • Strong SQL coding skills
  • Advanced skills in Microsoft BI stack (including Analysis Services, Paginated Reports and Power Pivot, Azure SQL)
  • Experience with Synapse and Data Flow would be nice to have
  • Self-motivated and self-managed with a high degree of analytical skills (quick comprehension, abstract thinking, recognize relationships)
  • Ability to be a strong team member, and communicate effectively
  • Ability to prioritize and multi-task, and reasonably estimate work effort for tasks
  • Excellent English in spoken and written

Additional Information

Regular travel up to 25% of the time

For dedicated and motivated employees, we offer an interesting and diversified job within a dynamic global team together with the individual and functional development in a professional environment of a global acting business. Fair treatment and a sense of responsibility towards employees are the principle of the Magna culture. We strive to offer an inspiring and motivating work environment.

We offer attractive benefits (e.g. employee profit participation program) and a salary which is in line with market conditions depending on your skills and experience.

Awareness. Unity. Empowerment.

At Magna, we believe that a diverse workforce is critical to our success. That‚Äôs why we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We hire on the basis of experience and qualifications, and in consideration of job requirements, regardless of, in particular, color, ancestry, religion, gender, origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or gender identity. Magna takes the privacy of your personal information seriously. We discourage you from sending applications via email to comply with GDPR requirements and your local Data Privacy Law.

title: Senior (Data Management)
description:
Senior (Data Management)

Location: Toronto
Other locations: Primary Location Only
Date: Oct 3, 2022

At EY, you‚Äôll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we‚Äôre counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

At EY, you‚Äôll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we‚Äôre counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

The opportunity


Joining EY‚Äôs DnA team in this exciting period of growth will offer a huge variety of opportunity to make a tangible impact to our clients businesses and to your career. We provide constant room for growth through client engagements and personal development. Our practitioners develop and lead innovative data techniques and methods, supporting both business and technology leaders. This role provides the unique opportunity to build a professional network, tackle complex data issues, and drive cutting edge approaches across industry leading clients and domains. The experiences you gain here will be more valuable than anywhere else.

We are currently seeking management consultants with experience in the various data management related capabilities - including data governance, data operating model, data strategy, etc.- to lead and implement leading-edge data management and strategy projects.

Your Key Responsibilities

  • Help our clients establish Data Management and Governance programs and drive data ownership into the client businesses
  • Perform Data Management and Governance reviews, Data Maturity assessments
  • Assist with implementation of the Data Management and Governance programs within the client organization
  • Conduct current state assessments, evaluate assessment results, and present findings in a logical and easy-to-understand manner
  • Assist with data architecture reviews and advise on data solutions that pertain to Data Governance programs (Data Catalogue, Data Quality, Business Glossary, data tools/software, metadata management, master data management, Lineage)

To qualify for the role, you must have

  • 2+ years of experience in and understanding of concepts and frameworks pertaining to Data Management- Data Governance, Data Policy, Data Lineage, Data Models, Data Quality, Data Risk and Control Frameworks, Data Literacy, Reference Data Management, Metadata Management
  • Experience working within Financial Services Industry in a data management related role
  • Experience within data management and governance. Possess knowledge of frameworks, standards and regulatory requirements related to Data Governance, Data Management - BCBS239, CCAR, etc.
  • Worked with or have an understating of EDM Council DCAM assessment or an alternative data maturity assessment; be certified in EDM Council DCAM Assessment
  • Experience with data management tools such as Collibra, Informatica, Ataccama, etc.
  • Advanced problem-solving skills, superior communication (verbal and written)
  • Experience working independently, efficiently, and effectively under tight timelines and delivering results by critical deadlines.
  • Experience with client-facing activities requirements gathering, presentation creation, and ability to prepare client ready deliverables
  • Experience of Agile and traditional SDLC delivery methodologies Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

Ideally, you‚Äôll also have

  • Prior consulting experience preferred
  • Project management and process development expertise in client serving rolesStrong organizational and time-management skills

Skills and attributes for success

  • Be self-motivated and passionate about data management and governance
  • Ability to meet deadlines and manage project delivery
  • Superior communication and interpersonal skills

What we offer

At EY, our Total Rewards package supports our commitment to creating a leading people culture - built on high-performance teaming - where everyone can achieve their potential and contribute to building a better working world for our people, our clients and our communities. It's one of the many reasons we repeatedly win awards for being a great place to work.

We offer a competitive compensation package where you‚Äôll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package allows you decide which benefits are right for you and which ones help you create a solid foundation for your future. Our Total Rewards package includes a comprehensive medical, prescription drug and dental coverage, a defined contribution pension plan, a great vacation policy plus firm paid days that allow you to enjoy longer long weekends throughout the year, statutory holidays and paid personal days (based on province of residence), and a range of exciting programs and benefits designed to support your physical, financial and social well-being. Plus, we offer:

  • Support and coaching from some of the most engaging colleagues in the industry
  • Learning opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
  • The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that‚Äôs right for you

Diversity and Inclusion at EY

Diversity and inclusiveness are at the heart of who we are and how we work. We‚Äôre committed to fostering an environment where differences are valued, policies and practices are equitable, and our people feel a sense of belonging. From our actions to combat systemic racism and our advocacy for the LGBT+ community to our innovative Neurodiversity Centre of Excellence and Accessibility initiatives, we welcome and embrace the diverse experiences, abilities, backgrounds and perspectives that make our people unique and help guide us. Because when people feel free to be their authentic selves at work, they bring their best and are empowered to build a better working world.

EY Way of Work and your health and safety

EY Way of Work recognizes flexibility in the way we collaborate, innovate and deliver with the ability to work in-person and remotely. To support a healthy and safe in-person working environment, EY has implemented various layers of health and safety controls while working in the office or at client or other locations. A critical component of EY‚Äôs workplace safety program includes our COVID-19 vaccination policy which requires all personnel to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 unless an accommodation based on a reason protected by human rights legislation is provided.

EY | Building a better working world

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

title: Sr. Data Engineer
description:
We‚Äôre building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what‚Äôs right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

You‚Äôll be joining CIBC‚Äôs Private Wealth Management (PWM) Technology group within Wealth Management and will be an integral part of CIBC‚Äôs technology transformation. As the Senior Consultant, Application Development, you will be reporting to a Director. Working closely to act as the technical subject matter expert with oversight and accountability for Business Analysis, Development and QA for the Data Analytics & Reporting applications and services supporting the Private Wealth Management business group. With a strong focus on technology strategy, delivery approaches and business acumen, you‚Äôll be providing subject matter expertise to Azure Cloud Engineering initiatives as they relate to the design, implementation and support of major public cloud technologies and automation tooling in a multi-platform environment. Deliver transformational changes at an Organizational level through processes and workflows. delivering technology changes and supporting requirements that align with both the Private Wealth Management line of business and the Wealth Management Technology (WMT) mandates.

How You‚Äôll Succeed

  • Leadership & Communication ‚Äì Collaborate with senior leaders across the company and make informed recommendations to enhance cloud related solutions. Weigh business needs against technology offerings, security concerns and provide recommendations to improve the user experience, which are practical and achievable.

  • Governance ‚Äì Proactively contribute to governance initiatives in the development of company policies, audit requirements etc. Provide technical or business guidance to clients within and outside your own department.

  • Engineering / Development ‚Äì Lead evaluation, selection and implementation of new and emerging products and techniques; support the development of business/technology proposals by evaluating implementation options. Provide automation expertise within core automation DevOPS tool chain and orchestration expertise in Public cloud, preferably with experience in Azure DevOps, Autosys and all aspects of Azure Network configuration through code, and familiarity with tools such as Git, JIRA, Confluence. Your understanding of Microsoft\'s Azure, Azure ARM Templating, Azure DevOps Pipeline implementation and other analytics and reporting components of Azure will be key to your success.

  • People Leadership ‚Äì Lead and coach a team of Business Systems Analysts, Application Developers, and Application Support Specialists building on existing individual capabilities and bringing new talent into the team to meet business and technology objectives. Develop your team, maximizing their contributions, encourage out of the box thinking and professional growth. Create a positive work environment through being an effective role model and by championing CIBC‚Äôs mission, vision and values, ensuring compliance with policies, standards, guidelines and controls, applying policies fairly and consistently so employees understand what to expect. Manage performance by providing fair and accurate formal and informal feedback, identifying and removing obstacles to performance and by explaining how performance expectations align with business priorities.

  • Relationship Management ‚Äì Work closely with clients and business partners to develop, test, plan and implement application enhancements. Become familiar for all CIBC enterprise development practices, standards and governance controls for other CIBC groups and technology vendors. Advise on emerging technical trends in the industry and at CIBC, and ensure application services best practices reflect appropriate technological developments for a competitive business position. Collaborate and support the other PWM Technology teams in the delivery of technology modernization that address the strategic and operational business partner agenda and the CIBC technology strategy. Analyze technical risk to support business recommendations and make adjustments to internal operations as necessary to improve performance of the Application Delivery and support teams.

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience with: 5+ years\' experience as a Data engineer, preferably in Azure Databricks.

  • You are a skilled Data Engineer to lead the development of our new data analytics platform.

  • Able to write clean/scalable/secure code and need a good understanding of Azure and Databricks. We work heavily in Azure and need this person to have a good grasp of modern Azure Tools like Databricks and DataFactory to build orchestration pipelines.You have led the creation of a data strategy and associated roadmap and led execution across multiple technologies and projects.

  • Experience in most of the following: Writing clean/scalable code and working with Databricks, Using Azure Data Factory to build orchestration pipelines, Working with Azure DevOps and CI/CD pipelines, Pyspark, Python, SQL, Power BI, Data Lake.

  • You will utilize your breadth of knowledge to identify opportunities to optimize, modernize, retire or consolidate a large number of applications spanning numerous technologies.

  • You are a seasoned people leader with the ability to coach and help develop other team members.

  • You have a solid understanding of: Managing vendor applications, roadmaps, testing, and implementation. Designing and implementing applications for cloud. Strong knowledge of Agile methodology and experience working in a Scrum team.

  • It‚Äôs an Asset if: You have good understanding of the Wealth Management business and have worked in a capacity supporting the business.

  • You have a degree/diploma in: Computer Science, Engineering, and/or a related field.

  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.

  • You embrace and champion change: You‚Äôll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best. You empower and enable your team to make continuous improvement, go above and beyond, and deliver results.

  • You\'re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of a team that enjoys working together to create a shared vision.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit.

Job Location

Toronto-81 Bay, 12th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

Analytical Reports, Analytics Strategy, Cloud Applications, Cloud DevOps, Cloud Platform, Data Engineering, Data Strategies, Functional Designs, Microsoft Cloud, Technical Subject Matter, Technology Roadmap, Technology Transformation

title: Machine Learning Researcher - Causality
description:
What\'s the opportunity?

As a Researcher in machine learning and causal inference, you‚Äôre looking to channel your love of playing with real-world data into industry-disrupting solutions. We‚Äôre a lab that supports research on a wide variety of theoretical and applied machine learning projects. Working in our lab will grant you unique access to massive structured and unstructured datasets with the tools and resources necessary to build game-changing statistical models.

Being part of our team means you‚Äôll also have the opportunity to publish original research in peer-reviewed academic journals and participate in conferences around the world, such as NeurIPS, ICLR, ICML, CVPR and more.

Your responsibilities include:

  • Developing novel AI solutions that facilitate impactful products;
  • Conducting original, publishable research by advancing the state-of-the-art in machine learning and causal inference;
  • Working with the development team to transfer research work into production;
  • Interpreting larger organizational needs and designing algorithmic solutions that can drive the next generation of banking experiences;
  • Identifying relevant new AI technologies as they become available, and disseminating them into the bank‚Äôs technology capabilities.

You‚Äôre our ideal candidate if you have:

  • Experience in researching or applying causal inference;
  • A passion for solving open problems using data and algorithms;
  • A PhD in a sub-area of AI or demonstrated research track record by means of publications and/or sophisticated AI product experience;
  • Ability to formulate and drive a research project independently without close supervision;
  • Proficiency in Python and Deep Learning packages such as Tensorflow or PyTorch.

What‚Äôs in it for you?

  • Become part of a team that thinks progressively and works collaboratively. We care about seeing each other reach full potential;
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock options where applicable;
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities;
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact from a local-to-global scale.

About Borealis AI

Borealis AI, a RBC Institute for Research, is a curiosity-driven research centre dedicated to achieving state-of-the-art in machine learning. Established in 2016, and with labs in Toronto, Montreal, Waterloo and Vancouver, we support academic collaborations and partner with world-class research centres in artificial intelligence. With a focus on ethical AI that will help communities thrive, our machine learning scientists perform fundamental and applied research in areas such as reinforcement learning, natural language processing, deep learning, and unsupervised learning to solve ground-breaking problems in diverse fields.

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

RBC is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status, Aboriginal/Native American status or any other legally-protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the application process are available upon request.

title: Data Scientist
description:
Are you looking to join a dynamic pension plan that embodies the strong values of its 500,000 members and is an industry leading global investor? If so, we would love to tell you our story.

At OMERS we put our people first and are proud to embrace the diversity of thought and leadership that comes from having locations in Toronto, London, New York, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe. Our culture is truly one of a kind. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it! We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live with an ever-constant eye to the global investment markets.

The Data Scientist will join the dynamic Enterprise Data & Advanced Analytics team within Data & Technology that applies data, analytics and AI to develop scalable business-first solutions for sustainable growth at OMERS. The Data Scientist will work alongside analytics specialists on their team and partner with data and analytics specialists within businesses and corporate functions to design, develop, implement and scale advanced solutions following best practices to drive measurable business outcomes.



Reporting to the Director of Enterprise Data Science, you will work closely with our Businesses, Corporate Functions, Enterprise Architecture, Business Relationship Management, Infrastructure and Enterprise Service Management, Cyber, Data Engineering, Data Governance and Analytics Strategy teams to deploy new capabilities following leading product management and AI system methodologies. You will develop and nurture strong relationships with partners in a variety of different business units across our global portfolio, building an understanding of their needs and how to apply data, analytics and AI techniques to increase scale and operational efficiency, enhance self-service capabilities and elevate the understanding & application of these capabilities across the company.



The Data Scientist will partner with internal stakeholders and external partners to build out AI systems and deliver data analytics projects within set timelines. They meet objectives and focus on priorities which drive the successful operation of this Department and ensures alignment with OMERS business and technology strategy.

As a member of this team, you will be responsible for:

  • Fostering strong relationships among cross-functional teams and facilitating decision making within multi-level audiences. Applying a system thinking approach to lead execution of data, analytics and AI initiatives quickly and in collaboration with other teams
  • Driving the implementation of corporate/strategic objectives via AI/ML driven projects and seeing opportunities
  • Building ML projects from experiments and hands-on solutioning through to production
  • Implementing model tracking, updating, and auto-train capabilities in addition to accounting for drift and imbalance
  • Building and maintaining NLP models using state of the art techniques like transformers and seq2seq for the purposes of classification, sentiment analysis, entity extraction, and more
  • Driving analytics innovation by posing open ended questions, exploring new ideas, recommending the appropriate techniques to solve challenging business problems and rapid prototyping
  • Developing, deploying, and operationalizing data science products along with the supporting integrated tools and processes, including but not limited to security, performance, scalability, and extendibility
  • Hands on creation and oversight of analytical models, conducting model training, validation, testing, integrated reconciliations and ongoing data and model integrity maintenance
  • Remaining on the ‚Äúleading edge‚Äù of emerging data, analytics and AI technologies and techniques to identify and implement novel tools and techniques and their application to new use cases and deployment opportunities
  • Driving a culture of innovation and AI by taking initiatives for activities such as lunch and learns, hackathons, paper readouts, etc.

To succeed in this role, you have:

  • A undergraduate or graduate degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics or any other quantitative field
  • Minimum five (5) years‚Äô experience working in a data science/ Machine Learning environment
  • 1-3+ years of experience leading and delivering enterprise-scale data science/ML projects and facilitating collaboration across teams
  • A proven grasp of the practical and theoretical aspects of statistical and deep learning such as data structures, algorithms, gradient descent, probability theory, linear algebra, calculus, hypothesis testing, and more
  • Experience building scalable and automated ML pipelines with strong Python programming skills
  • Natural language computing/understanding experience including but not limited to source data extraction, structuring, named entity extraction, sentiment analysis, topic modelling, and more
  • Experience with framework such as TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, MxNet and the sci-kit learn library
  • Proficiency with git is a must
  • Experience implementing pre-built models at scale along with retraining and implementing a custom deep-learning architecture is a strong plus
  • Experience working in the financial sector- ideally banks or investment firms, is an asset
  • Experience within Pensions, Investments and Commercial Real Estate sectors are an asset
  • Hands-on experience with big data systems such as Spark, Hadoop, Hive and ideally cloud technologies such as Azure Data Factory, AzureML, Azure Synapse, Google Fusion, Google BigQuery, AWS SageMaker, and others
  • Experience in using external/alternative data, data modeling, data architecture, data engineering, insight generation, data visualization, feature engineering and AI systems development & optimization
  • A passion around learning new technologies and analytical techniques with a track record of acting on this in prior roles and in their free time through projects, partnerships, mentoring and hackathons
  • Demonstrated experience as a leader in creatively addressing unique or ambiguous situations and motivating teams and delivering multiple projects simultaneously serving multiple stakeholders
  • The ability to build relationships and facilitate across a diverse group of stakeholders in several different business units
  • Demonstrated experience applying product management, design thinking and human centered design
  • Polished written and verbal communication and presentation skills targeted at all levels of the organization

Our story:

Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada‚Äôs largest defined benefit pension plans, with $121 billion in net assets as at December 31, 2021. OMERS is a jointly-sponsored pension plan, with 1,000 participating employers ranging from large cities to local agencies, and over half a million active, deferred and retired members. OMERS members include union and non-union employees of municipalities, school boards, local boards, transit systems, electrical utilities, emergency services and children‚Äôs aid societies across Ontario. Contributions to the Plan are funded equally by members and employers. OMERS teams work in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe ‚Äì serving members and employers and originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate.

OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives.

Vaccination Policy

At OMERS and Oxford the office or worksite is our primary place of work. We are committed to providing work environments which promote the health, safety and well-being of all employees in accordance with public health regulation and guidance. Accordingly, employees are required to provide evidence of full vaccination or have an approved exemption.

title: Director of AI
description:
The Role:

To facilitate the continued growth and innovation of Reticle, we‚Äôre seeking a Director of AI. This role requires an experienced and analytical individual to produce and implement innovative modelling techniques that incorporate a variety of features ‚Äì including text, entities, images, etc. ‚Äì to inform and enhance the classification outcomes of our model. The ideal candidate will have prior experience in advertising technology, a team-first attitude, and a passion for building compelling data products.

Why You Will Love This Opportunity:

  • This role combines science leadership, organizational ability, technical strength, product focus, and business understanding.
  • Autonomy to spearhead the development, implementation and innovation of an emerging data product using cutting edge technologies.
  • Supportive and growing team that ensures projects are well-resourced, timelines are attainable, work-life is balanced, and that our business units are organized and aligned.
  • Nobody else is doing what we‚Äôre doing effectively. We have a number of partnerships that will ensure our work is utilized by the largest brands and agencies in the world.

Key Job Responsibilities

  • Design, experiment and evaluate highly innovative models.
  • Rapidly design, prototype and test many possible hypotheses in a high-ambiguity environment, making use of both quantitative data and business judgment.
  • Analyze and extract relevant information from large amounts of both structured and unstructured data including images and texts to help automate and optimize key processes.
  • Building and scaling big-data machine learning model pipelines.
  • Work closely with software engineering teams to drive real-time model experiments, implementations and new feature creations.
  • Establish scalable, efficient, automated processes for large scale data analyses, model development, model validation and model implementation
  • Develop and manage a research agenda that includes defining and conducting experiments and developing prototypes, as well as establishing longer term roadmaps that allow us to deliver production solutions.
  • Advance the team's overall product vision and direction, while driving continued scientific innovation as a thought leader and practitioner.
  • Learning and up-skilling new knowledge on Machine learning and educating others
  • Maintain accountability and strong sense of ownership
  • Perform hands-on data analysis, build ML models, run regular A/B tests, conduct profiling, tune code, and communicate the learning and impact through senior executive levels.
  • Collaborate with business, product and tech teams.
  • Stay up to date with recent scientific publications relevant to the team.

Basic Qualifications

  • PhD or Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative discipline such as Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, Economics, Quantitative Social Science, or Computer Science
  • 5+ years of experience working as a data scientist or a similar role involving data extraction, analysis, statistical modelling, and communication
  • 5+ years of experience using data querying languages (e.g. SQL), scripting languages (e.g. Python), or statistical/mathematical software (e.g. R, SAS, Matlab, etc.)
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills, with the ability to communicate complex technical concepts and solutions to all levels of the organization.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Advanced expertise in Python,SQL, Stata, R and/or Scala.
  • Experience with deep learning‚Äìbased NLP models such as BERT, OpenAI, ELMo and more
  • Deep learning architecture skills including CNNs, LSTMs, Transformers
  • Experienced in deep learning frameworks like Tensorflow, PyTorch
  • Experience finding practical solutions for ambiguous and challenging business questions
  • Superior verbal and written communication skills, ability to convey rigorous mathematical concepts and considerations to non-experts
  • Experience directly managing scientists and/or machine learning engineers.
  • Experience with Big Data technologies such as AWS, Hadoop, Spark, Hive, Lucene/SOLR, or Kafka
  • Skilled in developing and querying knowledge graph like WikiData
  • Experience in building and leading small-medium research teams.
  • Launched research-inspired products/features that impacted real users.
  • Strong experience working effectively with science, data processing, and software engineering teams
  • Entrepreneurial spirit combined with strong architectural and problem solving skills
  • Demonstrated track record of project delivery for large, cross-functional projects with evolving requirements

Perks:

  • Remote/Hybrid role
  • Benefits and wellness package
  • 3 weeks vacation
  • Paid cell phone
  • Fridays off before long weekends

title: Data Scientist (Intern/Co-op), Lighthouse Canada
description:
Overview

At KPMG, you‚Äôll join a team of diverse and dedicated problem solvers, connected by a common cause: turning insight into opportunity for clients and communities around the world.

Do work that matters, supported by a community that values difference and cares about you. Gain learning that‚Äôll last you a lifetime and be recognized for the impact you make. With a focus on encouraging employees to come as they are, KPMG provides its employees with a variety of unique tools and support systems that ensure they thrive and make their mark in their career and in their communities.

Why KPMG Lighthouse?

KPMG Canada‚Äôs Center of Excellence for Data & Analytics + Intelligent Automation applies exponential thinking and emerging technologies to solve today‚Äôs challenges. Join a diverse team that is always curious and learning, thinking independently and working collaboratively, has a passion to solve difficult problems and has fun doing it.

  • Our teams apply exponential thinking and emerging technologies to solve today‚Äôs challenges
  • We are comprised of a global network of over 12,500 experts including data scientists and engineers
  • Our teams build and deliver solutions that transform the business of our clients
  • Our regional hubs are in strategic markets and provide specialty services to local teams

KPMG Lighthouse Canada has an exciting opportunity for Data Scientists (Intern/Co-op) to join our team for 4-8 months starting in May 2023!

** Please note that you must be enrolled in a Canadian post-secondary educational institution to be eligible for this opportunity.


What you will do

  • Work with a group of data scientists, data engineers to solve interesting and challenging business problems using advanced data analytics, AI and ML solutions.
  • Utilize advanced analytical techniques to solve challenging business problems. Leverage a diverse set of technologies and tools to deliver insights.
  • Propose and develop results, models and rules engines using statistics, machine learning, Natural Language Processing, Linear Programming, etc.
  • Work with large volumes of data (structured and unstructured).
  • Perform quantitative analysis of data issues.
  • Work in teams or individuals to performance ETL/ELT (extract, transform and load) of data from a variety of databases, from SQL, NoSQL, Hadoop, Neo4j, etc.
  • Experience with large scale and or distributed processing methodologies such as Storm, Spark and many others.
  • Review data quality and definitions, and perform data cleansing and data management tasks.
  • Work with the engagement team to translate business and analytics requirements into a data strategy for the engagement including ETL, data model and staging data for analysis
  • Run queries for descriptive analytics and provide formatted result sets.
  • Proactively contribute to the creation of presentation materials relating to data activities for stakeholder discussions.
  • Support application testing and production implementation as required.
  • Bridge the gap between technical platform needs and business issues.


What you bring to the role

  • Strong experience in analytics, statistics, data mining, machine learning, natural language processing and/or mathematics.
  • Problem solving ability through the use and/or development of algorithms, models, testing, etc.
  • Effectively communicate orally and written with peers within Data & Analytics teams, KPMG and the client.
  • Experience working in teams to perform ETL/ELT (extract, transform and load) of data from a variety of databases from SQL, NoSQL, Hadoop, Neo4j, etc.
  • Independent ability to review the data quality and data definitions, and perform data cleansing and data management tasks
  • Experience working in a multi-disciplinary team to tackle structured or unstructured data processing problems across a diverse range of industries
  • Strong ability to use Python and other packages such as Pandas and NumPy for data analysis and cleansing tasks
  • Some experience with visualization tools (Tableau, PowerBI, QlikView, etc.)
  • Basic understanding of Data Warehousing and Data Modeling.
  • Experience or knowledge in one major cloud service: AWS, MS Azure and GCP.

Keys to your success:

  • Ability to explain data and analytics concepts to non-technical team members.
  • Ability to apply data and analytics concepts to business problems.
  • Ability to understand and explain business value of data and analytics concepts.
  • Knowledge of machine learning to collaborate with the team on ML projects
  • Experience in visual exploration to perform data discovery and highlight insights
  • Knowledge of how specific visual components drive usability and understanding
  • A knack at telling a story with purpose. Strong facilitation and collaboration abilities to conduct discussions and workshop with engineers and business analyst to advocate for positive user experience and recommend potential solutions to identified problems

title: Risk Consultant (Full Time, New Grad), Forensic Data Analytics
description:
Overview

At KPMG, you‚Äôll join a team of diverse and dedicated problem solvers, connected by a common cause: turning insight into opportunity for clients and communities around the world.

Do work that matters, supported by a community that values difference and cares about you. Gain learning that‚Äôll last you a lifetime and be recognized for the impact you make. With a focus on encouraging employees to come as they are, KPMG provides its employees with a variety of unique tools and support systems that ensure they thrive and make their mark in their career and in their communities

About KPMG Forensic:

Using cutting-edge technology and methodologies, KPMG Forensic professionals help clients to manage the risks of money laundering, sanctions, fraud, misconduct, and regulatory non-compliance; maintain organizational integrity; manage reputational risk; address and simplify issues related to litigation (including avoidance); and limit financial exposure to loss. We help uncover the facts and support in creating clarity when people and organizations do not agree, or where financial and business behavior does not comply with expectations. Our professionals can offer support to help our clients investigate allegations of litigation support, financial crime, fraud and misconduct, enhance their financial crime programs, provide analytical services, and help meet regulatory requirements.

KPMG Forensic is a core part of KPMG‚Äôs Risk Consulting practice, which helps clients to improve risk intelligence and decision making, protect financial and reputational assets, and enhance business value through a range of trusted, digitally powered, and forward-thinking solutions for navigating business risks.

KPMG's Forensic Data Analytics team has an exciting opportunity for new grads to join our team full time in 2023.


What you will do

With KPMG Forensic, in this highly specialized group you will have a unique opportunity to be exposed to a fast-paced specialization that will allow you to combine your deep analytical and mathematical knowledge with forensic and investigative skills and leverage data analytic tools and techniques. The variety of assignments will provide you with the opportunity to gain exposure to many interesting and challenging situations. As KPMG is committed to capability development and continuous learning, this role provides an exceptional opportunity for both formal and hands-on training.

You will assist in financial crime analytics, investigations, quantification of damages, fraud risk management, litigation support, data analytics support, insurance claims quantification, regulatory compliance, and similar assignments in both the public and private sector, with a focus on learning the required skills and knowledge to progress in this dynamic and growing specialization.

This role includes but is not limited to:

  • Assist clients such as financial institutions, FinTechs, and Cryptocurrency organizations to build, optimize, transform, validate, and enhance their financial crimes technology solutions
  • Help clients adapt existing technology to meet changing operational requirements with Anti-Money Laundering (AML) and Fraud detection compliance systems
  • Performance of and assistance in project tasks, including for example: financial analysis, document review, interviews, leveraging data analytics tools and techniques, report and internal working paper preparation, and file organization and administration,
  • Assisting in client/engagement acceptance
  • Assisting with the development of engagement and project plans
  • Performance of and assistance in project tasks, including for example: financial analysis, document review, interviews, leveraging data analytics tools and techniques, report and internal working paper preparation, and file organization and administration,
  • Participating in marketing and business development activities,
  • Sharing in the administrative tasks related to the operation of KPMG Forensic

To learn more about the service line, please click here: KPMG Forensic Services.


What you bring to the role

You‚Äôre a highly motivated student who strives for excellence, innovation and collaboration. You‚Äôre passionate about being involved in your local community and university and have a proven ability to achieve personal and professional success while juggling competing priorities and deadlines. You have a strong academic record and are committed to achieving your learning advanced analytical techniques.

Keys to your success:

  • Recently completed a bachelor's degree from an accredited college/university in a technology or quantitative oriented field such as Computer Science, Engineering, Math, Statistics, Data Analytics, Applied Intelligence or Finance
  • Strong relationship-building skills that will enable you to easily interact with clients, colleagues, and the wider community.
  • A commitment to continual learning ‚Äì developing new skills, taking on new responsibilities and broadening your knowledge through research.
  • The ability to provide crucial consultation and analysis for the variety of clients you will serve.
  • Excellent written communication skills; able to demonstrate a strong business acumen, as well as an innovation-driven and a solution-oriented mindset.
  • Beneficial software/programming languages include but are not limited to Databases (SQL Server, Oracle, Teradata, MongoDB, Spark), Modelling & Analytics (Python, R, SAS, SPSS), Business Intelligence (Tableau, SpotFire, Alteryx, QlikView), Microsoft Access, and Visual Basic

title: Velocity - Treasury Internship/Co-op - Summer 2023
description:
Requisition ID: 169656

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Term: May - August 2023

Application Deadline: 01/23/2023

There's no better way to kickstart your career than to do a co-op or internship with Scotiabank! During your work term, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to be part of a winning team, build your network, and discover what you love ‚Äì all while getting paid to do it! There‚Äôs a place for every type of student at Scotiabank and all that we ask for is that you have passion and strong AOO (Attitude, Ownership and Opportunity).

The Velocity Program is not your average internship or co-op! This is a customized experience that focuses on providing you with the development and tools you need to grow your career. After successfully completing a co-op or internship with top performance, we will work with you to establish your future placements. As a result, you will get to learn, grow, and experiment within different areas of both Scotiabank and Tangerine!

Is this role right for you? In this role, you will:

  • Conduct reviews to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements.
  • Assist with reviewing and enforcing policies and procedures.
  • Provide support to various teams within Group Treasury.
  • Attend meetings with key stakeholders and leadership.
  • Undertake projects as required.
  • Review files for forecasting to ensure consistency.
  • Prepare data and work with data analytics.

Do you have the skills and requirements that will enable you to succeed in this role? ‚Äì We‚Äôd love to work with you if:

  • You are currently enrolled in post-secondary education.
  • You love to learn and envision yourself working for an international organization that heavily invests in your future.
  • You enjoy being involved in extracurricular activities such as conferences, clubs, and competitions.
  • You are a highly self-motivated individual with strong time-management skills.
  • You have an analytical mindset and investigative abilities.
  • You can lead high volume, time sensitive projects.
  • You have strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • You are proficient in Microsoft Office ‚Äì particularly Excel, Word, and PowerPoint.
  • Understanding of Capital Markets products is considered an asset.
  • Understanding of PowerBI, VBA, SAS, SQL or Tableau is considered an asset.
  • Ability to code in Python is also considered an asset.

What‚Äôs in it for you?

  • You‚Äôll be part of a diverse, collaborative, innovative, and high-performing team.
  • In-depth training to prepare you for the role, as well as ongoing coaching and feedback to help you succeed!
  • Exclusive student events such as Scotia Student Day, Lunch & Learns, leadership panels, and much more!
  • Bank-wide orientation to learn more about Scotiabank and gain exposure to senior leadership across the organization.

How do I apply?

For students applying to our internship/co-op or new graduate programs, we do not require resumes! We believe in evaluating you through relationships‚ÄØover resumes and are focused on learning about who you are and what you‚Äôre interested in to uncover your true potential.‚ÄØInstead,‚ÄØwe ask that as part of your application you complete the below:

  1. Complete your PLUM Profile here and save as a screenshot.
  1. Complete a short one-way video interview here.
  1. Apply to the role and when the application asks for your resume, instead upload the screenshot of your PLUM Profile.

*To be considered for student opportunities at Scotiabank, Tangerine, and MD Financial you must complete all steps above.

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

title: Data Scientist
description:
Company Overview

Tell us your story. Don‚Äôt go unnoticed. Explain why you‚Äôre a winning candidate. Think ‚ÄúTD‚Äù if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.

Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here‚Äôs our story: jobs.td.com

Department Overview

What does TD stand for? For starters, we believe in visionary leadership and insights. We believe in using every resource at our disposal to better serve our clients, and for almost every department, that begins with data.

As part of our Data and Analytics team, you‚Äôll be a fundamental part of crafting business processes enterprise-wide by analyzing vast amounts of past and present data.

TD‚Äôs vision for the future? Tailored, customized banking products, services and experiences for every single customer. If you‚Äôve been in business as long as we have, you know there‚Äôs no such thing as one size fits all, and a diverse, inclusive Data Analytics team is a massive part of that future achievement.

Job Description

Delivery

  • Broad technical skills in all facets of data science: advanced analytics, statistical modelling, machine learning & data engineering
  • Build complex statistical models that learn from and scale to petabytes of data.
  • Parse vast data, identify needs and analytics trends, employs industry leading techniques and theories to improve business practices across the enterprise
  • Provide insight into leading analytic practices, designs and leads iterative learning and development cycles, and ultimately produce new and creative analytic solutions that will become core deliverables
  • Accountable to lead & deliver complex, Agile, cross-functional projects that range widely in design, size, scale, scope and techniques
  • Self-directed with the ability to progress strategic opportunities in down times and effectively prioritize in busy times

Expertise & Leadership

  • Analytical thought leadership and stay current on developments in data mining and the application of data science
  • Serve as an authority on a given business domain and provide business expertise to place context around analytics discovery
  • A champion in the D&A community for TD‚Äôs platforms and strategies, scanning for cutting edge solutions, and proactively identifying opportunities to advance tools, techniques and approaches
  • Communication and Stakeholder Management
  • Work closely with stakeholders to identify opportunities, implement solutions, and serve as an ambassador for data science across the enterprise
  • Advanced communication, business acumen and stakeholder management competencies
  • Collaborate with support functions such as risk, technology, model validation, OCDO etc. to increase the velocity of data science by enhancing policies, protocols & procedures within TD‚Äôs risk appetite
  • Exceptional collaborator in a high-interaction environment
  • Foresee needs from business partners to prescribe effective solutions
  • Leverage empirical evidence and facts to influence/support decision making
  • Collaborate with business partners to inform analytics output, support strategic planning, and prioritize key initiatives
  • Take ownership of team targets and strategies such as value generation and contribute to the overall management and culture of the team

Requirements

What can you bring to TD? Tell us about your most relevant experience, credentials and knowledge for this role, as well as these essential requirements and attributes:

  • Ability to translate business requirements into technical and analytical tasks
  • Demonstrated track record of leading major data science projects [or demonstrate ability]
  • Technical understanding and critical thinking to challenge status quo
  • Strong problem-solving skills, mathematical and data literacy
  • Flexibility to adapt and run with contending priorities and the ability to shift focus as dynamic business needs evolve
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal ability to tell a compelling story which can be consumed by business partners/executives
  • Demonstrated experience in data transformation and data manipulation.
  • Aspirations to build in-depth industry and retail banking knowledge including current trends in data, analytics and technology
  • Master‚Äôs degree or PhD in relevant fields; Mathematics, Physics, Biotech, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Geomatics
  • Expert proficiency with industry data tools; python/Ruby, R, SQL and Scala, cloud architecture
  • Strong understanding of data manipulation and visualization techniques, with preference to Esri ‚Äì ArcGIS, Alteryx, SQL and Excel
  • Experience with big data tools, such as SCALA, SPARK, HADOOP, HDFS, HIVE, etc.
  • Experience with machine learning including supervised and unsupervised models.

Additional Information

#datascientist #LI-Hybrid

Locations:
Toronto
Montreal
Markham
London
Ottawa

* L7- L10

Hours

37.5

We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. title: Velocity - Global Risk Management Intern, Summer 2023 (for Students Graduating Prior to Summer 2024)
description:
Requisition ID: 169721

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Term: May-August 2023

Application Deadline: 01/23/2023

There's no better way to kickstart your career than to do a co-op or internship followed by a new graduate program with Scotiabank! During your work term, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to be part of a winning team, build your network, and discover what you love ‚Äì all while getting paid to do it! There‚Äôs a place for every type of student at Scotiabank and all that we ask for is that you have passion and strong AOO (Attitude, Ownership and Opportunity). Once you have completed your Velocity co-op term with strong performance, we would like to invite you back after graduation to join the Activate New Graduate Development Program where you will be able to further grow your career within Global Risk Management!

  • The Velocity Program is not your average internship or co-op! This is a customized experience that focuses on providing you with the development and tools you need to grow your career. You‚Äôll be part of a diverse, collaborative, innovative, and high-performing team. You will receive in-depth training to prepare you for the role, as well as ongoing coaching and feedback to help you succeed! As a Velocity student you have access to exclusive events such as Velocity Day, Community Day, Lunch & Learns, leadership panels, and much more!

  • The Activate New Graduate Development Program will provide you with experiences that build a foundation for you to become a future leader, accelerating your career journey from day one. As an Associate in the Activate, GRM stream you will spend 18-months rotating to pre-determined areas that will challenge you. You‚Äôll gain a well-rounded view of the entire organization, while gaining practical experience, focused on high-impact projects within your business line.

What is Global Risk Management?

Our Global Risk Management teams are highly diverse groups, with a variety of streams that filter into various Risk areas. These different streams include Market Risk, Business Banking Credit Risk, Enterprise Risk, Financial Crimes Risk Management (AML), and Retail Risk, where there are significant opportunities to gain a breadth of exposure within your focus area. Successful candidates will bring strong technical skills relevant to their chosen area, in addition to excellent communication and time management skills. Some roles like Enterprise Risk, for example, will carry a higher focus on risk modelling and analytics, while others like Market Risk will be tied to capital markets activities. If this sounds interesting and exciting to you, we encourage you to research the area you‚Äôre most passionate about in the space of Risk Management and apply today!

About the GRM, Business Banking Credit Risk Stream:

The Business Banking Credit Risk teams provide credit adjudication and risk oversight for an assigned portfolio within Global Banking & Markets (GBM), Canadian Commercial Banking (CCB) and International Banking (IB) by ensuring that the portfolio is maintained in sound condition with the Bank‚Äôs current credit policy.

About the GRM, Enterprise Risk Stream:

GRM‚Äôs Enterprise Team provide 2nd line governance and oversight to our business lines and support function partners in managing their non-financial risks across many categories. The risk domains you‚Äôll directly cover are non-financial risks, which would include Operational Risk, Third Party Risk, Model Risk and Environmental Risk where the team drives methodology and provides 2nd line oversight and challenge.

About the GRM, Financial Crimes Risk Stream:

The Financial Crimes Risk Management (FCRM) Team provides oversight over the banks Anti-Money Laundering, Anti-Terrorist Financing, and sanctions compliance program, including design and effective implementation. The program is designed to mitigate the risks of Scotiabank products or services being used for prohibited activities; and ensure compliance with the laws and regulations applicable to the bank.

About the GRM, Market Risk Stream:

The Market Risk stream provides risk oversight for the trading and treasury portfolio in the Bank. Working in close collaboration with the business line, our Market Risk teams ensure market risks are understood and controlled. This involves understanding risk/reward trade offs and working with front office staff to help facilitate business success. Across the team, roles range from quantitative modelling to risk oversight with a strong connection to capital market dynamics.

About the GRM, Retail Credit Risk Stream:

The Retail Credit Risk stream is comprised of multiple areas including Risk Technology, Retail Risk Secured Lending and Small Business, and Retail Risk Data and Analytics. Across these areas, teams work on data manipulation, risk technology project work, customer analytics and portfolio management all with a credit risk perspective. This includes analyzing the effectiveness of risk strategies, performing portfolio trend analysis, and pulling, summarizing, and presenting data. In each of these rotations, you will have regular interactions with senior management.

Do you have the skills and requirements that will enable you to succeed in this role? ‚Äì We‚Äôd love to work with you if:

  • You are working towards completion of an undergraduate, post-graduate certificate, MBA or Masters program in Risk Management, Finance, Economics or related discipline with an expected graduation date prior to June 2024.
  • You are passionate about launching your career in Risk Management through the Activate Program after graduation.
  • Strong analytical skills and experience with financial statement analysis, financial concepts, and accounting principles and practices.
  • Knowledge of Python, SQL, VBA, MS Office.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills to report complex outputs and findings in a concise and comprehensive manner.
  • Attention to detail with a strong ability to multi-task while maintaining a high work standard.
  • Demonstrated flexibility in adapting to constantly changing environments.

How do I apply?

For students applying to our internship/co-op or new graduate programs, we do not require resumes! We believe in evaluating you through relationships over resumes and are focused on learning about who you are and what you‚Äôre interested in to uncover your true potential. Instead, we ask that as part of your application you complete the below:

  1. Complete your PLUM Profile here and save as a screenshot.
  2. Complete a short one-way video interview here.
  3. Apply to the role and when the application asks for your resume, instead upload the screenshot of your PLUM Profile.

*To be considered for student opportunities at Scotiabank, Tangerine, and MD Financial you must complete all steps above.
