title: Associate, Quantitative Rotational Program
description:
We‚Äôre building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what‚Äôs right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

Join our Quantitative Rotational Program as an Associate and make a real difference for our clients. This is a great opportunity to work under the leadership of our quantitative teams within Risk Management and Internal Audit. In the program, you will be provided with the opportunity to gain comprehensive experiences in developing, validating, implementing, managing and auditing various types of quantitative models. You‚Äôll be part of a two-year program that consists of four, six-month rotations through various quantitative departments within CIBC that will provide you with the necessary experience and exposure to become an effective leader.

During your rotations, you will be part of the Quantitative Risk, Model Quantification and Model Validation within Risk Management, Model Risk teams within our Internal Audit department. Once you have successfully completed the program, you will be assisted in securing a full-time permanent role, preferably in one of the quantitative departments you worked with during your rotations. You will be part of a team that focuses on designing tools and reports to make the analysis process more efficient and streamlined. You‚Äôll have an opportunity to prepare management summaries describing the mathematical analytics of models, validation techniques, test results, and model limitations, including recommendations for further improvements. You‚Äôll perform, analyze and document the calibration and parametrization of the models used, define and monitor controls to ensure the appropriateness of the parameters used along with running back testing for models and analyze the impact of model behavior on risk management measures, as well as the impact of changes in capital from the model performance and how they affect the business.

As a QRP Associate, you will also have a chance to assist in the development and testing of new modelling methodologies, and effectively challenge these models through benchmark modelling and model validation. Additionally, we will look to you to provide assurance with respect to governance, the control environment, and compliance with regulatory requirements around model risk management through participating model specific and model governance audits and managing small and less complicated audit assignments and initiatives.

Important Information

  • You have a Master‚Äôs or Doctor‚Äôs degree in related programs e.g. Financial Engineering, Math, Physics and will graduate in 2023.
  • Please include your resume (no more than 2 pages), a cover letter (no more than 1 page), and your most recent unofficial transcript with your application. Please upload all documents as one PDF file into the Resume section of your application.
  • Work Location: Toronto (exact location to be decided during interview).
  • Duration of Program: 2 years (four, 6-month rotations).
  • Available start dates are in 2023 (to be confirmed during interview stage).
  • This job posting closes on February 5th at 11:59pm.

How You‚Äôll Succeed

  • Project Management ‚Äì You manage assignments through effective planning, execution, collaboration and communication to ensure timely delivery of high-quality results.
  • Risk Focused ‚Äì You understand the importance of maintaining and evolving processes and control to mitigate model risks arising from an ever-changing business. You will also act as a champion for existing processes, working with key stakeholders and partners.
  • Communication and Relationship Management - You will build and develop relationships with key business contacts, governance functions and oversight groups to become a true partner to the business.
  • Passion ‚Äì you will prove your risk focus and passion by demonstrating continuous improvement ideas that will enable CIBC‚Äôs model risk management practices to stand out in today‚Äôs competitive landscape.

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience in the use of mathematical, computer science, and statistical techniques, such as predictive modeling, analytics, and machine learning.
  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
  • Your attention to detail is second to none and you pick up things that others miss.
  • You enjoy finding innovative solutions to problems that will make a difference today and in the future.
  • You embrace change and look to evolve your thinking and the way you work to deliver your best.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values ‚Äì trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.

  • We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive compensation, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.

  • Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.

  • We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit.

Job Location

Toronto-81 Bay, 20th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

Management Practices, Risk Management

title: Cloud Database Administrator
description:
Location: Ottawa, Canada

Thales people architect identity management and data protection solutions at the heart of digital security. Business and governments rely on us to bring trust to the billons of digital interactions they have with people. Our technologies and services help banks exchange funds, people cross borders, energy become smarter and much more. More than 30,000 organizations already rely on us to verify the identities of people and things, grant access to digital services, analyze vast quantities of information and encrypt data to make the connected world more secure.

We are currently recruiting for a talented Cloud Database Administrator to provide support of this complex state-of-art solution. This role will provide you with the opportunity to learn the latest IT solutions and security concepts, within a like-minded supportive talented team.

Thales offers global cloud-based authentication services for high-profile customers with the most versatile and highest security practices implemented. We provide identity and access management services to thousands of customers worldwide

Key Responsibility

  • Analyze product requirements and identify the best database solution, technology, and tool.
  • Ensure database consistency of the projects by resolving any constraints.
  • Develop database installation and upgrade script, which is part of CI/CD.
  • Provide workload estimation of customization, features, and component level.
  • Forecast, inform risk/concern on task, team, or project level, and propose mitigation plans.
  • Provide technical solutions, support, and perform several activities for a new or customized database of products/components used in the project which includes but is not limited to database design, installation, upgrade, migration, backup, recovery, failover, HA, hardening, monitoring, etc.
  • Review other DevOps code as necessary.
  • Orchestrate and optimize the database activities of several databases, schemas, and components in one project or solution.
  • Manage system/network configuration and monitoring.
  • Strategize and plan for data migration, and develop data migration script if required by the project.
  • Support, investigate and propose solutions/workarounds for production issues related to the database.
  • Provide documentation as appropriate including design documentation, comments in code, and end-user documentation
  • Consult with other technical team members and management on industry best practices.
  • Maintain and enhance internal tools
  • Provide input to improve the scalability and reliability of infrastructure to our Automation Architects
  • Deploy and assist with the maintenance of automation technologies
  • Participate in the on-call schedule & Provide L2/L3 Support to our Services desk and R&D teams
  • Document all build and run procedures when implementing new automation technologies.

Required Skills and Exerience

  • 5+ years experience in Cloud Native database technologies including RDS,MSSQL, CloudSQL, Cloud Spanner, etc.
  • 5+ years experience in deploying and supporting different flavors of Cloud and OnPrem databases including MSSQL, MySQL, Postgres, MongoDB, etc.
  • 5+ years must have experience with orchestration and Automations tools (Helmcharts, Ansible, Terraforms, Yaml, Python, Json)
  • 5+ years experience in SQL programming, bash scripting etc.
  • Experience in configuring and maintaining different database replication methodologies.
  • Strong interest in performance and security. Involvement in application server deployment including System setup, monitoring and Network configuration
  • Understanding of operational concepts like change management, on-call rotations, escalations, uptime, etc
  • Experience in managing production systems on a very large scale
  • Experience with security-relevant protocols
  • Deep understanding of one of the major OS families (Linux or Windows)
  • Adhere to security best practices from design to implementation and operations
  • Experience with PaaS technologies (K8s, OpenShift, etc.)
  • Experience with building pipelines for Infrastructure as a code using Terraform
  • Ability to work in an extremely geographically distributed company
  • Excellent communication skills across multiple mediums

Thales is an equal opportunity employer which values diversity and inclusivity in the workplace. Thales is committed to providing accommodations in all parts of the interview process. Applicants selected for an interview who require accommodation are asked to advise accordingly upon the invitation for an interview. We will work with you to meet your needs. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.

title: Business Insights & Analytics Associate (Undergraduate)
description:
Company Overview

All companies are not the same. What makes TD special as a business is also, what makes us special as an employer. Why TD?

TD‚Äôs Colleague Promise: A better you. A better us.

A more confident you means a stronger us. We empower you to grow your skills, gain new perspectives, and create impact at work and in your community. That‚Äôs our unique and inclusive culture.

Department Overview

Our Associate Programs offer new graduates experience within one TD‚Äôs many lines of business, and the chance to work alongside experienced colleagues, work on challenging projects and assignments, and receive coaching and mentorship from business leaders and the Early Talent Experience team, to set you up for success in your career at TD.

Associate Role Profile:

  • 1-year in-depth experience, complemented by programming, coaching, tools and support
  • This is a full-time, permanent position

In addition, as an Associate you have access to programming, tools and a community of support for your pursuits and interests beyond the 9-5. This includes leadership talks, lunch and learns, self-development workshops, TD sponsored conferences, socials, team challenges, volunteer opportunities, career coaching and more. You will be part of a cohort along with other TD Associates from across Canada! If one of our over 20+ Associate programs is of interest to you, please read on and apply today.

Job Description

The Data & Analytics Associate Program is a 1-year enhanced development opportunity in analytics and data. The Business Insights & Analytics Associate will perform a variety of activities, which may include:

  • Perform data queries and prepare data sets for analysis/modelling, including cleaning data and feature engineering
  • Analyze large data sets and identify trends and insights to inform business decisions; communicate findings to technical and non-technical audiences
  • Collaborate with team members and business partners to develop, test and deploy analytics solutions, for example: forecasting, optimization, or pricing models
  • Proactively identify business problems and opportunities where a data-driven solution would be appropriate and develop proposals / approaches
  • Collaborate with business partners to support the business case development process for analytics solutions

Requirements

  • JOB REQUIREMENTS
  • Must be graduated between May 2021 and May 2023 with an Undergraduate degree in Business, Management, and/or Data Analytics or related.
  • Strong statistical and analytical skills and interest are necessary.
  • Experience with analyzing large data sets, drawing insights and inferences, and communicating outputs.
  • Experienced in one or more of:
    • Big Data ‚Äì Predictive Analytics, Optimization, Regression, Logit Modeling, Discreet Choice, Simulation, Propensity Modeling.
    • Machine Learning ‚Äì Data/Text Mining, Programming, Algorithm Development, Automation Data Visualization, Natural Language Processing.
  • Strong technical knowledge and experience with at least one of: R, Python, SQL, SAS, Java, or C/C++
  • Technical knowledge or experience with Hadoop, Spark and Cloud.Experience with Data Management, and Project Management is a plus.

Must have strong leadership qualities including demonstrating initiative, establishing priorities and using strong communication, analytical and problem-solving skills to add value to each initiative, project or team assigned to. Able to participate as part of a team with targeted deliverables, working on initiatives designed to improve decisions, processes, systems, and applications which support our key businesses. Remain current with emerging trends and technologies in this field.

We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. title: Data Ethicist - REMOTE
description:
Description


Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together


The TELUS Data & Trust Office provides world-class, innovative privacy solutions to TELUS. We partner with teams across the organization to advance our corporate priorities, support innovation and ultimately deliver on our promise to safeguard our customers\' privacy and to earn and maintain their trust. As the Data Ethicist, reporting to the Director of Data Ethics & Governance, you will provide thought-leadership and work with a cross-functional group focused on enabling a framework for responsible use of data, including health data. You will guide the design and development of data research, data-driven products and services in accordance with ethical principles.


You will be a champion for data ethics across the organization and you will advocate for TELUS‚Äô Trust Model as the fundamental driver for all of our decisions around data, recognizing how critical customer and team member trust is to TELUS‚Äô mission. Your commitment to data ethics will support our business needs as well as our position on social capitalism as we seek opportunities to innovate with data, including health data, for social good and specifically to address some of society‚Äôs most pressing problems.


Here‚Äôs how

  • Provide ethical analysis and questioning for the implications of data use and technology evolution that is fair and transparent, considering the experience of a broad range of stakeholders to identify potential unintended consequences and impacts
  • Establish the data ethics framework to ensure there is understanding, consideration and foresight into the issues raised by previously unimaginable uses of data and the development of emerging technologies like AI
  • Enhance understanding of data ethics and its importance across TELUS, providing education and influencing the data user community and network of Data Stewards on responsible innovation
  • Work with TELUS engineers, researchers, designers and business stakeholders to embed ethical decision-making and risk mitigation and monitoring processes into emerging technology, ensuring that design and production is fit for purpose and beneficial
  • Maintain expert knowledge of data ethics toolkits, best practices and contribute to industry working groups on standards for data ethics and responsible innovation.
  • Define and oversee stakeholder engagement methods to incorporate participatory human-centered design and the consultation of diverse voices across the innovation lifecycle to enhance public understanding and improve the social impacts of technology
  • Learn continuously, innovate every day and seek opportunities to develop and demonstrate thought leadership with external stakeholders

Qualifications

What you bring

  • University degree or equivalent experience in applied ethics, philosophy, ethical machine learning, human-computer interaction, social and human sciences, or relevant fields
  • Valued for your knowledge and expertise in data ethics and ethical risk assessments of emerging technology
  • Experienced in establishing ethical decision-making and monitoring processes
  • Demonstrated knowledge and experience in conducting analysis around societal expectations, including identifying stakeholder values and defining techniques for engagement and input
  • Highly adaptable and comfortable working in a nascent field in a demanding and fast-paced environment
  • Able to identify and proactively consider opportunities outside of conventional thinking, providing multiple solutions to resolve problems and address gaps
  • Effective in written communication and verbally communicating progress on initiatives in leadership forums
  • Trusted as a collaborative partner with excellent interpersonal skills who will act with integrity and exemplify ethical practices to fulfill TELUS‚Äô commitments to its customers
  • Post-secondary degree is a requirement


Great-to-haves

  • Bilingualism in English & French, verbal and/or written
  • Experience working in a large, matrixed organization
  • Experienced in implementing multidisciplinary data ethics practices and collaborating in a cross-functional environment working with technology, policy, engineering, product and research teams

title: Manager, Adjudication Data Analytics
description:
Requisition ID: 169306

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Purpose of Job:

The Adjudication Management function is responsible for working with the Retail and Small Business risk adjudication teams (Loan Adjudication Centres & Loan Underwriting Centres) across the Caribbean region. This function is responsible to peform Data Analytics for the adjudication process considering Operations and Credit Risk.

Job Responsibilities:

The Manager, Adjudication Data Analytics C & CA will work closely with the Director Adjudication to ensure that all adjudication teams are aligned in terms of the risk policies and Bank‚Äôs Risk Appetite. Key accountabilities include:

‚Ä¢ Develop reports using Data Analytics techniques for the adjudication centres to monitor operational KPIs, loan performance and exception management reporting

‚Ä¢ Apply critical thinking to validate improvements with the adjudication units using data and analytics

‚Ä¢ Manage analytical inquiries related to executive decisions and conducts root cause analysis of key operational issues, providing guidance and advice towards optimal resolution and mitigation while ensuring a timely and high-quality response.

‚Ä¢ Responsible for monitoring the activity of the adjudication teams to provide risk oversight, including providing monthly analysis on early warning indicators, process updates, impact on adjudication from new initiatives or risk policies.

‚Ä¢ Participating in key risk initiatives and projects which focus on the key priorities of the Adjudication teams from the data analytics perspective.

‚Ä¢ Conducting assessments of the operational activity across the adjudication workflow. It is required that the Manager will provide recommendations for efficiency gains and be responsible for implementing these recommendations leveraging data and analytics.

‚Ä¢ Assisting in the preparation of training material and tools for adjudicaiton teams, including communication of changes and updates.

‚Ä¢ Working closely with the heads of the adjudication teams and Quality Assurance to identify areas where processes and procedures may need to be developed to improve the overall consistency of credit risk decisions.

‚Ä¢ Adherence to lean practices and methodology

‚Ä¢ Assist the Director with planning, forecasting, ad hoc requests, research, and strategic projects as they arise

‚Ä¢ Responsible for quarterly Cost Allocation Transfer Pricing Expenses for the Adjudication department

‚Ä¢ Actively pursues effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational risk, regulatory compliance risk, AML/ATF risk and conduct risk, including but not limited to responsibilities under the Operational Risk Management Framework, Regulatory Compliance Risk Management Framework, AML/ATF Global Handbook, and the Guidelines for Business Conduct

‚Ä¢ Champions a high-performance environment and implements a people strategy that attracts, retains, develops, and motivates their team by fostering an inclusive work environment, communicating vison/values/business strategy, and managing succession and development planning for the team

Job Requirements:

‚Ä¢ Minimum bachelor's degree in business, economics, or finance or at least 3 year's working experience in retail banking or risk management
‚Ä¢ Strong skills with data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, SAS
‚Ä¢ Experience on data analytics with a solid grasp of reporting practices and performance measurement tools
‚Ä¢ Strong communication skills
‚Ä¢ Strategic influencing abilities
‚Ä¢ Assertive, and driven to be a change agent
‚Ä¢ Fluent written and spoken English is mandatory
‚Ä¢ Experience in Retail & Small Business banking, finance, credit risk are assets
‚Ä¢ Spanish is an asset

title: Senior Analyst, Campaign Analyst
description:
Company Overview

Tell us your story. Don‚Äôt go unnoticed. Explain why you‚Äôre a winning candidate. Think ‚ÄúTD‚Äù if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.

Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here‚Äôs our story: jobs.td.com

Department Overview

What does TD Data & Analytics stand for? For starters, we believe in visionary leadership and insights. We believe in using every resource at our disposal to better serve our clients, and this includes our vast data.

The Business Intelligence group delves into our data, past and present, to develop crucial metrics and reporting functionality that better informs and optimizes key businesses decisions across the organization.

This is the team building the tools, reports, dashboards, cubes and scorecards that deliver and process vital data to business partners across the enterprise.

Joining us in Business Intelligence & Reporting is an opportunity to advance and deepen your career and to help TD serve its customers in a way we never have before.

Job Description

The Data & Analytics function within Marketing is a central source of internal and external consumer insights and data analytics which supports both corporate and business unit strategies for TD Bank Financial Group Canada and TD Bank, America‚Äôs Most Convenient Bank.

The D&A team mission is to be influential change agents and consumer advocates to help deliver the better bank and to drive shareholder return through optimizing the impact of marketing. We do this by delivering hindsight (what happened), insight (why), and foresight (future actions) on how to best reach consumers, who to target, what to say, and build intelligence on the market and competitive landscape. The group seeks to deliver excellence in analytics and insights to support short-term business success as well as long-term strategy of the bank.

The D&A team brings together a diverse range of technical and business expertise including market research, business analytics, data science and modelling, business intelligence, data strategy and governance, data management, campaign targeting and delivery, and visualization.

Job Description
The successful candidate will be responsible for campaign analytics supporting the growing needs of the Personal Lending team within the broader Marketing Analytics Delivery group.

Your goal as a part of the Marketing Analytics Delivery team is to design and execute campaigns to drive acquisition, customer management, loyalty, and engagement across personal and business banking products. Success in this role will be achieved by:

1. Translating key business objectives into insight rich experiments that drive marketing ROI
2. Ensuring execution (i.e., list creation) is done efficiently and with excellence
3. Designing campaign results can be actioned by providing high value campaign reporting
4. Work in a consultative role to provide ‚Äúvalue-added‚Äù insights in the form of analysis and advice of campaign reporting

Your success will be predicated on your ability to forge strong partnerships, communicate effectively, deliver on-time, and continuously strive for increased efficiency.

Responsibilities

  • Design / execute / measure high impact direct to consumer marketing experiments
  • Continuously improve campaign design and delivery by leveraging analytical tools/techniques at your disposal
  • Execute with excellence and look for opportunities to automate and simplify tasks
  • Manage your project pipeline to ensure agreed upon timelines can be met
  • Proactively provide analytical guidance to key stakeholders, based on deep understanding of the businesses, to understand and enhance marketing ROI
  • Maintain a culture of risk management and control, supported by effective processes and sound infrastructure
  • Good communication skills with the ability to clearly summarize and share insights and foster partner relationship

Requirements

Skill Sets

  • Familiarity with direct marketing principles (Predictive Models, Experiment Design, A/B testing, Sample Size calculations, Net Performance Measurements, etc.)
  • Technical and detail oriented
  • Knowledge of how campaigns are created by leveraging customer data from internal data warehouses through the use of programming tools such as SAS
  • A project management mindset to help deliver on time to specifications
  • Team player while able to work independently
  • Pragmatic decision maker blending a mix of intellect, experience and street smarts
  • A profit driven mindset

Qualifications

  • 4+ years of relevant experience in a direct marketing, consulting, analytics, or agency-side role in financial services/telecom (or other high volume direct marketing industries)
  • Significant experience with IBM Campaign (Unica) an asset
  • Knowledge of SQL and SAS; knowledge of databases and data structures; knowledge of vendors and file format requirements
  • Knowledge of Python, Azure, Databricks, Hadoop
  • Experience designing successful direct marketing experiments
  • Degree in business, science, statistics, engineering, or other quantitative discipline
  • Track record of delivering successful initiatives on time and on budget

Hours

37.5

Inclusiveness

We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

title: Director, Treasury Analytics
description:
We‚Äôre building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what‚Äôs right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You‚Äôll be Doing

This is a unique opportunity that involves leadership and development of the Treasury Analytics functions and expansion of mandates. As the Director, Treasury Analytics will drive insights, identify inherent risk drivers of consumer products, and relate relate modeling risk specifications back to the business. You will dive into the underlying mechanics of the specific problems and translate complex concepts into program enhancements and specifications to Technology for development. Communicate complex problems and solutions to senior management and LOB.

Additionally, you will support the Senior Director, Treasury Analytics to conduct analysis to maintain analytics infrastructure developed in Treasury Analytics used to conduct analysis of how consumer behavior affects retail product cash-flows and the use of embedded options. You will assist in developing business requirements and conduct QA testing of Treasury systems and assist in applying advanced statistical models and financial engineering techniques to quantify and ensure minimal consumer behaviour risk. You will also assist in implementing and applying advanced analytics for optimization, reporting, P/L decomp and back-testing, and risk factor simulation to interpret and explain any resulting output.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You‚Äôll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you‚Äôll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote.

How You‚Äôll Succeed

  • Systems and Support (Infrastructure) - Lead development and implementation of various strategic business initiatives. This includes liaise with various groups within CIBC to explain methodologies, and procedures developed within Treasury Analytics to assess analytic/data requirements for future business activities, and resolve any issues which arise. Lead the maintenance of pricing, risk and mathematical analytics library supporting integration across all Treasury systems that are used for Bank-wide benchmarking to validate pricing or risk. This will ensure consistency of risk measures across different risk platforms/measures and mitigate model risk.

  • Support the management and enhancement of Cash-Flow Modeling Books - Liaise with Treasury CFO group to interpret and explain cash-flow modeling P/L variability. Enhance PnL decomposition and signing off on daily cash-flow modeling P/L.

  • Financial/Derivative Analytics - Ensure pricing and risk analytics capture all hedgeable risks as is practical. This will include work to prototype pricing and hedge of fixed income derivatives. Maintain and develop analytics/methodologies for transfer pricing new retail products, assess new and existing retail product profitability, and cash-flow modeling book.

  • Consumer Behavior Analytics - Apply customer behaviour calibration techniques for Treasury Analytics parameter review. Incorporate consumer behavior models into the funds transfer pricing and hedging processes. Collaborate in the development, continuous improvement and ongoing expansion of an analytics library with appropriate tools, models and techniques for modeling of customer behaviour and interest rate risks.

  • Quantitative Analysis - Lead the implementation of sophisticated mathematical modeling, processes or algorithms to conduct analysis. Ensure operational effectiveness to deliver analytics capabilities, ensuring that outputs are correct and reproducible, and proper documentation to explain methods.

Who You Are

  • You‚Äôre goal oriented. You‚Äôre motivated by accomplishing your goals and delivering your best to make a difference.

  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems and making sense of information. You communicate detailed information in a meaningful way. You have the ability to express modeling insights with an aptitude for explaining PnL and risk drivers. Creative problem solver and strong analytical skills.

  • You\'re motivated by collective success. You know that teamwork can transform a good idea into a great one. You know that an inclusive team that enjoys working together can bring a vision to life.

  • You can demonstrate experience. In ALM, Product Analytics, Risk Management. Experience in quantitative analytics within banking and/or other financial institutions in areas of valuation, hedging and risk measurement is an asset. Strong system and quantitative programming skills using C/C++/Python/R/SQL or high level languages. Experience working with banking retail products such as commitments, mortgages or GICs is an asset.

  • You can demonstrate knowledge. In financial economics, financial mathematics such as fixed income theory, statistics, treasury processes, risk management and balance sheet modeling techniques. You have knowledge of advanced GLM (including Cox regression), panel time series, and model selection.

  • You have a degree/diploma. Masters and/or Doctoral degree in mathematics, computer science, quantitative finance, engineering, statistics or related technical field with work experience in applied mathematical, statistical, and/or stochastic modeling.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.

  • We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.

  • Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.

  • We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

title: Business Reporting Analyst, Retail Automotive Finance
description:

33 Dundas Street West

Job Family Group:

Data Analytics & Reporting

The Business Reporting Analyst is accountable to develop and deliver reporting, analytics, and financial modeling pertaining to the Automotive Finance Line of Business (LOB). This includes preparing and delivery of key management reports, and consults on analytical solutions to understand, analyze, and synthesize requirements, goals and objectives relative to data and business intelligence needs and to enable high-quality, fact-based business decisions to drive better business outcomes.

The successful candidate will combine both business and technology acumen to generate and maintain reporting in various forms (models, cubes, ad-hoc reports). Such reporting is used by leaders for performance evaluation, to facilitate coaching, and for business decision-making purposes. The incumbent will be self-motivated and take ownership of solving problems and proactively raising issues to management that may require further investigation.

  • Breaks down strategic problems and analyzes data and information to provide subject-matter insights and recommendations.

  • Designs, develops, and implements innovative analytical solutions.

  • Designs and produces regular and ad-hoc reports, and dashboards.

  • Builds reports and visualizations to effectively communicate data driven insights to users for a variety of audiences (i.e. visualization solutions of data into reports, graphics, dashboards to illustrate facts, trends, and insights).

  • Develops solutions and makes recommendations based on an understanding of the business strategy and stakeholder needs.

  • Supports development and execution of strategic analytics & reporting initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.

  • Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders.

  • Develops tools and delivers training programs for use of reporting tools and self-serve analytics by non-analytical end users; may include delivery of training to audiences.

  • Documents and maintain operational procedures and processes relating to analytical and reporting processes.

  • Focus may be on a business/group.

  • Thinks creatively and proposes new solutions.

  • Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules.

  • Works mostly independently.

  • Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.

Qualifications:

  • Typically between 3 ‚Äì 5 years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience.

  • Knowledge and experience in data preparation, data analysis, and statistical tool sets including but not limited to Spotfire, Power BI, SQL, SAS, VBA, R, Python, MATLAB, SPSS - In-depth.

  • Experience in working with and linking big data sets across multiple sources.

  • Proficient in Microsoft Office.

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

  • Strong business communication and stakeholder management skills.

  • Some financial background dealing with Balance Sheet and/or P&L is an asset.

We‚Äôre here to help

At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one ‚Äì for yourself and our customers. We‚Äôll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we‚Äôll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.

To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en.

BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other‚Äôs differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. title: Data Scientist
description:
You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you‚Äôll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

Job Description:

Role Summary

Within Sun Life, the Analytics & Insights teams are comprised of savvy and intellectually curious professionals who are on a mission to transform how we apply data and analytics to support Sun Life becoming client-centric. An integral part of the Analytics & Insights organization, the Data Science team supports Canadian business units in their journey to leverage data and analytics as a foundational pillar in delivering business value

The Data Scientist you will focus on supporting Canadian business units in accelerating the growth and application of analytics in driving value. The data scientist will leverage practical experience in applying varied data science techniques & offering advice/inputs to help with the design, development and implementation of analytics use cases.

Sun Life views success in this role in demonstration of these key attributes:

Fierce curiosity. You are drawn to discovering and leveraging new data and taking on challenging business puzzles. An inquisitive mind. Driven to ask questions to help lead projects to commercial value and not being afraid that the innovation attempts can and will lead to failing. A passion for solving problems. The most successful data scientists‚Äô solution for what the right data to use, they solve using the most suitable (not most advanced) algorithms for the problem at hand and figure out how to execute and deliver with highest efficiency. Technical skills in both data and computer science. There are 3 core technical skills we look for: in-depth coding knowledge of an analytical tool(s) (i.e., Python); data science techniques and concepts; working with structured data (SQL) Thirst for learning. You are a data scientist who is constantly updating their knowledge of data science state-of-the-art.

What will you do?

  • Apply best in breed data science including descriptive, predictive and machine learning techniques from the design to implementation that impacts the business.

  • Focus on Feature Engineering, Model Training and Model Evaluation in addition to data munging / wrangling

  • Identify the right algorithms and statistical techniques for a specific project as well as the best features for a model. Advise junior members on the same.

  • Make business recommendations with effective presentations of findings at multiple levels of stakeholders

  • An active contributing member to the analytics community to help foster and grow the data science community at Sun Life

  • Champion and support diversity and inclusion

What will you need to succeed?

  • BSc/M.S. in a statistical, mathematical, or technical field (i.e., computer science) or equivalent experience

  • 1+ year experience in developing and implementing data science techniques (predictive, prescriptive, ML etc.)

  • Comfortable writing complex SQL queries to extract and integrate data from multiple database sources

  • Proficient in using one or more statistical programming languages (i.e., Python) for data science

  • Experience with AWS services including SageMaker is required for some roles

  • Experience with machine learning including supervised and unsupervised models

  • Demonstrated experience in data transformation & data manipulation

  • Experience working with Structured vs. Unstructured data

  • Experience with Big Data Technologies: Hadoop, HDFS, Hive, HBase, Spark is strongly desirable

  • Effective and concise oral and written storytelling and insights communication skills

  • Ability to work on multiple projects in parallel while managing constantly changing deadlines and priorities

  • Ability to document work and effectively prioritize documentation

  • Bilingualism (French, English) required for Quebec only - interactions with English-speaking customers or partners

What will be nice to have?

  • Past experience in life insurance/wealth management, or other financial services industry (e.g., retail banking, credit card, property and casualty insurance)

Unique Requirements

The candidate selected for this role is required to have special clearance from the Royal Canadian Mounted Police. To see if you are eligible for this clearance, please review the information on Federal Government site (https://www.tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca/esc-src/personnel/pdcf-rsrp-eng.html)

‚Äã

What\'s in it for you?

  • Remote/ Hybrid Work environment

  • Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data

  • 15 days vacation per year and an innovative sabbatical program

  • A friendly, collaborative and inclusive culture

  • Being part of our Analytics community, where we share best practices and broaden skill-sets

  • Flexible Benefits from the day you join to meet the needs of you and your family

  • Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security

  • Fitness and wellness programs that help you balance work and life and enjoy a healthier lifestyle

The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted. It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors. In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance. Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results.

Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.

At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

58,700/58 700 - 93,900/93 900

Advanced Analytics

Posting End Date:

12/03/2023

title: Senior Data Analyst - Communications and Public Affairs
description:
About the role

The Communications Data team owns data initiatives related to ‚Äã‚Äãthe Comms mission: sharing the what - the primary messages we want the world to understand, and the how - the ways in which we share our story with the world. Comms positions Shopify as a technology leader that is pulling the future forward, and they storytell using data-informed statistics and insights. As a company we are doing incredible things for our merchants and data helps us tell this story to the world [see how this Shopify merchant created 14,000 jobs in India.].

Reporting to Data Science, Shopify is hiring a data analyst with a storytelling archetype. This team member will craft the data behind our stories to make them impactful and trustworthy to audiences worldwide. The work includes contributing vetted data to stories that will be shared publicly with media, government, and the world through Shopify‚Äôs website. The team collaborates with data teams across Shopify to empower Communications with knowledge from data domain experts. Our mandate is challenging, varied and constantly evolving.

The analyst will leverage their expertise in data querying and manipulation to create analyses and data products that answer complex business questions and enable decision-making. This data will shape how Comms and Public Relations view and position Shopify‚Äôs impact on the global economy and community. This individual will be aligned with Data Science and have Comms and Public Affairs as its primary stakeholder.

Responsibilities:

  • Identify opportunities to increase the impact of Shopify storytelling with data
  • Generate high-impact insights that tell Shopify‚Äôs story to the world
  • Work within Data Science and Comms teams to enable improved discovery of vetted data points
  • Lead and own work
  • Become an expert at navigating Shopify data to answer business questions

Qualifications

  • Expertise in telling a story with data in order to guide conversations, persuade your audience, and influence decision makers
  • Extensive knowledge of SQL for data extraction and manipulation and proficiency with Python (Git helpful)
  • Experience with BI, visualization or data analysis tools such as Mode, Tableau, Looker
  • Excellent interpersonal and collaboration skills - you are able to work effectively with a diverse group of technical and non-technical stakeholders at all levels of the organization
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • High attention to detail, but an equally important ability to see the big picture and evaluate analyses with strategic business context
  • Good time management and organizational skills - ability to manage multiple priorities and timelines and address challenges in a collaborative team environment
  • Endless curiosity and an ability to think outside of the box

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: Director, Treasury Analytics
description:
We‚Äôre building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what‚Äôs right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You‚Äôll be Doing

This is a unique opportunity that involves leadership and development of the Treasury Analytics functions and expansion of mandates. As the Director, Treasury Analytics will drive insights, identify inherent risk drivers of consumer products, and relate relate modeling risk specifications back to the business. You will dive into the underlying mechanics of the specific problems and translate complex concepts into program enhancements and specifications to Technology for development. Communicate complex problems and solutions to senior management and LOB.

Additionally, you will support the Senior Director, Treasury Analytics to conduct analysis to maintain analytics infrastructure developed in Treasury Analytics used to conduct analysis of how consumer behavior affects retail product cash-flows and the use of embedded options. You will assist in developing business requirements and conduct QA testing of Treasury systems and assist in applying advanced statistical models and financial engineering techniques to quantify and ensure minimal consumer behaviour risk. You will also assist in implementing and applying advanced analytics for optimization, reporting, P/L decomp and back-testing, and risk factor simulation to interpret and explain any resulting output.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You‚Äôll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you‚Äôll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote.

How You‚Äôll Succeed

  • Systems and Support (Infrastructure) - Lead development and implementation of various strategic business initiatives. This includes liaise with various groups within CIBC to explain methodologies, and procedures developed within Treasury Analytics to assess analytic/data requirements for future business activities, and resolve any issues which arise. Lead the maintenance of pricing, risk and mathematical analytics library supporting integration across all Treasury systems that are used for Bank-wide benchmarking to validate pricing or risk. This will ensure consistency of risk measures across different risk platforms/measures and mitigate model risk.

  • Support the management and enhancement of Cash-Flow Modeling Books - Liaise with Treasury CFO group to interpret and explain cash-flow modeling P/L variability. Enhance PnL decomposition and signing off on daily cash-flow modeling P/L.

  • Financial/Derivative Analytics - Ensure pricing and risk analytics capture all hedgeable risks as is practical. This will include work to prototype pricing and hedge of fixed income derivatives. Maintain and develop analytics/methodologies for transfer pricing new retail products, assess new and existing retail product profitability, and cash-flow modeling book.

  • Consumer Behavior Analytics - Apply customer behaviour calibration techniques for Treasury Analytics parameter review. Incorporate consumer behavior models into the funds transfer pricing and hedging processes. Collaborate in the development, continuous improvement and ongoing expansion of an analytics library with appropriate tools, models and techniques for modeling of customer behaviour and interest rate risks.

  • Quantitative Analysis - Lead the implementation of sophisticated mathematical modeling, processes or algorithms to conduct analysis. Ensure operational effectiveness to deliver analytics capabilities, ensuring that outputs are correct and reproducible, and proper documentation to explain methods.

Who You Are

  • You‚Äôre goal oriented. You‚Äôre motivated by accomplishing your goals and delivering your best to make a difference.

  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems and making sense of information. You communicate detailed information in a meaningful way. You have the ability to express modeling insights with an aptitude for explaining PnL and risk drivers. Creative problem solver and strong analytical skills.

  • You\'re motivated by collective success. You know that teamwork can transform a good idea into a great one. You know that an inclusive team that enjoys working together can bring a vision to life.

  • You can demonstrate experience. In ALM, Product Analytics, Risk Management. Experience in quantitative analytics within banking and/or other financial institutions in areas of valuation, hedging and risk measurement is an asset. Strong system and quantitative programming skills using C/C++/Python/R/SQL or high level languages. Experience working with banking retail products such as commitments, mortgages or GICs is an asset.

  • You can demonstrate knowledge. In financial economics, financial mathematics such as fixed income theory, statistics, treasury processes, risk management and balance sheet modeling techniques. You have knowledge of advanced GLM (including Cox regression), panel time series, and model selection.

  • You have a degree/diploma. Masters and/or Doctoral degree in mathematics, computer science, quantitative finance, engineering, statistics or related technical field with work experience in applied mathematical, statistical, and/or stochastic modeling.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.

  • We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.

  • Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.

  • We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit.

Job Location

Toronto-161 Bay St 11th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

Asset and Liability Management (ALM), Communication, Critical Thinking, Fixed Income Valuation, Hedging, Product Analytics, Python, Quantitative Analytics, Risk Management, Structured Query Language (SQL), Treasury Management

title: Research and Business Development Officer
description:
About us: The Faculty of Arts & Science is the heart of Canada‚Äôs leading university and one of the most comprehensive and diverse academic divisions in the world. The strength of Arts & Science derives from our combined teaching and research excellence in the humanities, sciences and social sciences across 29 departments, seven colleges and46 interdisciplinary centres, institutes and programs. We can only realize our mission with the dedication and excellence of engaged staff and faculty. The diversity of opportunities and perspectives within the Faculty reflect the local and global landscape and the need for curiosity, innovative thinking and collaboration. At Arts & Science, we take pride in our legacy of innovation and discovery that has changed the way we think about the world.

Established in 1964, the Department of Computer Science is ranked among the top computer science departments in the world. Our faculty have been presented with a wide variety of honours and awards over the years, including two Turing Awards, and many other national and international honours. We provide diverse programs and research opportunities while consistently producing high-impact research that is among the most highly cited in computer science.

Your opportunity: Reporting to the Associate Director, MScAC Partnerships, the incumbent will focus on strategic business development and cultivate lasting industrial relationships. The Research and Business Development Officer will coordinate with internal units, including the University's Innovations & Partnerships Office, and will help drive commercialization initiatives and develop collaborative research projects through research internship opportunities. This is a critical outward and inward facing role at the senior staff level.

Your responsibilities will include:

  • Developing and implementing plans to support areas of research relevant to industry needs that are consistent with the University‚Äôs academic mission
  • Developing and implementing strategies to maximize the economic and social impact of commercialization partnerships
  • Writing grant and investment proposals to acquire proof of concept and product development funding
  • Using formal negotiation skills to settle the financial and business terms of all commercialization agreements
  • Identifying, developing and executing strategies for research and development collaborations
  • Serving as a resource on specific issues to a group of specialists
  • Developing project schedules including milestones, critical path, timelines, deliverables and reporting
  • Forecasting, planning and monitoring multiple complex budgets

Essential Qualifications

  • Master's Degree in Computer Science
  • Six to seven years of recent and related experience in industrial and academic research setting related to computer science, statistics and mathematics, undertaking both hands-on research & business development (R&D) and formulation of industry-based research projects, with experience managing and promoting professional graduate programs
  • Experience working with and supporting graduate students, preferably through internship cycles
  • Experience managing program budgets
  • Experience writing documents (such as complex business contracts, grant and investment proposals) and compiling statistical reports
  • Experience in assessing, formulating, and articulating a business case for partnering on high-quality academic-industry research and development problems
  • Excellent problem solving, decision making and facilitation skills
  • Excellent interpersonal skills to build consensus, employ multiple approaches and manage the conflicting expectations of multiple stakeholders
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills
  • Excellent research skills
  • Excellent organizational and time management skills
  • Ability to exercise discretion and tact
  • Ability to build relationships with a pleasant and professional demeanor
  • Ability to work independently and in a team setting
  • Experience with industry- academic governmental funding programs such as through Mitacs, NSERC, and OCI

Assets:

Visit the following link to view the full posting and submit your application for consideration: https://jobs.utoronto.ca/job/Research-and-Business-Development-Officer/567853817/

Closing Date: 03/09/2023, 11:59PM ET
Employee Group: USW
Appointment Type: Budget - Continuing
Schedule: Full-Time
Pay Scale Group & Hiring Zone: USW Pay Band 19 ‚Äì $109,343 with an annual step progression to a maximum of $139,826. Pay scale and job class assignment is subject to determination pursuant to the Job Evaluation/Pay Equity Maintenance Protocol.
Job Category: Research Administration & Teaching

Lived Experience Statement

Candidates who are members of Indigenous, Black, racialized and 2SLGBTQ+ communities, persons with disabilities, and other equity deserving groups are encouraged to apply, and their lived experience shall be taken into consideration as applicable to the posted position.

title: Manager Data Steward
description:
Company Overview

Tell us your story. Don‚Äôt go unnoticed. Explain why you‚Äôre a winning candidate. Think ‚ÄúTD‚Äù if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.

Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here‚Äôs our story: jobs.td.com

Department Overview

Data governance and management at TD is part of an enterprise-wide data and analytics ecosystem. Adaptability is key. You may be part of the data and analytics professional community managing data assets aligned to TD‚Äôs overarching policies or strategies, or you may find yourself directly immersed in various lines of business. Data stewardship at TD spans the enterprise and welcomes experts like you to help drive our business forward while protecting the interests of our organization, customers and shareholders.

Job Description

About this Role

Can you lead and inspire a team of data professionals varying in size and complexity? This people manager role is responsible for the direction of day-to-day data governance and data management activities, for a key function or line of business.

Are you ready to take a team of high-performers even higher? As the leader and manager of your team, you enjoy growing group dynamics and expertise to align with business and enterprise demands and direction. You set the bar high and set yourself apart as a leader by continually looking for ways to provide, and enhance, the value of your team and their satisfaction on the job, including assessing and developing both individual and team skills and capabilities. You‚Äôll succeed and inspire your team to do the same with your deep knowledge and understanding of businesses, technology and organizational practices and disciplines.

As a Manager, Data Steward, you will:

  • Provide people management leadership by hiring the best talent, setting goals, developing employees, managing performance and stimulating teamwork
  • Lead and manage a team of data experts and overall operation of a diverse group in an area of moderate risk, complexity and scope
  • Lead the team in the development and integrated implementation of policies, processes, procedures, projects and changes across multiple functions
  • Help build and deploy the strategic direction of the data governance/management function within your line of business
  • Act as a strategic partner by leading relationships with key enterprise partners and with leadership team to clarify scope, align, influence and effectively manage assigned data governance / management area
  • In particular, partner closely with Technology and other SMEs to drive the successful implementation of the LOBs Data Strategy for data initiatives up to medium complexity
  • Manage the overall data governance and / or data management team or function for a key business which may include Data Governance and / or Data Management roles
  • Grow talent, by developing skills and capabilities in line with evolving trends in the data governance space, to help achieve team member career goals, support project success and achieve business results
  • Complete key courses for the EDS capabilities within the EDU, including annual Mastery Testing

Requirements

What can you bring to TD? Share your most relevant experience, credentials and knowledge for this role, as well as these essential requirements and attributes:

  • Undergraduate degree or technical certificate
  • Seven (7) or more years relevant experience
  • Ability to stay on top of emerging issues, trends and risks, including evolving regulatory requirements
  • Skill in using software tools, applications, data analysis methods
  • Ability to work multi-functionally, communicate positively and professionally in both spoken and written form, provide assistance or guidance to other team members and build positive relationships across teams and functions

Additional Information

title: Data Analyst
description:
Req Id: 406647

At Bell, we do more than build world-class networks, develop innovative services and create original multiplatform media content ‚Äì we advance how Canadians connect with each other and the world.

If you‚Äôre ready to bring game-changing ideas to life and join a community that values, professional growth and employee wellness, we want you on the Bell team.

Bell‚Äôs Field Services team is proud to be the face of the Bell brand, performing the best installation and repair services and maintaining Bell‚Äôs network for our residential and business customers.

Position Description:
Bell Field Services Operational Support team is a dynamic team where our main goal is to ensure we are delivering customer support to Canadians. The team works in a highly complex space involving many system interactions with dozens of internal teams to manage those interactions. Day-to-day, you‚Äôll collect data & develop opportunities that will drive the future direction of the operations team and help to streamline the complex business problems they face. You will use your analytical skills to improve the understanding of KPIs while working to improve their limitations. And your attention to detail will help you push projects and process changes forward even when there is incomplete data or resources. A successful candidate will gain exposure with many people across various levels at Bell.

Job Duties/Accountabilities:
‚Ä¢ Code: create code to join various systems to translate raw data into meaningful stories
‚Ä¢ Analyze: perform extensive analysis to identify & size trends in performance
‚Ä¢ Create: think outside the box to deliver creative opportunities to the business
‚Ä¢ Collaborate: work with experts in different teams to understand end-to-end processes
‚Ä¢ Sell: build compelling business cases to convince our partners to invest in our proposals

Essential Skills & Abilities:
‚Ä¢ University or College degree in engineering, economy, computer sciences, physic, mathematics or relevant experience in equivalent domain
‚Ä¢ 1-3 years experience in business intelligence related functions (analysis, coding, etc.)
‚Ä¢ Proficient with MS Excel (pivot tables, functions, charting)
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of SQL and relational databases
‚Ä¢ Well-versed in applied statistics
‚Ä¢ Excellent communication skills and ability to quickly build straight-to-the-point presentation and deliver them with passion

Preferred Qualifications/Competencies:
‚Ä¢ Experience in Microsoft Office applications, Excel, Powerpoint, Visio
‚Ä¢ Experience with SAS & Python
‚Ä¢ Experience with data visualization software such as PowerBI
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of process modelling & mining techniques

title: Senior Manager, Autonomous Machine Business Group
description:
For more than two decades, NVIDIA has pioneered visual computing, the art and science of computer graphics. With an unusual focus on this field, we offer niche platforms for the gaming, professional visualization, data center and automotive markets. Our work is at the center of the most consequential mega-trends in technology - virtual reality, artificial intelligence and self-driving - and there has never been a more exciting time to join our team. NVIDIA\'s World Wide Field Operation Group is looking for a Senior Manager in Tokyo, Japan for supporting Embedded markets.

What you\'ll be doing:

  • Enthusiastically grow Automotive, Factory Automation, Robotics, Smart-city (AI video surveillance) businesses with our embedded (Jetson) and data center products

  • Balance distributor, channel and Partners

  • Matchmaking and bridge global end customers with embedded and enterprise system partners

  • Develop outstanding strategic relationships with customers\' R&D and procurement teams in order to understand customers\' system architecture, existing solutions, development plans and competition

  • Develop new opportunity pipelines and drive design wins

  • Understanding and guide delivery of NVIDIA value proposition, key features, product messages, positioning

  • Engage appropriate NVIDIA resources as part of a virtual sales team

  • Provide market and partners feedback to product teams to drive strategic alignment

  • Provide projects pipeline, forecast and accounts update periodically

What we need to see:

  • 10+ years Embedded Product and Sales experience and experience managing a team

  • Successful experience with Japanese industrial companies

  • Executive-level sales knowledge and experience

  • Excellent both English and Japanese / communication / presentation skills

  • Good organization ability / proactive

  • Data Center business experience is a plus

  • Distributor and channel management experience is helpful

  • Familiar with AI DL, Embedded Linux and Android environments is a plus

  • Education: BS EE, Computer science is plus

  • Strong customer relationship skills

  • Ambitious, inventive, market savvy, creative thinking

NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world‚Äôs most desirable employers. We have some of the most forward-thinking and hardworking people in the world working for us. If you\'re creative and autonomous, we want to hear from you!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Senior Business Insights Analyst, Fraud Strategy & Resiliency
description:
Company Overview

Tell us your story. Don‚Äôt go unnoticed. Explain why you‚Äôre a winning candidate. Think ‚ÄúTD‚Äù if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.

Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here‚Äôs our story: jobs.td.com

Department Overview

TD Fraud Performance Management strives to protect TD Bank Customers, shareholders and employees from financial crimes and fraud. Aligned with TD strategy and risk appetite, TD Fraud Performance Management develops analytics capabilities, processes, and layers of defense to mitigate fraud. The team operates within Enterprise Protect requiring both strategic and tactical responses to ever-changing fraud patterns and provides a unique opportunity to apply critical thinking and analytical skills in a fast-paced environment.

Job Description

The Senior Business Insights Analyst, Fraud Strategy & Resiliency will be part of a unique and new mandate for the Canadian Performance Management team. The team will lead a platform and process resiliency mandate across all current and future fraud platforms and processes at TD. A forward-looking role, this role will ensure appropriate oversight, early warning frameworks, incident playbooks, linkages to upstream and downstream systems are in place to run the bank fraud processes. The role will provide ample exposure working across various internal and external stakeholders in the bank and opportunity to make a big impact.

You will build on your deep analytics experience and process mindset to:

  • Understand and improve the operational impacts of our fraud defense strategies
  • Evaluate business processes, anticipate requirements, uncover areas for improvement, and develop and implement solutions.
  • Participate in ongoing reviews of business processes and develop optimization strategies.
  • Maintain confidence of the business via continuous engagement and achieving deliverables
  • anticipate and explain potential fraud risks associated with strategic initiatives across TD
  • help design policy, process, or strategic changes to enable the bank to safely deliver its strategic roadmap
  • provide deep fraud and process expertise into solving larger, Fraud-driven strategic initiatives
  • identify emerging fraud trends and support the teams‚Äô developing defenses against emerging and in-market fraud trends

The successful candidate will work collaboratively with a diverse team of Fraud solution developers, data scientists, business insights analysts, operational agents and subject matter experts and applies fraud business expertise leveraging advanced tools and detection systems to manage risk appropriately. The incumbent will be accountable for loss and customer experience targets.

Accountabilities:

Fraud Management

  • Perform periodic and targeted monitoring like QA and QC reporting, testing and business KPIs.
  • Evaluate current early warning reporting, identify gaps, and lead remedial action.
  • Supports development of new monitoring reports, dashboards using interactive dashboards
  • Assists senior members of the Fraud Resiliency group in current/target state process assessment
  • Identify and escalate gaps in process or technology hindering efficiency and/or effectiveness of the Analytics or Operations teams
  • Assists in review of new technologies and assesses reasonableness of business cases to understand potential investment opportunities
  • Leverage subject matter expertise to independently investigate new, high-risk exposures under tight timelines
  • Produce timely diagnostics to identify system, strategy, and operational issues
  • Participate in defect analysis to identify and remediate coverage gaps

Partner Support

  • Works with business partners to understand new intent, and to liaise with project team as fraud management representative
  • Collaborates with business partners to develop solutions that minimize fraud risk while enabling business partners to achieve bank strategic priorities
  • Occasionally provides IT release support to ensure projects reliably deliver on fraud requirements
  • Undertakes and completes a variety of complex projects and initiatives requiring specialist knowledge and/or the integration of cross functional processes within own area of expertise.
  • Support the continuous improvement agenda for our operational partners
  • Maintain strong relationships with internal stakeholders such as Fraud Operations, Internal Audit, Internal Business Partners, Vendor Managers etc.
  • Acts as a subject matter expert and represents the team or bank at project meetings or industry forums

Requirements

  • 3+ years of work experience in an analytical capacity
  • Graduate or undergraduate degree or technical certificate (e.g., engineering, mathematics, statistics, computer science, or analytics)
  • Ability to quickly and independently structure and deliver on new problems not previously tackled by the bank
  • Demonstrated analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Creative, Critical, Conceptual thinker, ability to wade through data and arrive at conclusions
  • Motivated to constantly strive to find innovative ways to enhance capabilities
  • Ability to effectively manage competing priorities in a fast-paced environment
  • Ability to ‚Äútell the story‚Äù to both technical and non-technical team members
  • Ability to take initiative and work independently under tight timelines
  • Ability to work collaboratively and build relationships
  • Passion in analytics with a customer-first mindset
  • Experience using analytical software tools such as Python, R, SQL, Tableau and Excel for data analysis, automation, and reporting

Preferable

  • Process engineering and/or Lean Six Sigma background preferred
  • Experience in fraud management and fraud detection platforms is an asset
  • Automation experience is an asset
