We‚Äôre committed to providing fair and equitable compensation to all our colleagues. As a candidate, we encourage you to have an open dialogue with your recruiter and ask compensation related questions, including pay details for this role.

Department Overview

What does TD stand for? For starters, we believe in visionary leadership and insights. We believe in using every resource at our disposal to better serve our clients, and for almost every department, that begins with data.

As part of our Data and Analytics team, you‚Äôll be a fundamental part of crafting business processes enterprise-wide by analyzing vast amounts of past and present data.

TD‚Äôs vision for the future? Tailored, customized banking products, services and experiences for every single customer. If you‚Äôve been in business as long as we have, you know there‚Äôs no such thing as one size fits all, and a diverse, inclusive Data Analytics team is a massive part of that future achievement.

Job Details

About this Role

You are eager to provide your burgeoning technical expertise as part of a team that takes on consistently complex projects across a wide range of business units. You are familiar with data functions including data modelling, visualization, data profiling, data origin and lineage, report design and more. You will employ these disciplines to help create data related solutions to drive business results. You thrive on positive feedback and use your specialized knowledge to implement feedback systems that evaluate your team‚Äôs progress and create innovative new ways improve your overall performance.

We are looking for someone to work as part of a trailblazing team of data scientists who create groundbreaking analytical solutions that improve our core work enterprise wide.

As a Data Scientist I, you will be supporting Financial Reporting Control(FRC) Data & Analytics function to deliver:

1.CCOA and Attestation Dashboard Maintenance and Development
¬ßQuality checks, data integration and refresh of various reports used for policy governance.
¬ßUndertake additional analysis related to exceptions and trends ‚Äì produce governance and exception reporting e.g., significant period over period changes, analyze QoQ changes in attestations, etc.
¬ßCreate reports for FRC‚Äôs oversight and monitoring mandate including business rules & data lineage for various reports, reports for submission to Internal Audit for remediation testing, progress updates for Project Lotus, etc.
¬ßAdd and operationalize incremental metrics related to new policy requirements, monitoring and oversight.
2.Operationalization of Chart of Accounts Policy (CCOA Policy)
¬ßOngoing development and enhancements to key metrics and KPIs to monitor policy compliance
¬ßAssist to remediate gaps identified in chart of accounts governance and end-to-end oversight control
¬ßSupport implementation of controls and monitoring for CCoA Policy implementation e.g.,
‚Ä¢Tracking of newly opened GL accounts & dimensions, oversight of dynamically open accounts by business segment & source
‚Ä¢Tracking of closed, deleted & purged account in various GL systems
‚Ä¢Development & operationalization of new oversight metrics
3.Ongoing daily support (examples below)
¬ßSupport FRC in its ongoing oversight mandate for various control & oversight activities as required ‚Äì example include completeness checks at quarter ends, exceptions reporting, variance root cause analysis etc.
¬ßDefining target audience for training based on mandatory roles and nominations from various teams. Extract details like emails and ACF2‚Äôs
¬ßTracking registrations, attendance and pending to date. Manage module in dashboard on trainings assignments and completeness
¬ßOthers ad hoc support examples include
‚Ä¢Work with different teams on identifying Transit/Suspense/Cash account
‚Ä¢Support ARCs discussions & requirements and reviewing new logic for ARCS data feed
‚Ä¢Support FRC on Business segment breakdown
4.Support Future Ongoing Enhancements
¬ßRe-configure to ARCs : Data engineering and platform update to switch attestation & reconciliation data from current tools (ACATT, Trintech) to ARCs
¬ßMove to Cloud : Migration to Akora on Cloud from Akora on Prem
¬ßAutomation :
‚Ä¢Efforts to automate parts of data sourcing & ingestion (as feasible)
‚Ä¢Enhancing data source to minimize sideloading process (onboard data to Akora)

Job Requirements

What can you bring to TD? Tell us about your most relevant experience, credentials and knowledge for this role, as well as these essential requirements and attributes:

Advanced Big Data Processing

¬ßAdvanced coding in data processing tools like Python, PySpark, Databrick.
¬ßPerform activities like data modeling, integrating files, record roll-up & attribution, deriving analytical attributes etc.
¬ßLink big data platform to BI tools using data connectors

Advanced Tableau
¬ßDeveloping new views ‚Äì ability to design & develop complex views & metrics
¬ßUpdating existing views ‚Äì update parameters, refresh data to update existing modules, perform QC, optimize load time
Business Knowledge

¬ßGood understanding of General Ledgers & Accounting, Governance & Controls and associated data structures
¬ßFamiliarity with Attestation & Reconciliation processes & tools
¬ßKnowledge of key terms & KPI‚Äôs related to policy, controls, governance and oversight activities & processes

Project Management

¬ßAbility to understand metrics & validate with business partners, conduct Demos to gather feedback
¬ßMaintaining various mapping files and prepare & prioritize backlog for platform enhancements & any fixes
¬ßDocumentation Skills like drafting Technical Documentation, Business & System Requirements, PowerPoints
¬ßPerform data QC & completeness checks and undertake root-cause analysis in cause of any discrepancies

Company Overview

Our Values
At TD we‚Äôre guided by our purpose is to enrich the lives of our customers, communities and colleagues, and share a set of values that shape our culture and guide our behavior. In exchange for how our colleagues show up to help TD succeed, we are committed to delivering a colleague experience grounded in Impact, Growth and a Culture of Care. No matter where you work across TD, we empower you to make an impact at work and in your community, explore and grow your career and be part of our caring and inclusive culture.

Making Your Well-being a Priority
A caring and supportive culture that promotes colleague well-being is core to who we are. At TD, we focus on total well-being with extensive programs to help colleagues assess, manage, and improve their well-being across four core pillars ‚Äî physical, financial, social and mental/emotional. In addition, we champion a safe, inclusive and supportive work environment to help colleagues feel a sense of belonging, and supported in their personal and professional growth. Through our focus on total well-being, we know that we can help our colleagues thrive, contribute to our culture of care, and support better business outcomes ‚Ä¶ because when colleagues feel their best, they‚Äôre more likely to do their best.

Our Total Rewards Package
Our Total Rewards package reflects the investment we make in our colleagues to help them, and their families achieve their well-being goals. Total Rewards at TD includes a base salary, variable compensation, and several other key plans such as health and well-being benefits including medical, dental, vision & mental health coverage, savings and retirement programs, paid time off, banking benefits and discounts, career development, and reward and recognition programs.

How We Work
At TD, we believe in-person connections fuel collaboration and collective creativity. Our workplace experience empowers colleagues to do great work side-by-side at TD locations, while offering flexibility to work remotely where it makes sense for the work and team. Our teams work in one of three workplace models: hybrid, onsite and primarily remote. Wherever our colleagues are working, they‚Äôll always have access to the TD community and experience our culture of care.

Who We Are
TD is one of the world‚Äôs leading global financial institutions and is the fifth largest bank in North America by branches. Every day, we deliver legendary customer experiences to over 27 million households and businesses in Canada, the United States and around the world. More than 95,000 TD colleagues bring their skills, talent, and creativity to the Bank, those we serve, and the economies we support. We are guided by our vision to Be the Better Bank and our purpose to enrich the lives of our customers, communities and colleagues. TD is a customer obsessed organization, and we are deeply committed to being a leader in customer experience, that is why we believe that all colleagues, no matter where they work, are customer facing. As we build our business and deliver on our strategy, we are innovating to enhance the customer experience and build capabilities to shape the future of banking. Whether you‚Äôve got years of banking experience or are just starting your career in financial services, we can help you realize your potential. Through regular leadership and development conversations to mentorship and training programs, we‚Äôre here to support you towards your goals. As an organization, we keep growing ‚Äì and so will you.

Inclusiveness

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion
At TD, we‚Äôre committed to fostering an environment where all colleagues are encouraged to bring their authentic selves to work, experience equitable opportunities, and feel respected and supported. We‚Äôre dedicated to building an inclusive workforce that reflects the diversity of the customers and the communities in which we live and serve.

How We‚Äôre Helping Make an Impact in Communities
TD has a long-standing commitment to help drive progress towards a more inclusive and sustainable future. That‚Äôs why we launched the TD Ready Commitment in 2018, now a multi-year North American initiative. Under the TD Ready Commitment, we are targeting a total of $1 billion by 2030 in community giving four key, interconnected drivers of change: Financial Security, Vibrant Planet, Connected Communities, and Better Health. It‚Äôs our goal to help support change, nurture progress, and contribute to making the world a better, more inclusive place for our customers, colleagues, and communities.

Accommodation
Your accessibility is important to us. Please let us know if you‚Äôd like accommodations (including accessible meeting rooms, captioning for virtual interviews, etc.) to help us remove barriers so that you can participate throughout the interview process.

We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Staff Engineer - Machine Learning, NLP (Remote)
description:
We are seeking a Staff Machine Learning Engineer to join our platform architecture team. This role is an opportunity to apply state-of-the-art ML that will shape the future of scientific discovery. You will be a key player in accomplishing BenchSci's mission to exponentially increase the speed and quality of like-saving research and development. Your work will have an impact on thousands of scientists across the world who rely on BenchSci for their research.

Reporting to the Head of the Platform Architecture Group, you will work on complex and challenging ML architectures (model level and data pipeline level). You will be responsible for the high-level design of technical solutions end to end. You will work closely with our ML teams, provide guidance and mentorship, and set the technical direction throughout the ML Development Lifecycle.

BenchSci is a remote first organization. At this moment, we are welcoming applicants from Canada.

You will:

    • Join the Platform Architecture Group, collaborate with Staff Engineers and architects and provide high-level end-to-end solution design for the company‚Äôs mission critical initiatives.
    • Design ML Architecture across multiple ML and Data Teams in order to build robust, scalable and production-ready solutions that enhance the speed and quality of life-saving research.
    • Write, review and approve ML and Data technical documentation to ensure quality and accuracy of performance and results.
    • Contribute to the ML and Data roadmap by ensuring project proposals are both highly impactful and technically feasible.
    • Continuously improve our workflows by keeping up to date with the latest optimizations in libraries such as PyTorch, and expand our usage of modern tools such as DVC.
    • Own ML solutions and long-term technical investments that will drive innovation at BenchSci.
    • Lead technical design discussions, apply best practices, diagnose problems and lead the resolution while fostering an inclusive environment.
    • Participate and contribute to Agile grooming, planning and estimation.
    • Promote the definition of coding guidelines and raise the bar for code quality using tools such as SonarCloud.
    • Provide guidance to senior engineers and help to foster a culture of continuous growth.
    • Work cross functionally with different stakeholders including BenchSci's R&D scientists to learn, model, and capture the nuances of biology.

You have:

    • At least 8 years of professional experience applying ML techniques to solve business problems, with at least 2 years at a Staff Engineer level.
    • Strong experience with NLP and LLMs.
    • Strong experience with Python and programming fundamentals.
    • Extensive experience with PyTorch.
    • Track record of successfully delivering robust, scalable and production-ready ML models.
    • Experience with the full ML development lifecycle from architecture and technical design, through data collection and preparation, model selection, training and evaluation, to deployment and maintenance.
    • Experience with data manipulation and processing, such as SQL or pandas. Experience with Cloud solutions and Cloud architecture, in particular with MLOps, DataOps and data warehouses.
    • Experience leading technical design discussions, writing and reviewing technical design documents and providing technical guidance and directions.
    • Ability to reason about trade-offs and make technical decisions under a certain level of uncertainty. Strong cross-team communication and collaboration skills.
    • A growth mindset and a constant desire to learn.
Benefits and Perks:
An engaging remote-first culture
A great compensation package that includes BenchSci equity options
15 days vacation plus an additional day every year; plus company closures for 15 more days throughout the year
Unlimited flex time for sick days, personal days, religious holidays
Comprehensive health and dental benefits Emphasis on mental health with $2500 CAD* for Psychologist, Social Worker, or Psychotherapist services
A $2000 CAD* Annual Learning & Development budget
A $1000 CAD* home office set-up budget
A $2500 CAD*wellness, lifestyle and productivity spending account for employees
Generous parental leave benefits with a top-up plan or paid time off options
*Benefits are tied to Canadian dollar amounts and would be converted to local currency for those in other countries. Moving to local currency allotments in the future.

About BenchSci:
BenchSci's mission is to exponentially increase the speed and quality of life-saving research and development. We empower scientists to run more successful experiments with the world's most advanced, biomedical artificial intelligence software platform.
Backed by Generation Investment Management, TCV, Inovia, F-Prime, Golden Ventures, and Google's AI fund, Gradient Ventures, we provide an indispensable tool for scientists that accelerates research at 16 top 20 pharmaceutical companies and over 4,300 leading academic centers. We're a certified Great Place to Work¬Æ, and top-ranked company on Glassdoor.

Our Culture:
BenchSci relentlessly builds on its strong foundation of culture. We put team members first, knowing that they're the organization's beating heart. We invest as much in our people as our products. Our culture fosters transparency, collaboration, and continuous learning.
We value each other's differences and always look for opportunities to embed equity into the fabric of our work. We foster diversity, autonomy, and personal growth, and provide resources to support motivated self-leaders in continuous improvement.
You will work with high-impact, highly skilled, and intelligent experts motivated to drive impact and fulfill a meaningful mission. We empower you to unleash your full potential, do your best work, and thrive. Here you will be challenged to stretch yourself to achieve the seemingly impossible. Learn more about our culture.

Diversity, Equity and Inclusion: We're committed to creating an inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive. We believe that improving diversity, equity and inclusion is our collective responsibility, and this belief guides our DEI journey. Learn more about our DEI initiatives.

Accessibility Accommodations: Should you require any accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs. Please reach out to talent@benchsci.com.

#LI-Remote

title: Lead Data Engineer
description:
Description


Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together


We are looking for an enthusiastic Lead Data Engineer who can help us bring focus, flow, and joy to all developers at TELUS as part of our Platform Engineering team.

We believe that a strong data science competency is required at TELUS for our business to be successful, and that happy humans build fantastic software. And so our calling is to improve developer focus, flow, and joy at TELUS. This means implementing changes to our systems and processes to make developer platform insights into reality.

What you will do

  • Lead a team of data engineers, data analysts and developers on our journey to strengthen the developer experience through all data ingested, secured, managed, processed and analyzed on our metrics platform
  • Lead initiatives that will improve focus, flow, and joy for software developers across the organization
  • Work with equally smart, grounded and collaborative individuals, as well as down-to-earth leaders who get stuff done and deliver measurable results
  • Lead challenging and interesting problems, and strive to do the right thing, the right way and continuously improve via KPIs
  • Innovate every day and have the freedom to contribute your ideas
  • Drive the development of data analytics strategy by developing and enhancing data democratization principles
  • Present our users with relevant, actionable and timely data to improve on software development KPIs such as stability, velocity and availability

The platform engineering team is delivering data analytics capabilities built upon unified scalable platforms, advanced AI tooling, high quality data,

We are entrepreneurial and passionate, we believe that anything is possible and can be achieved by innovative and meaningful outcomes for our customers, team members and that through meaningful and impactful endeavors we can integrate dynamic change in our professional lives.

We intend to shape the future of how machine learning, data processing and analysis can drive TELUS through insights that solve releasing software to production on-demand.

Help architect the future of our enterprise data solutions and leverage the best of Google Cloud‚Äôs data management, analysis and machine learning capabilities and drive forward our data strategy.

Here‚Äôs how

  • Overseeing the team that builds and iterates data pipelines to process data either where it lives, or across boundaries into a single system.
  • Analyze datasets, build data relationships and models to generate reports, meaningful insights and machine learning automation to support the business
  • Build a cohesive data platform that extends between the cloud and our data centers which can ingest, transform and process data.
  • Support operational efficiencies across our people, software engineering processes, management and our technical programs by leveraging data retrieved from our systems and tools.
  • Lead the team supporting the data pipelines feeding into our machine learning algorithms and models. Explore the latest tools and API‚Äôs that can help optimize our Machine Learning operations.
  • Lead the team to assist the extracting, loading, transforming, cleaning, and validating of data from both inside and outside of Telus.

Qualifications


What you bring

  • You are recognized for your 5+ years of experience of IT platform implementation in a technical capacity
  • You are sought out for your 5+ years experience of Data Lake and platforms implementation with experience implementing and performance tuning
  • Realize the vision of Data Democratization for software delivery metrics. Educate our customers on how to work with data to improve and reap the rewards
  • AI/ML tools expertise
  • GCP Professional Data Engineering certification
  • Google Cloud Dataflow and Google BigQuery experience
  • Orchestration and job scheduling platforms experience
  • Experience working with Google Cloud data products (CloudSQL, Spanner, Cloud Storage, Pub/Sub, Dataflow, Dataproc, Bigtable, BigQuery, DataLooker, Dataprep, Composer, etc)
  • You are respected for your experience in designing and deploying distributed, multi-technology, data processing systems
  • You bring systems design experience with the ability to architect and explain complex systems interactions, data flows, common interfaces and APIs
  • You bring a deep understanding of and experience with software development and programming languages and Python, Perl and Shell scripting
  • Communication skills to ensure effective management of relationships, prepare presentations for leadership consumption.

title: Senior Consultant - Data Analyst
description:
Overview

At KPMG, you‚Äôll join a team of diverse and dedicated problem solvers, connected by a common cause: turning insight into opportunity for clients and communities around the world.

Our Governance, Risk and Compliance Services (GRCS) team is growing and we are looking for a Senior Consultant ‚Äì Data Analyst to join our team in Toronto.

  • Learn more about Risk Consulting here
  • Learn more about our Toronto office here

What you will do

As a Senior Consultant, you‚Äôll be learning from some of the best in the industry and growing your personal skillset by:

  • Work closely with clients and partners in understanding key business issues on digital opportunities
  • Gather and analyze requirements to develop impactful recommendations and solutions
  • Utilize advanced analytical techniques to solve challenging business problems to identify areas of risk, opportunities and recommend solutions for our clients. Leverage a diverse set of technologies and tools to deliver insights
  • Work in multi-disciplinary and cross-functional teams to develop a strong experience in analytics, statistics, machine learning, data mining, data management, data governance, reporting, visualization and/or intelligent automation
  • Work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment with both virtual and face-to-face interactions; utilize structured approaches to solving problems, managing risks, and documenting assumptions; communicate results and educate others through insightful visualizations, reports, and presentations
  • Work with large volumes of data (structured and unstructured)
  • Proactively contribute to the creation of presentation materials relating to data activities for stakeholder discussions
  • Bridge the gap between technical platform needs and business issues
  • Effectively communicate orally and written with peers within GRCS, KPMG and the client

What you bring to the role

You have strong work experience and academic record and excel in an entrepreneurial environment. You‚Äôre highly motivated and passionate professional who strives for excellence, innovation and collaboration, and has the ability to achieve personal and professional success while juggling competing priorities and deadlines.

  • Strong experience of 3-5 years, working with different kinds of messy, real-world data from a variety of databases
  • You‚Äôre a highly motivated and passionate professional who strives for excellence, innovation and collaboration, and can achieve personal and professional success while juggling competing priorities and deadlines
  • Independent ability to review the data quality and data definitions and perform data cleansing and data management tasks
  • Strong knowledge and/or experience in the following: SQL, BI tools (like Tableau and PowerBI), Python, R, ETL, Alteryx and RPA tools (like Blue Prism, Automation Anywhere and UIPath)
  • Experience working in a multi-disciplinary team to tackle ambiguous data processing problems across a diverse range of industries
  • Experience in data governance, data quality, data processing, and data controls
  • Client-facing or consulting experience
  • Experience communicating insights or ideas through presentations and meetings
  • Certificate or degree in Computing or IT, with a focus on Business Systems Analysis, Business Intelligence, Data Analysis and Reporting, or similar, is an asset
  • Ability to explain data and analytics concepts to non-technical team members.
  • Ability to apply data and analytics concepts to business problems.
  • Ability to understand and explain business value of data and analytics concepts
  • Strong relationship-building skills to interact with clients, colleagues, and the wider community.
  • Ability to provide crucial consultation, analysis, and recommendations on a broad range of projects in a deadline drive environment with ambiguity.
  • Effectively work as part of a project team, and communicate findings of analysis, key implications, and recommendations in written and verbal formats.
  • Nice to have: Experience in data governance with tools such as Collibra and Informatica

Keys to your success:

KPMG individuals Deliver Impact | Seek Growth | Inspire Trust and understand that a diverse workforce enables us to deepen relationships and strengthen our business.

Providing you with the support you need to be at your best



For more information about KPMG in Canada‚Äôs Benefits and well-being, click here.


Our Values, The KPMG Way

Integrity, we do what is right | Excellence, we never stop learning and improving | Courage, we think and act boldly | Together, we respect each other and draw strength from our differences | For Better, we do what matters

KPMG in Canada is a proud equal opportunities employer and we are committed to creating a respectful, inclusive and barrier-free workplace that allows all of our people to reach their full potential. A diverse workforce is key to our success and we believe in bringing your whole self to work. We welcome all qualified candidates to apply and hope you will choose KPMG in Canada as your employer of choice. For more information about Inclusion, Diversity & Equity in Recruitment, please click here.

For general recruitment-related inquiries, please contact the HR Delivery Centre at cafmcdnhrsthotline@kpmg.ca.

If you have a question about accessible employment at KPMG, or to begin a confidential conversation about your individual accessibility or accommodation needs through the recruitment process, we encourage you to contact us at cafmcdnhrsthotline@kpmg.ca or phone: 416-777-8002 or toll free 1-888-466-4778.

title: Senior Manager, Retail Deposit Analytics
description:
Requisition ID: 169202

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Purpose:


The Senior Manager, Retail Deposit Analytics is responsible for leading a team of analytics professionals in conducting analyses and making fact-based recommendations across the Retail Deposits and Day to Day Banking portfolios. The incumbent will deliver strategic and tactical knowledge to facilitate the execution of strategies that will enable profitable growth of Deposit customer base, increase customer engagement and optimize revenue margins for the business. He/She will work with multiple stakeholders and partners within and outside Scotiabank to develop optimal strategies based on excellent analytical, database marketing, people management, communication and relationship management skills.

Accountabilities:

Accountability 1 - Analysis & development support for acquisition and campaign strategies


‚Ä¢ Collaborate with Retail Deposit and Day to Day banking team to profitably grow customer base. Proactively provide strategic analysis that will assist the business to optimize new & existing accounts and product mix from various channels. Grow day to day banking customer base within multiple segments of Scotiabank customers and enhance opportunity to acquire non-Scotiabank customers.
‚Ä¢ Work closely with marketing team to develop analytical and segmentation strategies that enhance Deposit customer engagement initiatives while optimizing budgets as well as margins. Collaborate with Retail Marketing and Customer Decisioning teams to implement and fulfill campaigns while ensuring seamless customer experience.
‚Ä¢ Lead the data science initiatives to optimize pricing and targeting strategies to drive acquisition & retention of chequing balances. This role works closely with Retail Deposit team, finance, treasury, channel partners to recommend pricing and targeting strategies to grow deposit portfolio.
‚Ä¢ Evaluate new campaign ideas based on business opportunities and revenue growth; provide initial sizing and develop business case. Provide go/no go recommendation by examining overall P&L impact to the bank.
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with Campaign Design, Products and Retail Marketing teams to support optimal acquisition and customer migration initiatives driven through centralized campaign execution engine.
‚Ä¢ Work closely with segmentation/modeling experts within or outside Scotiabank to create new and effective ways of targeting customers in order to maximize efficiency of acquisition campaign strategies.
‚Ä¢ Continuously acquire and enhance knowledge of business/product strategies, competitive practices, market insights and other policies, technical processes and advanced analytical tools/methodologies in order to best provide business solutions to all key constituents
‚Ä¢ Effectively manage and prioritize multiple business initiatives, projects and ad-hoc analysis with business stakeholders and/or external partners/consultants.

Accountability 2 - Measurement & Reporting


‚Ä¢ Lead the creation of ongoing measurement of acquisition/engagement campaign strategies relative to the pro-forma/plan. Provide actionable insights and recommendations to business stakeholders on an ongoing basis in order to maximize business results and enable the creation of an ongoing learning loop.
‚Ä¢ Develop pro-forma for acquisition/engagement campaign initiatives working closely with multiple stakeholders at Scotiabank.
‚Ä¢ Identification of portfolio trends and key statistics using advanced analytics; Effective and timely communication of strategic and operational results to the business teams;
‚Ä¢ Providing analytical support and profit insights on a regular and ad-hoc bases within Retail Canadian Banking with an eye towards driving business growth and profits
‚Ä¢ Provide business support to all areas of Retail Deposits and Day to Day Banking including Business development, Product, Acquisition and Analytics. Work with Finance for business case development and to report results to Senior Management as well as provide outlook/projection


Accountability 3


‚Ä¢ Champions a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems and knowledge.
‚Ä¢ Understand how the Bank‚Äôs risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.
‚Ä¢ Actively pursues effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational risk, regulatory compliance risk, AML/ATF risk and conduct risk, including but not limited to responsibilities under the Operational Risk Management Framework, Regulatory Compliance Risk Management Framework, AML/ATF Global Handbook and the Guidelines for Business Conduct.


Qualifications


‚Ä¢ In-depth analytics experience and solid business acumen are required. Extensive marketing & campaign analytics and decision support experience is strongly preferred along with a comprehensive understanding of portfolio optimization and financial P&L levers.
‚Ä¢ Proficiency utilizing a variety of analytical tools including Python, R, SAS, SQL and Excel and a solid knowledge and understanding of advanced analytical concepts and methodologies.
‚Ä¢ A proven ability to rapidly, effectively and accurately extract and interpret data and transform it into meaningful and actionable business insights.
‚Ä¢ Exceptional oral and written communication skills, with a demonstrated ability to present and translate highly technical concepts to a wide audience.
‚Ä¢ A strong sense of urgency and a proven ability to understand, and effectively assess multiple, ongoing requests.
‚Ä¢ Strong prioritizing, planning, analytical, presentation, project management, people management and relationship building skills
‚Ä¢ Proven track record of success in maintaining, leading and motivating a productive team of analytics professionals.
‚Ä¢ Displays a high level of analytical maturity and sophistication, financial acumen and a solid understanding of profit drivers, KPIs and other factors that will contribute to successful growth initiatives.
Educational Requirements
‚Ä¢ Minimum Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Finance, Economics, Business Administration, Engineering or Statistics
‚Ä¢ MBA (Finance or Marketing)/CFA/FRM or Master in Analytics - preferred

Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. If you require technical assistance, please click here. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Senior Data Scientist, Advanced Analytics & AI
description:
We‚Äôre building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what‚Äôs right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

The Advanced Analytics & AI team is a hub of data science expertise within CIBC, and is leading the way in applying the best practices in predictive science, machine learning, leveraging massive datasets and the latest in big data technology platforms. As a Senior Data Scientist in Advanced Analytics, you will work with business and technology partners to deliver solutions that meet their analytical needs and help serve our clients.

You will work with real world structured and unstructured datasets to produce end-to-end solutions, taking models from experiment to deployment. We collaborate with industry partners in the space of AI and machine learning, and engage with leading academic researchers to promote the exchange of ideas and enrich our talent.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role you‚Äôll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you‚Äôll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote.

How You‚Äôll Succeed

  • Data Science Expertise: You will utilize your knowledge in statistics, machine learning and/or optimization to frame business problems in a data science context. You will build data products by writing code that is modular, reliable, maintainable & replicable.

  • Consulting Mindset: You will communicate complex concepts in simple and elegant ways. You will work closely with our business partners to understand their challenges by asking the right questions to gather information. You will put in the effort to understand the business problem and to answer any questions and concerns brought up by our partners.

  • Team Player: You will collaborate with data experts to learn about the data and engineer relevant features. You will effectively collaborate with other data scientists and engineers to learn about the data, engineer features and work together to build data products.

Who You Are

  • You have an advanced degree in a scientific or quantitative field

  • You have minimum of 3 year experience in industry or research

  • You enjoy the challenge of leading engagements and coaching junior team members

  • You embrace change and advance our capability through continuous learning, sharing of knowledge with colleagues and partners, and encouraging constant improvement in how we do our work.

  • You have strong communication skills and an ability to present complex concepts clearly.

  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.

  • You\'re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to bring a shared vision to life.

What CIBC Offers

title: Data Scientist II
description:
Company Overview

Tell us your story. Don‚Äôt go unnoticed. Explain why you‚Äôre a winning candidate. Think ‚ÄúTD‚Äù if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.

Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here‚Äôs our story: jobs.td.com

Department Overview

The Global Compliance Department mission is to foster a culture of integrity, ethics and compliance and deliver independent risk management and oversight of regulatory compliance risk and conduct risk throughout TD. This is performed in accordance with the Global Compliance Department Mandate, in execution of the Global Compliance Operating Framework (GCOF). The department achieves this by independently assessing the adequacy of, adherence to and effectiveness of regulatory compliance management programs and controls in the business; delivering objective guidance and independent challenge; proactively managing regulatory change; and providing trusted and reliable reporting, advice and opinion to senior leadership and the Board on the state of regulatory compliance risks, controls and outcomes.

Job Description

Do you want to dive into the intersection of fairness and machine learning? Do you want to tackle how we can leverage explainability approaches to open machine learning and AI black boxes for customers? Are you passionate about technology and ethics? If so, then this is a job for you.
As the backbone of our financial system, banks have rich large-scale datasets and are rapidly adopting machine learning solutions to improve customer experience and drive business performance. While machine learning is increasingly pervasive across society, there are many outstanding questions and challenges to ensure that ML/AI solutions are fair and transparent. In this position, you will play a key role in ensuring the ethical application of machine learning.

This position reports to the Senior Manager, Compliance Oversight of Models Office. Detailed accountabilities include:
‚Ä¢ Conduct research on how to identify, assess, and address ML modeling risks and associated concerns, especially fairness and explainability
‚Ä¢ Evaluate ML model development procedures and processes for model compliance risks (e.g., unfairness)
‚Ä¢ Support the development of technical standards and guidelines covering model risk matters, and draft key Compliance documents in appropriate coordination with stakeholders
‚Ä¢ Maintain up-to-date knowledge of techniques and developments in the field of machine learning and share knowledge with business partners and senior management
‚Ä¢ Lead compliance review of machine learning use cases across TD, and build a close working relationship with business units across the Enterprise. Objectives include:
o Supporting compliance risk management associated with models used by TD;
o Supporting the business in identifying models whose outcomes impact customers or communities;
o Assessing models for regulatory compliance and conduct risk, including fair banking risk; and
o Supporting the business in monitoring regulatory compliance and removing or mitigating conduct risk throughout the model lifecycles.
‚Ä¢ Partner with Legal, Privacy, Model Validation and other Compliance Units (e.g., TDI Compliance, and TDS Compliance)
‚Ä¢ Represent Compliance in projects that have a regulatory compliance component and/or carry regulatory risk exposure related to the use of a model or tool

The position involves working effectively with different internal partners such as TD Wealth, TD Insurance, ED&A, PBDA, and Layer 6 among others.

TEAM DESCRIPTION

The successful candidate will join the Compliance Oversight of Models Office (COMO), an interdisciplinary team that sits at the intersection of data science, regulatory understanding, and ethics. COMO is responsible for the global compliance oversight of models from a regulatory compliance and conduct risk perspective. COMO‚Äôs oversight spans the model lifecycle and engagement with disparate model stakeholders. The COMO mandate includes but is not limited to:
‚Ä¢ Assessing models for regulatory compliance and conduct risk;
‚Ä¢ Providing oversight and independent challenge to approaches used to identify, assess, and address model compliance risks and concerns (e.g., fairness/bias and explainability); and
‚Ä¢ Supporting the business in monitoring regulatory compliance and removing or mitigating conduct risk throughout the model lifecycle.

COMO embraces a multidisciplinary approach, celebrating the alternative, multi-faceted perspectives needed to ensure that AI is developed and deployed ethically. COMO is committed to helping team members develop professionally and expand their horizons because the best way to address the ML challenges of tomorrow is to have a team that can see those challenges today.

Requirements

‚Ä¢ Hands-on data science expertise including, but not limited to, machine learning, statistics, and data visualization
‚Ä¢ Experience with/knowledge of methods, techniques and tools to support explainable AI (XAI) and address ML bias/fairness
‚Ä¢ The ability to stay abreast of developments in artificial intelligence and machine learning and provide thought leadership on same
‚Ä¢ The ability to effectively collaborate with technical and non-technical stakeholders (e.g., business partners and control partners) across the model development lifecycle and as part of enterprise initiatives
‚Ä¢ Ability to influence people and deal with conflicting points of view and to effect creative and responsive solutions
‚Ä¢ Excellent verbal and written communication skills
‚Ä¢ Comfort representing Compliance in executive-level initiatives and meetings, and working with all levels of staff within the Enterprise
‚Ä¢ Work effectively as a team to peer review other team member model reviews and share knowledge
‚Ä¢ Establish strong relationships with Business Units, Control Partners, Compliance Units, acting as a primary Compliance contact for model and tool compliance risks
‚Ä¢ Assist with response to regulatory inquiries, examinations and investigations as applicable.
‚Ä¢ Represent Compliance in projects that have a regulatory compliance component and/or carry regulatory risk exposure.
‚Ä¢ Quick learner who constantly works on improving skills and expertise.
‚Ä¢ Good time management and multitasking skills with minimal supervision.

EXPERIENCE & EDUCATION:
‚Ä¢ Postgraduate degree (preferably in computer science, math, statistics, engineering, or related quantitative field)
‚Ä¢ Relevant experience with the machine learning model development lifecycle (model validation expertise would be especially advantageous)
‚Ä¢ Demonstrated engagement with the issues of explainability and/or fairness in the context of advanced analytics and machine learning

Hours

37.5

Inclusiveness

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

title: Manager, Financial Reporting (Data Analytics)
description:
Requisition ID: 166893

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Purpose of Job:

The Manager, Financial Reporting, will assist in the analysis, monitoring and reporting of Retail Credit Risk, Small Business & Wealth Management portfolios including monthly, quarterly and annual reporting for Scotiabank's senior management, investors and regulators.

Job Responsibilities:

  • Assist in the preparation of Global Retail Credit Risk monthly, quarterly and annual portfolio reporting for Bank Executives and external stakeholders:
  • Development, analysis and maintenance of key senior management reports including data management, presentation, documentation, quality assurance and operational production effectiveness
  • Provide prompt and sound analysis of performance of the Retail, Small Business and Wealth Management portfolios to support management decisions
  • Participate in the identification, assessment and monitoring of credit risk trends and communicate adherence to authorized risk tolerance parameters
  • Extract, review, and analyze data from Enterprise General Ledger, Enterprise Date Lake & other various sources to address Global Retail Credit Risk ad-hoc reporting needs and projects
  • Prepare quarterly regulatory reporting and financial note disclosure:
  • Interact with the Canadian & International Retail Risk groups, Finance, Audit and other Bank departments to ensure information provided is accurate and reliable
  • Prepare reconciliations and analysis of Retail Risk and financial information to ensure that the data discrepancies are properly known and identified.
  • Assist in developing enhancements for reporting and data aggregation by:
  • Following and keeping up-to-date with regulatory requirements, End User Computing guidelines, RDARR principles and other data-related requirements
  • Improving the reporting methodology, modifying requirements per regulator guidance, identifying streamlining opportunities and redesigning as appropriate
  • Provide key support and technical expertise in data management and validations, report automation and trend analysis; Work with technology teams to identify issues and implement solutions.

Job Requirements:

  • University degree in business (finance or accounting) or a quantitative field (mathematics or statistics).
  • A minimum of 5 years progressive experience and functional competencies in development, analytics and delivery of senior management reporting including monthly, quarterly reporting; experience in Retail Banking, Retail Credit Risk and financial / quantitative methodologies.
  • To be successful in the position, the incumbent must have the following competencies:
    • Must have knowledge and experience in SAS, SQL and VBA.
    • Knowledge of current industry trends, regulatory requirements and industry best practices
    • Familiar with the Bank's General Ledger and / or has experience with preparing financial note disclosures
    • High level of proficiency in using MS Office suite of applications (MS Word, MS Excel, MS Access, MS PowerPoint)
    • Ability to analyze raw data; strong ability to understand and write business requirements.
    • Sound project and time management skills; strong organizational and prioritization skills; strong communication skills, both verbal and written; a highly proactive attitude, and use of initiative and independent judgment
    • Experience with Power BI or Tableau and open source programming like SQL, R or Python are considered an asset.

Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. If you require technical assistance, please click here. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

description:

There's no better way to kickstart your career than to do a co-op or internship with Scotiabank! title: Data Scientist I
description:
Company Overview

Tell us your story. Don‚Äôt go unnoticed. Explain why you‚Äôre a winning candidate. Think ‚ÄúTD‚Äù if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.

We are looking for world-class engineers to tackle cutting-edge problems of applying Machine Learning (ML) in the real world. Working across TD, you will be part of a leading financial services brand, have access to some of the largest datasets and innovate with leading machine learning scientists and engineers. Unleash the power of Machine Learning by helping us engineer models that scale and are rapidly deployable and, in the process, positively impact millions of customers. The goal of the team is to develop framework and automation solutions to help build and deploy robust and high-performing models through introducing software engineering best-practices.

About this Role

As Machine Learning Engineer at TD, you will work with ML Scientists to learn their modelling workflow, so that you can design abstractions and build components that can be combined to build high quality models. You will work to develop and/or integrate tools that help with model monitoring, governance and explainability. You will work with ML Platform team to make sure these models can be trained and deployed on our computing infrastructure, taking advantage of cloud technologies like Azure Kubernetes and more.

title: Data Scientist
description:
Description

Our team and what we\'ll accomplish together

The Marketing, Strategy and Data Insights team supports TELUS Future Friendly Home (FFH) by unlocking the power of data and producing deep analytics to deliver actionable insights and generate value for our business and our customers. We are looking for someone passionate about data and new technologies to join our data science group and be a key player in our Machine Learning and AI journey. Always wanted to work with a team of innovators and be part of a culture that embraces creativity and collaboration? If so, we‚Äôd love to talk with you!

You‚Äôll collaborate with teams across the company, seeking out innovative data sources such as speech analytics to help identify new business opportunities while championing data driven decision making and the accelerated adoption of AI. You will work closely with our marketing primes on the end to end journey, from ideation session for identification of use cases, to insights activation and monitoring of outcome.

As a Data Scientist on the team, you will leverage your expert knowledge of data science to automate and facilitate machine learning model development, training and deployment. The team takes pride in the Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning models and solutions they develop and deploy, and take ownership of each step of the process. From hypothesis generation, initial exploration of datasets, development of novel AI techniques, to automation of pipelines and ML models; be a leader in our cloud migration journey.

What you\'ll do

  • Lead the iterative development, validation, and deployment of AI/ML models
  • Collaborate on end-to-end automation efforts required to bring models to production
  • Work with structured and unstructured raw data to design and develop innovative predictive models, metrics, and dashboards to uncover actionable insights
  • Visualize and report data findings creatively in a variety of visual formats that provide insights to the organization
  • Influence how we approach business challenges and opportunities by driving the adoption of a data-driven mindset
  • Develop re-usable code aimed at delivering on future goals faster and more reliably
  • Build and maintain a strong engagement with key stakeholders to understand business needs and priorities

Qualifications

What you bring

  • You are recognized for addressing business needs via your application of data mining and analysis, predictive modeling, statistics and other advanced analytical techniques in which you have previous hands-on work experience
  • You are sought out for your skills in Machine Learning and AI, including classification, clustering, time series analysis, NLP, predictive models and bring 3 or more years of hands-on work and practical business experience in the above areas
  • You are a master communicator capable of breaking down technical and complex concepts in a way that is understood by non-technical audiences
  • You have solid development experience with Python and you are comfortable using various data science libraries such as Scikit-learn, Pandas, Numpy as well as frameworks like TensorFlow, and have applied these skills towards solving actual business matters
  • You possess advanced knowledge in SQL and Apache Spark
  • You are familiar with at least one of the cloud computing platforms - GCP, AWS, Azure
  • You are agile and have a bias for action, removing roadblocks to get results fast

Great-to-haves

  • Masters or PhD degree in a quantitative field such as Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, or Data Science
  • GCP or other cloud certifications #LI-REMOTE

title: Machine Learning Engineer  Framework (Layer 6)
description:
Company Overview

Tell us your story. Don‚Äôt go unnoticed. Explain why you‚Äôre a winning candidate. Think ‚ÄúTD‚Äù if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.

Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here‚Äôs our story: jobs.td.com

Department Overview

Layer 6 is a leading Canadian machine learning applied research company, a fully owned subsidiary of TD Bank Group. Layer 6 develops advanced machine learning and deep learning systems that have the power to uplift large populations while advancing the field of artificial intelligence. Our research is supported by access to massive datasets, close collaboration with world renowned academic faculty, and a uniquely scalable machine learning platform.

Our technical capabilities have been publicly recognized through a number of wins in various international machine learning competitions, including the prestigious ACM RecSys Challenge (the only repeat winner in 2017 and 2018 and runner-up in 2019), Google‚Äôs Landmark Retrieval Challenge (2nd place in 2018, 3rd place in 2019), the Stanford Question Answering Dataset (2nd place in 2019), 3rd YouTube-8M Video Understanding Challenge (winner in 2019) and Open Images 2019 ‚Äì Visual Relationship (winner in 2019).

Job Description

We are looking for world-class engineers to tackle cutting-edge problems of applying Machine Learning in the real world. Join this team to develop a framework for machine learning models that have a real world impact. The goal of the framework is to enable training and deploying robust and high-performing models by providing a solid foundation and allowing for fast iteration.

As part of the Machine Learning Frameworks team, you will design and build the cloud-based core engine powering enterprise use cases at the bank, enabling scientists to build high-quality machine learning models. You will work with ML product engineers, Ops teams, and scientists to ensure our frameworks can support use cases deployed on our computing infrastructure.

Requirements

title: ON - 2023 Internship Program - Customer Experience, Marketing, and Applied Technologies
description:
Req Id: 390452

At Bell, we do more than build world-class networks, develop innovative services and create original multiplatform media content ‚Äì we advance how Canadians connect with each other and the world.

If you‚Äôre ready to bring game-changing ideas to life and join a community that values, professional growth and employee wellness, we want you on the Bell team.

Bell‚Äôs forward-thinking Customer Operations team is creating the ultimate service experience for our residential, wireless and small business consumers. We lead strategic development and execution of day-to-day operations, develop tools and processes to drive service enhancements, manage customer loyalty and retention, and leverage big data and artificial intelligence to create intellectual property.

Revised Application Deadline: 02/26/2023

Over the course of our three-month internship program, you will:

  • Learn from the customer: Work directly with our customers through our call centres and online e-chat services as you learn about our services and customer support systems.
  • Apply your learnings: Improve the customer experience by working with your fellow interns on critical business projects. Our executive team carefully selects project topics, which offer interns an opportunity to make tangible impacts.
  • Discover opportunity: Explore the many career paths at Bell while building an extensive network as you connect with the brightest minds in the industry.

Why join us:

  • Learn how to leverage and use data to drive results as you produce and present business cases to our senior Leadership Team.
  • Develop your analytical, project management, and communication skills with training and hands-on opportunities to apply your learnings.
  • Interact with our peer-to-peer support network and receive mentorship from recent Grads enrolled in our full-time Graduate Leadership Program.
  • You will have the opportunity to secure a full-time permanent position in our award-winning Graduate Leadership Program.

You should apply if:

  • You are graduating in spring 2024.
  • You are enrolled in a university Bachelor‚Äôs degree in engineering, business technology management, computer science, math/statistics, business, or economics.
  • You are enrolled in a full time STEM-related college program and are required to complete an integrated work experience.
  • You are aligned with working in-person at a Toronto-based Bell office location 2-3 days per week. We value in-person collaboration and believe working in-office is the best way to establish meaningful relationships, build your network, and interact with our Leadership Team.
  • You have excellent interpersonal and communication skills (verbal and written).
  • You have introductory experience, or the desire to learn, data tools and software such as SQL, SAS, MicroStrategy, and Unica.

Application Instructions:

  1. Apply directly on Bell‚Äôs career page.
  2. Submit a resume and most recent transcripts (unofficial accepted).
  3. When prompted, indicate three role profiles that interest you. Before submitting your application, please visit jobs.bell.ca/ca/en/campus-glp-customer-operations for more information on each of the following role profiles:
    1. Customer Experience Strategy, Design and Delivery
    2. Operations and Business Strategy
    3. Digital Advocacy (Web and App)
    4. Application Developer
    5. Communications and Brand Development
    6. Marketing Campaigns and Pricing Strategy
    7. Channel Sales Strategy
    8. Product Management (Internet, TV, 5G and IoT)
    9. Business Intelligence Analyst, Operational Insight and Support
    10. Machine Learning Developer
