title: Data Engineer, Investment Finance
description:
The Data Engineer, Investment Finance will report to the Manager, Financial Systems & Workflows, Investment Finance and will be responsible for supporting the Investment Finance team through designing, developing, implementing and maintaining the departmental data strategy that capitalizes on low-code solutions to enable robust data, analytics, and reporting, as well as playing a key role in collaborating with the stakeholders to identify data requirements and providing insightful analytic data and visualization solutions. The role requires an understanding of finance and investment data with a keen desire to explore new technologies and implement innovated solutions.

CORE RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Develop, implement and the support the Investment Finance data strategy to manage structured and unstructured data that integrates the data into a data solution to support BI solutions, reporting and business processes
  • Provide innovative data solutions by working with stakeholders and across functional areas to understand and gather data objectives, and identify opportunities for improvement for data analysis, reporting and visualizations
  • Design, develop, and help maintain data assets to extract, transform, and load data from various data files, and databases, and to make them accessible for various applications and reporting tools that enable analytics and reporting
  • Automate manual processes and optimize data ingestion and delivery to support departmental data needs, reporting and business processes
  • Partner with the Investment Finance Business Analysts to develop reports and PowerBI dashboards
  • Support and troubleshoot existing investment data applications and BI reporting solutions as needed
  • Work across functional areas (with team members, investment professionals and leaders) to understand and identify data objectives, and provide solutioning that supports analytics, reporting and downstream data requirements

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Strong experience with data management, investment systems, business intelligence, and reporting technologies
  • Experience working with complex data structures and developing efficient queries to create calculated fields and data aggregates (5+ years)
  • Relevant experience in data science and analytics in creating/maintaining investment and financial data models (5+ years)
  • Proven experience designing and developing dashboards using PowerBI (3+ years)
  • Proficient in ETL tools (such as Alteryx), cloud-based data platforms/systems (such as Azure, Snowflake), process automation, and standardization
  • Strong communication skills (written and verbal), with strong team orientation and great customer focus
  • Critical thinking skills with the ability to independently solve problems with data and/or reference documents
  • Good understanding of investment and finance products
  • Data governance experience is an asset
  • Track of record working in a role that intersects with business and technical analysis to support existing solutions, delivering new solutions, and contributing to investment system implementations and upgrades
  • Bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Finance, or a related field

Our story:

Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada‚Äôs largest defined benefit pension plans, with $121 billion in net assets as at December 31, 2021. OMERS is a jointly-sponsored pension plan, with 1,000 participating employers ranging from large cities to local agencies, and over half a million active, deferred and retired members. OMERS members include union and non-union employees of municipalities, school boards, local boards, transit systems, electrical utilities, emergency services and children‚Äôs aid societies across Ontario. Contributions to the Plan are funded equally by members and employers. OMERS teams work in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe ‚Äì serving members and employers and originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate.

OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives.

title: Director, Treasury Quantitative Analytics
description:
We‚Äôre building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what‚Äôs right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

Treasury Analytics supports the senior Treasury leadership team in establishing the analytical and systems framework to measure, model, and optimize retail product risks and customer behavior. This support consists of pricing new and existing retail banking products, forecasting P/L, and transfer pricing the interest-rate and optionality risk from retail SBU‚Äôs into Treasury for hedging. Treasury Analytics also manages the customer behavior risk to optimally maintain minimal customer behavior risk in the Canadian Retail Balance Sheet.

As the Director, Treasury Analytics, you will support Senior Directors to evolve and expand the mandate of Treasury Analytics, providing strategy and leading the management of individual cashflow modeling programs. You will drive insights, identify inherent risk drivers of consumer products and relate relate modeling risk specifications back to the business. This requires the ability to think critically, dive into the underlying mechananics of the specific problems and translate complex concepts into program enhancements and specification to Technology for development. This is a high visibility role where the Director must effectively communicate complex problems and solutions to senior treasury executives and LOB.

Additionally, you will maintain/enhance the analytics infrastructure developed in Treasury Analytics used to conduct analysis of how consumer behavior affects retail product cash-flows and the use of embedded options; to assist in developing business requirements; to assist in appling advanced statistical models and financial engineering techniques to quantify and ensure mimimal consumer behaviour risk. You will also assist in implementing/applying advanced analytics for optimization, reporting, P/L decomp and back-testing, and risk factor simulation and to interpret and explain any resulting output. This is a unique opportunity that involves leadership and development of the Treasury Analytics functions and expansion of mandates.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You‚Äôll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you‚Äôll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote.

How You‚Äôll Succeed

  • Management and Enhancement of Cash-Flow Modeling Books - Leadership role to specify and model the retail risk representation in the cashflow modeling book (CFMB). This includes working with the LOB to understand any behavioural changes and strategic thinking to evolve the program to effectively model and hedge risk. Liase with Treasury CFO group to interpret and explain cash-flow modeling P/L variability. Enhancing PnL decomposition and signing off on daily cash-flow modeling P/L.

  • Financial/Derivative Analytics - Ensure pricing and risk analytics capture all hedge-able risks as is practical. This will include work to prototype pricing and hedge of fixed income derivatives. Maintain/Develop analytics/methodologies for transfer pricing new retail products, assess new and existing retail product profitability, and cash-flow modeling book.

  • Consumer Behavior Analytics - Apply customer behaviour calibration techniques for Treasury Analytics‚Äô parameter review. Incorporate consumer behavior models into the funds transfer pricing and hedging processes. Collaborate in the development, continuous improvement and ongoing expansion of an analytics library with appropriate tools, models and techniques for modeling of customer behaviour and interest rate risks.

  • Systems and Support (Infrastructure) - Lead development and implementation of various strategic business initiatives. This includes liaise with various groups within CIBC to explain methodologies, and procedures developed within Treasury Analytics to assess analytic/data requirements for future business activities and resolve any issues which arise. Lead the maintenance of pricing, risk and mathematical analytics library supporting integration across all Treasury systems that are used for Bank-wide benchmarking to validate pricing or risk. This will ensure consistency of risk measures across different risk platforms and measures and mitigate model risk.

  • Quantitative Analysis - Lead the implementation of sophisticated mathematical modeling, processes or algorithms to conduct analysis. Ensure operational effectiveness to deliver analytics capabilities, ensuring that outputs are correct and reproducible, and proper documentation to explain methods.

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience. In ALM, Product Analytics, and Risk Management with a bank and/or other financial institution. You have strong work experience in applied mathematical, quantitative analytics, statistical, or stochastic modeling. Strong system and quantitative programming skills using C/C++/Python/R/SQL or high-level languages. Experience in working with banking retail products such as commitments, mortgages or GICs.

  • It‚Äôs an asset. Experience in quantitative analytics with a bank and/or other financial institution in areas of valuation, hedging and risk measurement is a strong asset. Exposure to valuation and risk metrics of various interest rate derivatives will be an asset.

  • You can demonstrate knowledge. In financial economics, financial mathematics such as fixed income theory, statistics, treasury processes, risk management and balance sheet modeling techniques. You have strong theoretical understanding of financial economics, financial mathematics, statistics, risk management and option modeling techniques. Ability to express modeling insights with an aptitude for explaining PnL and risk drivers. Experience in advanced GLM (including Cox regression), panel time series and model selection.

  • You have a degree/diploma. Masters/Doctoral degree in mathematics, computer science, quantitative finance, engineering, statistics and/or related technical subject.

  • You‚Äôre goal oriented. You‚Äôre motivated by accomplishing your goals and delivering your best to make a difference.

  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems and making sense of information. You communicate detailed information in a meaningful way. Ability to express modeling insights with an aptitude for explaining PnL and risk drivers. Creative problem solver and strong analytical skills.

  • You\'re motivated by collective success. You know that teamwork can transform a good idea into a great one. You know that an inclusive team that enjoys working together can bring a vision to life.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.

  • We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.

  • Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.

  • We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit.

Job Location

161 Bay Street, 39th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

Asset and Liability Management (ALM), Behavior Modeling, C++ Programming Language, Communication, Critical Thinking, Financial Modeling, Fixed Income Valuation, Hedging, PL/SQL (Programming Language), Product Analytics, Python (Programming Language), Risk Management, R Programming, Treasury Management

title: Manager, Data Platforms Risk & Audit Management - CID&A
description:
Requisition ID: 175932

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Purpose:

The Data Platform Management team is looking for a Manager, Data Platforms Risk & Audit Management to lead the team‚Äôs risk management and audit remediation activities. Working with the Data Office, technology partners and risk and audit stakeholder, this role will be responsible for ensuring alignment between our data platform strategy and roadmaps with committed audit deliverables and for leading the design and execution of a risk and audit management program.

The selected candidate will play a crucial part in defining and implementing a Data Risk and Control Framework and its associated processes for Data Risk identification, monitoring and reporting, partnering with various businesses and functions to strengthen CID&A‚Äôs Risk Management practices.


Accountabilities:

‚Ä¢ Develop and execute a framework for risk and audit issues management, including the creation of a risk and audit issue registry for data platforms.
‚Ä¢ Track risk and audit remediation tasks and ensure they are being addressed in a timely and effective manner.
‚Ä¢ Coordinate issue remediation activities with and drive a consistent engagement from issue owners and stakeholders across the organization.
‚Ä¢ Provide subject matter expertise and act as the primary point of contact for risk and audit management activities.
‚Ä¢ Support and maintain Data Platforms risk and audit related documentation and tools
‚Ä¢ Manage follow-ups on the new findings raised from regulatory and internal divisional audits to ensure all deliverables are up-to-date and properly documented.
‚Ä¢ Assess risks, identify key controls, and document appropriate risk mitigation plans to execute on audit deliverables. Applicants should be able to identify control gaps effectively and efficiently, as well as summarize and clear findings with senior stakeholders.
‚Ä¢ Ensure data platform roadmaps are in alignment with audit commitments and include solutions to address identified risks.
‚Ä¢ Support Issue Owners in defining Management Action Plans in response to new audit findings.
‚Ä¢ Communicate risk and audit issues to executive leadership and provide insights and recommendations for risk management strategies.
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure alignment and consistency in risk management practices.

What we're looking for:

‚Ä¢ Experience auditing design and operating effectiveness of data controls frameworks in large scale organizations or an experienced IT Risk professional with an interest and desire to expand into data controls framework.
‚Ä¢ The ability to effectively manage senior stakeholder relationships, building credibility and trust, demonstrating strong communication, technology and auditing skills and business understanding to effectively influence and negotiate with stakeholders.
‚Ä¢ Experience managing large projects in complex operational environments and working with multiple stakeholders across the organization.
‚Ä¢ Ability to independently perform and manage risk and controls assessments, end-to-end, and ability to effectively collaborate with audit teams and stakeholders.
‚Ä¢ Strong communications skills to facilitate meetings with various stakeholders, communicate ambiguous topics in a structured manner and deliver presentations/demos.
‚Ä¢ Attention to details, high standards for quality.


It would be nice if you had...

‚Ä¢ Experience in IT audit, cloud implementations and data migrations.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of Google Cloud Platform data capabilities.
‚Ä¢ Experience auditing business applications including application controls, access, and security administration.
‚Ä¢ Experience of data analytics and data visualization would be highly desirable: the ability to utilise and analyse data to highlight control gaps and areas for improvement would be of benefit.
‚Ä¢ Prior experience with Data Management projects such as Data Governance, Data Quality, Master Data Management, Reference Data Management, Metadata Management; Hands-on experience defining and testing data controls.
‚Ä¢ Excellent problem-solving skills, ability to see the big picture with high attention to critical details.
‚Ä¢ Bilingual in Spanish would be an asset.


Requirements & Qualifications:

‚Ä¢ Post-Secondary education completed. Advanced degree preferred but not mandatory
‚Ä¢ 5+ years of experience in data management, data governance, internal control, risk management, compliance, audit and/or related areas
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of database platforms, ETLs and reporting/BI tools preferred

title: Business Intelligence Specialist
description:
Company Overview

Tell us your story. Don‚Äôt go unnoticed. Explain why you‚Äôre a winning candidate. Think ‚ÄúTD‚Äù if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.

Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here‚Äôs our story: jobs.td.com

Department Overview

What does TD Data & Analytics stand for? For starters, we believe in visionary leadership and insights. We believe in using every resource at our disposal to better serve our clients, and this includes our vast data. Key objectives include driving business value, adopting key platforms, upholding reporting principles, simplifying and optimizing operations, supporting an inclusive environment and enhancing the colleague experience. The Business Intelligence group delves into our data, past and present, to develop crucial metrics and reporting functionality that better informs and optimizes key businesses decisions across the organization. This is the team building the tools, reports, dashboards, cubes and scorecards that deliver and process vital data to business partners across the enterprise. Joining us in Business Intelligence & Reporting is an opportunity to advance and deepen your career and to help TD serve its customers in a way we never have before.

Job Description

Job Description

Data & analytics is something you‚Äôre passionate about. Leading the Fraud Analytics and Reporting pod, you will work closely with partners in Fraud Strategy and Fraud Operation to determine analytical solutions that will drive performance, risk and mitigation strategies that align with business objectives.
Most importantly, your coaching and leadership inspires leadership in others, driving them to execute with speed, and collaborate with one goal in mind: make TD the better bank.

Sound good so far? Fantastic! We are looking for an experienced BI Specialist/Product Owner to own and deliver on a portfolio of highly complex Fraud reports/dashboards in collaboration with a large, diverse and inclusive team of data, analytics, and reporting practitioners. Together, you‚Äôll help champion best-in-class business intelligence capabilities by measuring and driving value for business stakeholders, focusing on stories that drive action, align with standardized reporting principles, and enhancing our colleague experience.

As a Business Intelligence Specialist / Product Owner, you will:

  • Lead discussions intended to unlock and identify Fraud business drivers, definitions and metrics in order to interpret findings, act and provide strategic direction.
  • Prioritize and manage the Fraud portfolio reporting backlog, working with Fraud executives and analytics teams to define clear reporting requirements for new outputs. Continuously iterate, ensuring that features and user stories are scoped and prioritized;
  • Collaborate with data owners to identify data elements and business leads to elicit information requirements and articulate those requirements in a manner that can be easily understood by data and reporting delivery pods;
  • Deliver and/or review presentations and communications to executive audiences and various working groups;
  • Have a deep understanding of business / technology, organizational practices and disciplines;
  • Plan effective test and learn scenarios for various programs or scenarios, leading a cross functional pod towards a singular objective;
  • Adhere to internal policies/procedures and applicable regulatory guidelines, contribute to the review of internal processes and activities and assist in identifying potential opportunities to improve operational efficiencies;
  • Manage issues raised by business stakeholders and work with delivery partners to streamline and improve existing reporting to eliminate errors and redundancies;
  • Apply judgement, discretion and collaborate with internal partners to navigate and resolve ambiguous issues;
  • Provide on-going communications on project status and systems capabilities, participate in agile ceremonies (standups, planning, retros, showcases), express new ideas for improving product value;
  • Work with colleagues and stakeholders located in various remote sites, generally US or Canada;
  • Generally, focus on broad range of complex issues that may span from medium ‚Äì long term issues (e.g. 6-12 months).

Requirements

Job Requirements

  • The ideal candidate should have 7+ years of relevant experience in business or financial reporting/business data analysis and reporting, knowledgeable and savvy with new technology and tools preferably within the global financial services / financial crimes and fraud management industries;
  • Demonstrated relationship building skills ‚Äì strong collaborator who successfully engages executive leadership, business-line and infrastructure/support partners in a matrix environment, gives direction to colleagues and, makes things happen through using positive influence. Experience leading ‚ÄòDesign Thinking‚Äô sessions would be an asset;
  • Strong analytically-anchored problem-solving skills ‚Äì a logical and strategic thinker with strong critical reasoning skills, proactively identifies risks and issues, recommends solutions, challenges the status quo;
  • Energetic, enthusiastic, pro-active self-starter ‚Äì willing to ‚Äúroll up the sleeves‚Äù to deliver results in the short-term while building for the long-term; agile, adaptable, ‚Äòcan-do‚Äô attitude, high degree of responsiveness and initiative;
  • Excellent oral and written skills, and demonstrated ability to digest complex information and summarize in a clear, concise fashion (for executive-level consumption);
  • Robust organizational skills with the ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple deadlines and priorities, with a proven track record of executing with excellence and making an impact.
  • Comfortable accessing large data sources, performing mining, extractions and manipulations to uncover relevant data findings and big-picture stories;
  • Very strong working knowledge of MS Excel, MS PowerPoint, MS Access, MS Word, MS Outlook, MS OneNote;
  • Background building and using business intelligence, analytics and/or data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Alteryx, PowerBI, etc.);
  • Experience developing and maintaining reporting environments across multiple platforms (e.g. Star Schema, ETL, reporting data layer, etc.) with exposure to programming and data environments (e.g. SQL, VBA, SAS, Hadoop, R, Python, etc.);

Additional Information

#LI-Hybrid #businessintelligence

Hours

37.5

Inclusiveness

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

title: Data Scientist - CID&A
description:
Requisition ID: 176950

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Purpose:

Banking Banking Analytics is responsible for providing unbiased, customer-focused insights on business initiatives across the Bank, and for developing analytical processes and platforms for use across the Bank that highlight opportunities to acquire, grow and retain customers. Within this department, the Data Scientist, Business Banking Analytics is responsible for solving complex data and analytical problems, using quantitative approaches with a unique blend of analytical, technical and business skills. The incumbent uses their advanced analytical skills to develop analytical assets that will help the Bank achieve its business objectives.

The incumbent will work closely with internal business lines, data stewards and other internal stakeholders to drive business value, and recommend solutions to drive client acquisition, retention, balance growth, cross-sell/up-sell, product activation and usage. The incumbent will require a combination of business focus, strong analytical and problem solving skills and programming knowledge to quickly draw insights from large, disparate data sources to support Bank strategies.

Excellent written and communication skills are required and the Data Scientist will work closely with the Senior Data Scientist to conduct analytics and present insights/findings in impactful and easy-to-understand terms for business partners and senior management. Finally, the incumbent is responsible for developing and mentoring a team of senior level analytic staff, and instilling a customer-centric view of analysis within the organization.

Major Accountabilities:

  • Expert in analyzing large, complex multi-dimensional datasets in structured and unstructured format.
  • Provide support to various partners and stakeholders across Business Banking by leading in the discovery process to identify business requirements and expected outcome.
  • Develop innovative and effective approaches and apply statistical, predictive modelling techniques and to solve client‚Äôs analytics problems and communicate results and methodologies to business clients and senior members of the analytics team.
  • Prepare detailed documentation to outline data sources, models and algorithms used and developed
  • Present and depict the rationale of findings in easy to understand terms for the business or senior management.
  • Stay current on trends in the data science and fin-tech product space, translate those trends into actionable strategic and tactical objectives for the company.
  • Contribute to a culture of innovation inside and outside of the company as a visionary capable of inspiring through presentation, demonstration and leading by example.


Requirements & Qualifications:

  • Excellent understanding of Predictive Analysis and Machine Learning techniques like Random Forests, Neural Networks, NLP, clustering and other similar techniques.
  • Solid analytical skills. Must be comfortable working with large amounts of information in a data lake environment and translating data into clear and concise findings.
  • Strong data engineering / data pipeline skills ‚Äì the ability to understand how to efficiently build model pipelines to support production ready models
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills. Boardroom level oral/written communication & presentation skills in a client-facing setting.
  • Strong programming skills in Python and SQL.
  • Knowledge of Bank Information Systems, such as product and reporting systems, including finance systems, Salesforce, GDAP, and the Enterprise Data Lake, an asset.
  • Experience using common machine learning algorithms in Python, GCP.
  • Experience using and implementing visualization tools like PowerBI and/or Tableau.
  • Knowledge of the Business Banking products and services an asset.

Educational Requirements:

  • University degree in relevant STEM discipline (Computer Sciences, Electrical/Computer/Software Engineering, Mathematics). Master‚Äôs Degree or Ph. D preferred.

title: Research Director
description:
What‚Äôs the opportunity?

Borealis AI is looking for a Research Director. The role includes directing a team of machine learning researchers and managing other research team leads with the goal of delivering AI-based products for the financial services industry. In addition, you will provide leadership and deliver on initiatives that improve the effectiveness of the entire research organization.

Your responsibilities include:

  • To join the Borealis AI research leadership team and shape the research organization as a whole and contribute to its overall performance.
  • To work with the Borealis AI business development team to identify viable artificial intelligence products that will add significant value to RBC stakeholders.
  • To lead a team of machine learning researchers delivering cutting edge AI technology to support these products.
  • To partner with Borealis AI‚Äôs product and engineering teams to ensure the seamless delivery of these products.
  • To manage other research team leads and provide guidance and support.
  • To help recruit, mentor and retain a high-performing research team across Borealis AI.

You‚Äôre our ideal candidate if you have:

  • A Ph.D. degree in Computer Science or a related technical field;
  • 10 years of experience leading research teams in machine learning in a product-centric environment or equivalent experience;
  • A track record of successful people management including mentoring junior researchers and engineers, experienced high-performance researchers, and research managers;
  • Experience delivering successful high-impact machine learning products
  • Involvement across the research and development lifecycle, from prototyping to production, engaging with stakeholders to develop solutions that meet business needs;
  • Broad research interests and detailed knowledge of cutting edge machine learning techniques across multiple areas;
  • The ability to formulate and drive multiple research projects independently;
  • Exceptional communication and leadership skills;
  • A history of high quality academic publications (e.g., NeurIPS, CVPR, AISTATS, ICLR, ICML etc.) and community recognition for excellence;

What\'s in it for you?

  • Become part of a team that thinks progressively and works collaboratively. We care about seeing each other reach full potential;
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock options where applicable;
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact from a local-to-global scale

About Borealis AI

Borealis AI, a RBC Institute for Research, is a research centre dedicated to achieving state-of-the-art in machine learning. Established in 2016, and with labs in Toronto, Montreal, Waterloo and Vancouver, we support academic collaborations and partner with world-class research centres in artificial intelligence. With a focus on ethical AI that will help communities thrive, our machine learning scientists perform fundamental and applied research in areas such as reinforcement learning, natural language processing, deep learning, and unsupervised learning to solve ground-breaking problems in diverse fields.

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

RBC is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status, Aboriginal/Native American status or any other legally-protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the application process are available upon request.

title: First Nations/Metis/Inuit - Manager Collections Strategy Data Analytics, Remote Career Opportunity
location: Canada : Manitoba : Winnipeg || Canada : Alberta : Calgary || Canada : Alberta : Edmonton || Canada : British Columbia : Vancouver || Canada : Ontario : Windsor
description:
Requisition ID: 176220

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Posted pursuant to Scotiabank‚Äôs Special Program under the Employment Equity Act and Canadian Human Rights Act.

While you must be an Indigenous person in order to submit your resume, participation is completely voluntary. Please use the definition below to make sure you‚Äôre eligible and open to self-identifying as Indigenous person:

Indigenous peoples include status, non-status First Nation, M√©tis and Inuit people. Only those Indigenous peoples who come from Canada should identify themselves as belonging to this designated group

Job Purpose:

Working within Global Risk Management, you will be responsible for driving improvements in collection strategies by leading the production of policies, strategies and data driven analyses that result in actionable insights that improve the Bank‚Äôs loan losses & profitability.

Job Responsibilities:

  1. Participate in the strategic management of debt collections by:
  • Leading the design, implementation, monitoring and management of Collection strategies for Canadian portfolios to mitigate credit losses by testing and assigning appropriate treatments to delinquent accounts
  • Ensuring all credit risks associated with collections are understood and quantified with effective management reporting, across all components of collections (People, Data, Process, Technology, Strategy, Control Quality and Vendor Management)
  • Lead continuous improvement of all components of collections from a credit risk perspective, leveraging risk technology and by working within the minimum standards defined in the global collections policy
  • Mitigating risks/loss to the Bank by ensuring adherence to credit risk management policies and operational guidelines
  • Continue to be fully aware of industry trends and opportunities as related to technology, process and decision science
  • Ensuring future enhancements continue to be identified and implemented
  • Support reorganizations/projects to create a Collections organization that is aligned with business partner‚Äôs strategic focus

2. Lead initiatives to strengthen the Collections risk and operational effectiveness and efficiency. Continually champion new growth opportunities which lend themselves to the Bank‚Äôs goal of improving productivity, enhancing service and reducing costs by:

  • Promoting the reengineering of processes to lower loan losses, improve dollars collected, improve productivity and reduce costs

  • Streamlining and/or integrating automation and technology
  • Continually challenging the ‚Äòstatus quo‚Äô through innovation
  • Support construction of a Centre of Excellence in Collections

Job Requirements:

title: Senior Machine Learning Engineering Consultant
description:
Description

Our team and what we‚Äôll accomplish together

As a ML Engineer at TELUS, you‚Äôll be in great company, working alongside some of the brightest and most creative Data Scientists, Data Engineers, and Strategists. You will be part of the journey we‚Äôre on to better understand our customers, to predict their needs and interaction behavior. With your expert knowledge and experience in Machine Learning, you will contribute to the development of state-of-the-art ML & AI driven solutions. Our team works in a fun, innovative, and challenging environment that directly influences the strategic direction and performance of the Marketing, Strategy & Data Insights team in our Home Solutions and Mobility business.

  • We provide opportunities for you to excel and show your stuff: work on high-value and high-visibility projects
  • We have flexible work styles with the ability to work in and out of the office
  • You will work in a team that actively supports your personal development with progressive training and development tools


What you‚Äôll do

  • Support and evolve the AI Insights roadmap by leveraging industry research, best practices, and emerging tools/technologies
  • Study and transform data science prototypes and design machine learning systems according to requirements for production
  • Select appropriate datasets and data representation methods
  • Execute, oversee, and evolve production ML models and algorithm selection to deliver solutions that are relevant and facilitate decision-making.
  • Build and maintain a strong engagement with key stakeholders to understand business needs and priorities
  • Identify opportunities for process/model optimization and refine to improve effectiveness/accuracy and enhance ROI
  • Collaborate with Data Scientists and Data Engineers within TELUS as well as external Data Science communities
  • Responsible for end-to-end engagement from problem definition to insight delivery as well as value realization & measurement

Qualifications

What you bring

  • You have 5 + years experience in a data related position
  • Extensive experience with ML frameworks, platforms and tools, and expert knowledge with GCP
  • You have solid development experience with Python and are comfortable with using GitHub and other programing languages

Great-to-haves

location: Canada : Ontario : North York || Canada : Ontario : Ajax || Canada : Ontario : Mississauga || Canada : Ontario : Scarborough || Canada : Ontario : Toronto
description:
Requisition ID: 172337

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Contributes to the overall success of the Fraud Management Group in Canada ensuring specific individual goals, plans, initiatives are executed / delivered in support of the team‚Äôs business strategies and objectives. Proactively contributes to the Fraud strategy by applying advanced analytics techniques to enhance fraud mitigation capabilities for multiple products across the Canadian Retail portfolio, including Day to Day Banking, Credit Cards, Unsecured Lending Products, Mortgages and Global Payments.

Accountabilities

Education / Experience

title: Senior Analytics Manager
description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you‚Äôre helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Analytics Manager

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

To be a part of a global, exciting and forward-thinking Data Products team within Internal Audit that is focused on building insight-driven applications and tools to provide enhanced assurance across our technology and operations organizations. As RBC continues to evolve in response to new challenges that impact financial markets across the globe, Internal Audit have been proactive in transforming their approach from traditional auditing, to data-informed decision making when assessing and challenging the management of risk across the business.

The RBC CAE Group leverages a unique perspective‚Äî with a coordinated view across the entire business‚Äîto deliver valuable advice that not only gives assurance, but that illuminates a bigger picture, connects dots, builds best practices and broadens possibilities. In this role you will become a critical part of our journey to transform and automate our Internal Audit processes to better protect and enable the bank.

‚ÄãWhat will you do?

  • Apply your skills in data validation, exploration, statistical analysis and machine learning on a diverse range of data sources to identify insights and opportunities to develop data products.
  • Use your curiosity and own initiative to develop innovative solutions to a wide and ever-changing set of complex problems across RBC.
  • Drive the automation and implementation of powerful data-backed reports to stakeholders throughout the organization.
  • Automate and productionize the testing of key business controls to enable auditors in continuously monitoring key risks across the enterprise.
  • Collaborate with other data analysts, data engineers and data scientists within Internal Audit to scale your ideas from concept to production.
  • Design, develop and maintain productionized applications and dashboards for our end users.
  • Respond to data analysis inquiries from the internal audit team.

What do you need to succeed?

Must have

  • Degree in a quantitative field
  • Experience with either Python or R as well as SQL and other NoSQL DBs
  • Strong grasp of fundamentals in statistics (hypothesis testing, regression, inference)
  • Demonstrated experience exploring large, complex datasets for the purpose of anomaly detection and latent pattern recognition

Nice to have

  • Experience developing interactive and sophisticated dashboards in Tableau (or similar tool)
  • Experience working with Dataiku
  • Understanding of software engineering design principles
  • Experience building natural language processing (NLP) and unsupervised learning models
  • Demonstrated experience building strong relationships and communicating effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders

What‚Äôs in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Flexible work/life balance options

Job Summary

To be a part of a global, exciting and forward-thinking Data Products team within Internal Audit that is focused on building insight-driven applications and tools to provide enhanced assurance across our technology and operations organizations. As RBC continues to evolve in response to new challenges that impact financial markets across the globe, Internal Audit have been proactive in transforming their approach from traditional auditing, to data-informed decision making when assessing and challenging the management of risk across the business.

The RBC CAE Group leverages a unique perspective‚Äî with a coordinated view across the entire business‚Äîto deliver valuable advice that not only gives assurance, but that illuminates a bigger picture, connects dots, builds best practices and broadens possibilities. In this role you will become a critical part of our journey to transform and automate our Internal Audit processes to better protect and enable the bank.

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you‚Äôll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

Job Description:

The Client Experience Office (CXO) is an important pillar of Sun Life‚Äôs corporate strategy and as such, is seeking an experienced Senior Data Analyst to join our CXO Analytics team. This team is dedicated to supporting client growth and performance through extracting meaningful insights from enterprise data.

Reporting to the AVP, CXO Analytics, the Senior Data Analyst will play an integral role in migrating our existing Lead Program reporting from SAS to AWS through migrating the technology to our newest data stack and updating existing reporting to provide more insight, a robust data foundation, and easier to understand visuals. This is an exciting opportunity to build new reports using new data sources and new technology. Please note this is a 6-month contract opportunity.

What will you do?

  • Design and engineer data products in Tableau

  • Ensure that a high level of data quality and data integrity are maintained across all data sources

  • Convert complex business and technical rules into logic for data flows, data pipelines and dashboards

  • Develop visualization solutions that present data accurately and drive insights to guide business decisions and outcomes

  • Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand reporting needs

  • Work with our Data Enablement teams to implement data products for reporting needs

  • Perform ad-hoc analysis to help explore new data questions

What do you need to succeed?

  • 3-5 years of hands-on experience working with AWS technologies for data processing and analytics; demonstrated experience with relational database systems, relational models, and dimensional models

  • 3-5 years of experience with engineering data products as input to various analytical models

  • 3 years of experience in SQL with a proven track record in leveraging SQL and SQL-based programming to solve business problems

  • 2 years of experience with AWS Glue for ETL

  • Experience in building dashboards in Tableau or an equivalent tool, with the ability to produce well-designed interactive dashboards and automated reports

  • Proven experience working with complex data sources and various data types to develop robust data foundations and production-grade data products

  • Ability to translate complex business requirements into a set of data ingestion pseudocode

What would be nice to have?

  • Experience with Salesforce

  • Experience with SAS programming

  • Experience working in a large financial services organization

  • Knowledge of fundamental statistical models & techniques

What are the unique requirements?

  • The candidate selected for this role is required to attain Canadian Reliability Security Clearance (administered by submitting fingerprints to the RCMP, who then conduct minimum 5-year history checks)

  • To see if you are eligible for this clearance, please review the section 201 on the Federal Government site (https://www.tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca/esc-src/personnel/pdcf-rsrp-eng.html)

What‚Äôs in it for you?

  • Great Place to Work¬Æ Certified in Canada and the US - 2022

  • Great Place to Work¬Æ award for Best Workplaces for #HybridWork - 2022

  • Named ‚ÄúBest Places to Work‚Äù by Glassdoor - 2021

  • Canada Award for Excellence for Mental Health at Work - 2021

  • Flex hours and Flexible hybrid work model including in-country work-from-home if you prefer. #LI-Hybrid, #LI-Remote

  • Be part of our continuous improvement journey in developing the next greatest digital enterprise experience.

  • Work and professional development that is united by our Purpose: to help Clients and Employees achieve lifetime financial security and live healthier lives

The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted. It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors. In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance. Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results.

Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.

At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
