title: Senior Manager, Data Analytics & Reporting (FRC group)
description:
Company Overview

Tell us your story. Don‚Äôt go unnoticed. Explain why you‚Äôre a winning candidate. Think ‚ÄúTD‚Äù if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.

Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here‚Äôs our story: jobs.td.com

Department Overview

What does TD Data & Analytics stand for? For starters, we believe in visionary leadership and insights. We believe in using every resource at our disposal to better serve our clients, and this includes our vast data.

The Business Intelligence group delves into our data, past and present, to develop crucial metrics and reporting functionality that better informs and optimizes key businesses decisions across the organization.

This is the team building the tools, reports, dashboards, cubes and scorecards that deliver and process vital data to business partners across the enterprise.

Joining us in Business Intelligence & Reporting is an opportunity to advance and deepen your career and to help TD serve its customers in a way we never have before.

Job Description

Senior Manager, Data Analytics & Reporting, Finance Risk Controls will be responsible for executing the detailed analytical work related to production of oversight and governance reporting, running monthly/quarterly completeness checks and managing dashboards within TD‚Äôs data environment and suite of tools (e.g., HIVE, PySpark, Tableau). The individual will support the team in strengthening of internal controls and enhancing governance and Quality Check (QC) program for financial controls across the Bank. The individual will support the team(s) in ensuring compliance with Finance policies and effectiveness of controls related to financial reporting.

Specific Functions and Accountabilities

  • Managing end-to-end production of reports and dashboards supporting FRC in its mandate of oversight certain Finance policies and financial reporting controls
  • Executing data pipeline and performing data engineering tasks using big data processing tools like HIVE, PySpark
  • Performing bug fixes and updating existing business logic based on business feedback.
  • Creating new metrics/tables and integrating them into the data pipeline on an ongoing basis
  • Running any manual processes to support production of dashboards, e.g., preparing files for data ingestion into TD‚Äôs analytics environment
  • Understanding metrics and validating those metrics with business partners, validating data quality for key performance metrics and performing root-cause analysis for any discrepancies noted, in alignment with relevant business partners
  • Gathering requirements for creation of new metrics and reports for dashboards arising from evolving needs
  • Collaborating with business partners in sourcing and maintaining reports and dashboard
  • Leading review and walkthrough sessions with various business and technology partners
  • Maintaining, prioritizing and implementing a feature backlog based on user feedback
  • Enhancements of reporting and dashboard design to optimize dashboard performance
  • Supporting management supervision and review, ongoing training needs, and change management.
  • Supporting dashboard user access management
  • Documenting and setting up of operating procedures to support dashboard implementation e.g., data lineage, metric formulation, data modelling, use cases, etc.
  • Preparing ad hoc reports and presentations, as required

Requirements

Specific Educational and Professional Experience Requirements:

  • University degree in business analytics or other relevant fields
  • 5+ years experience in data analytics, reporting and business intelligence roles
  • Strong knowledge of big data processing tools like, Hive and HQL/SQL, Python and PySpark to extract and transform data
  • Advance working knowledge of MS Excel, VBA and PowerPoint is highly preferred
  • Experience in an accounting/finance role (financial services industry desirable)
  • Internal controls experience will be an asset
  • Familiarity with TD businesses, technology, finance and data ecosystem will be an asset
  • Financial reporting, process, operations, internal controls, audit experiences will be an asset
Professional Skills and Competencies Requirements:

  • Excellent problem-solving skillsets with ability to interpret new business requirements, undertake deep-dive analysis and translate findings into actionable data insights
  • Ability to work with numbers, large data sets and their interpretation for business impact
  • Ability to make recommendations based on a combination of data, professional judgment and common sense
  • Ability to navigate some level of ambiguity and execute
  • Ability to synthesize data, extract meaning and utilize relevant information to identify opportunities and provide recommendations
  • Effective communication skills (both written and verbal), organizational and time-management skills
  • Good understanding of financial statement assertions and their practical application in controls

Additional Information

#LI-Hybrid
#FinanceCareers

Hours

37.5

Inclusiveness

title: Data Engineer
location: Mississauga, ON L4Y1M4, CAN Mississauga, ON L4Y1M4, CAN
description:
Job Details

Description

Connect with us LinkedIn, Instagram, Facebook, Twitter

EllisDon is committed to being the safest general contractor. As part of our vaccine directive, we require employees to be fully vaccinated, or in the process of receiving the vaccine against COVID-19. Should you have any additional questions related to our vaccine directive as you move forward in the hiring process, please discuss this with our People & Culture team.

Thinking about a change?

We recognize that the construction industry is changing at a rapid pace and we continually strive to be at the forefront. Our core values empower people to deliver great careers and develop creative solutions for complex problems on some of the most intricate projects. It doesn‚Äôt matter what your expertise and craft is ‚Äì there are no boundaries. We are a group of leading professionals with a variety of expertise: engineers, investment bankers, superintendents, estimators, software engineers, accountants, lawyers, marketing and communications consultants, sustainability professionals, and project managers. As you can see, we are a diverse bunch.

In case you‚Äôre curious, here‚Äôs what the industry thinks of us and some cool things we have done.

You as a Data Engineer (Insight and Analytics) will:

  • Be a technical lead in the development of high-volume platforms & Data pipelines
  • Work with relevant stakeholders to identify sources of data and map out processes/data flow while researching opportunities for data acquisition and innovative new uses for existing data.
  • Design, construct, install, test, and maintain highly scalable data management systems while integrating new data management technologies into existing structures.
  • Develop ETL processes to move internal and external data into EllisDon's external cloud-based data lake: Develop separate ETL processes to move data from data lake to data warehouse(s).
  • Provide input and feedback to support continuous improvement in team processes

  • Providing thought leadership for all data solutions, including designing data solutions that meet and exceed customer expectations.

  • Continually improve our data pipelines and find innovative ways to maximize automation while recommending ways to improve data reliability, efficiency, and quality.

Is this the right role for you?

  • Have knowledge and understanding of Programming Languages: Python and/or Java, SQL, ETL methodologies and toolsets, AWS/Google ecosystem, Database design, MS SQL, MySQL and/or Redshift/Big Query and NoSQL
  • Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment and collaborative environment

EllisDon is proud to provide this unique career opportunity within a progressive environment with continuous learning and opportunity for growth, as well as a competitive compensation package.

Go ahead and be yourself. We'll pay you for it!

title: Expert Data Developer
description:
At CN, we work together to move our company‚Äîand North America‚Äîforward. Be part of our Information & Technology (I&T) team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. From enterprise architecture to operational technology, our teams use the agile methodology to automate and digitize our railroad ensuring our operations run optimally and safely and our employees can focus on value-added tasks. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!

Job Summary

The Expert, Data Developer is responsible for building, handling, and optimizing data pipelines. The role moves them effectively into production for key data and analytics consumers, shapes the enterprise Data as a Service (DaaS) model and delivers on Information and Technology (I&T) business models. The incumbent develops best practices and optimizes data pipelines to deliver products and services aligned with business expectations. Moreover, the position plays a pivotal role in operationalizing data and analytics initiatives, defining and building CN‚Äôs data integration and DaaS platform roadmap.

Main Responsibilities

Data Development

¬∑ Ensure optimal data delivery architecture and processes are consistent throughout ongoing projects

¬∑ Optimize CN‚Äôs data architecture to support the next generation of products and data initiatives

¬∑ Build, handle, and optimize data pipelines, moving them effectively into production for key data and analytics consumers

¬∑ Build data and domain event models, implement business rules, and scalable data pipelines

¬∑ Ensure compliance with data governance and security requirements while creating, improving, and operationalizing integrated and reusable data pipelines

¬∑ Enable faster data access, integrate data reuse, and improve time-to-solution for data and analytics initiatives

¬∑ Integrate analytics and data science results with business processes

¬∑ Promote effective data management practices

¬∑ Collaborate with Data Science, Reporting, Analytics, and other Development teams to build data pipelines, infrastructure, and tooling to support business initiatives

¬∑ Oversee the design and maintenance of data pipelines and contribute to the continual enhancement of the data development architecture

¬∑ Collaborate with the team to meet performance, scalability, and reliability goals

¬∑ Maintain and expand existing systems, tooling, and infrastructure

¬∑ Design and develop Exact, Transfer and Load (ETL) pipelines using multiple sources of data in various formats and deploy them to achieve a high-level of reliability, scalability, and security

Data Design

¬∑ Collaborate with stakeholders and architects to model data landscape and define secure data exchange approaches

¬∑ Meet with stakeholders to identify fit-for-purpose within CN‚Äôs existing data ecosystem and deliver options and agile solutions

¬∑ Design and develop processing pipelines that ingest data into the Data Platforms

¬∑ Expose the data into meaningful formats so that it can be easily consumed

¬∑ Provide day-to-day support and technical expertise to both technical and
non-technical teams

¬∑ Participate in building data development expertise and framework

¬∑ Translate business needs into technical requirements

Data Operations and Quality Assurance

¬∑ Use Agile methodologies and development practices to streamline project delivery aligned with goals, timelines, and budgets and for code reviews and testing to develop and deliver data pipelines

¬∑ Build monitoring and debugging tools to analyze data pipelines

¬∑ Help unify software development and operations seamlessly, efficiently, and cost effectively

¬∑ Improve software quality, automate processes, and accelerate software releases

¬∑ Develop and implement test plans and scripts for various data quality processes

¬∑ Maintain manual and automated test scripts

Working Conditions

The role has standard working conditions in an office environment with a regular workweek from Monday to Friday and is eligible to participate in CN‚Äôs flexible work from home policy. Due to the nature of the role, the incumbent must be able to meet tight deadlines, handle pressure, and stress.

Requirements

Experience

Data Development

¬∑ Minimum 10 years of overall work experience

¬∑ Minimum 5 years demonstrating technical leadership qualities or overseeing deliverables

¬∑ Minimum 7 years of experience in a data development role, working in different data management disciplines including data integration, modelling, optimization and quality

o Experience working in cross-functional teams and collaborating with business stakeholders in support of a departmental or multi-departmental data management and analytics initiative

Education/Certification/Designation

¬∑ Bachelor\'s Degree in Computer Science, Electrical Development or Software Development

¬∑ Master‚Äôs Degree or Doctor of Philosophy in Data Management, Data Analytics, Information Systems, or a related quantitative field*

¬∑ Professional Engineer (P.Eng.) Degree*

¬∑ Google or Azure Data Development certification*

*Any designation for these above would be considered as an asset

Competencies

¬∑ Inspires others with impactful communications and adapts to the audience through speech and writing

¬∑ Applies analytical thinking

¬∑ Innovates through problem solving

¬∑ Knows the business and stays current with industry trends to elevate expertise and work

¬∑ Demonstrates organizational abilities

¬∑ Collaborates with key internal stakeholders to enable higher productivity

¬∑ Works independently with little supervision

Technical Skills/Knowledge

¬∑ Knowledge of Scala, Java or Python

¬∑ Knowledge of software development best practices such as code reviews, testing frameworks, maintainability, and readability

¬∑ Knowledge of Big Data technologies and cloud platforms such as Databricks, Apache Spark, Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Explorer, Azure Data Lake, Google BigQuery, Google Dataproc, Google Cloud Data Fusion, Google Dataflow, Google Cloud Composer, Google, Dataprep, Google Dataplex, Google BigLake, Google Vertex

¬∑ Knowledge of event-driven architecture (e.g., Pub-Sub, Kafka, Message Queuing (MQ), Message Queuing Telemetry Transport (MQTT), Advanced Message Queuing Protocol (AMQP), Event Hub, Logstash)

¬∑ Knowledge of Linux and shell scripting

¬∑ Knowledge of multiple database technologies such as Distributed Processing (i.e., Spark, Hadoop), traditional Rational Database Management Systems (RDBMS) (i.e., Oracle, Database 2 (DB2), PostgreSQL), Non-Structured Query Language (NoSQL) (i.e., MongoDB, FireBase)

¬∑ Knowledge of Development Operations (DevOps) and Azure DevOps for Continuous Integration (CI) and Continuous Deployment (CD) Data Pipelines



About CN

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada‚Äôs Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.

For internal candidates, note that the grade level of the position will depend on the employee\'s experience.

CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

title: Analyst, SAP Data Conversion and Governance
description:
At CN, we work together to move our company‚Äîand North America‚Äîforward. Be part of our Information & Technology (I&T) team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. From enterprise architecture to operational technology, our teams use the agile methodology to automate and digitize our railroad ensuring our operations run optimally and safely and our employees can focus on value-added tasks. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!

Job Summary

The Analyst, SAP Data Conversion and Governance contributes to the SAP ecosystem roadmap by planning, executing and providing expertise on data-related activities. The role is instrumental as CN is currently undertaking a large multi-year business transformation program triggered by a SAP ECC to a SAP S/4 HANA product migration.

The incumbent works within a multi-disciplinary team and participates in a variety of data activities, namely: profiling, quality assessment and cleansing of master and transactional data objects, including establishment of data cleansing strategies and their implementation; master data mapping, transformation and enrichment, to account for new SAP product data models and business transformation requirements; and data governance and management tasks on approval workflows, configurations and processes to ensure data objects maintain compliance to CN quality standards throughout their lifecycle.

The incumbent contributes to data validation runs, troubleshooting, data reconciliation and identification of corrective actions prior to production migrations.

The position helps develop skills and experience in setting up and managing best-in-class data pipelines that are becoming essential building block in industries adopting data-centric digital transformation approaches.

Main Responsibilities

Data Profiling and Cleansing ‚Äì Data-Related Tasks on the ‚ÄúAs-Is‚Äù Environment ‚Äì 30%

Participates in data objects identification and business rules profiling

Performs data quality assessment and quality metrics reporting

Participates in manual/automated data object cleansing strategies and their implementation

Collaborates to the iterative post-cleansing validation and implementation of corrective measures

Leverages off-the-shelf and specialized tools to carry out tasks

Data Mapping and Transformation - Data-Related Tasks on the ‚ÄúTo-Be‚Äù Environment ‚Äì 40%

Participates in identification and design of functional data mapping, transformation and enrichment activities and documentation according to the business process re-engineering efforts and new S/4 HANA data structures

Implements sandbox solutions to assess data mapping and transformation methods, including algorithms

Performs iterative validation runs and implement corrective measures on conversions

Leverages off-the-shelf and specialized tools and conversion platforms to carry out tasks

Data Governance and Management - Data-Related Tasks on the Data Lifecycle and Enhancements ‚Äì 30%

Identifies, implements, and validates governance workflow and data business rules requirements for master data management, in conjunction with business owners

Takes part in data quality assessment on target systems

Implements data governance roadmap and strategy on specialized data management tools and platforms

Participates in functional designs and documentation, system configuration, and validation

Maps enterprise-level data governance requirements into SAP landscape

Working Conditions

The role has standard working conditions in an office environment with a regular workweek from Monday to Friday. Due to the nature of the role, the incumbent must be able to meet tight deadlines, handle pressure, and stress.

Requirements

Experience

Managing and Handling Enterprise Data

Between 1 to 3 years of experience in managing and handling enterprise data

Education/Certification/Designation

Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in a technical or business field, with an interest in data management

Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Business Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science or Engineering*

*Any designation for these above would be considered as an asset

Competencies

Inspires others with impactful communications and adapts to the audience through speech and writing

Applies analytical thinking

Innovates through problem solving

Knows the business and stays current with industry trends to elevate expertise and work

Demonstrates organizational abilities

Collaborates with key internal stakeholders to enable higher productivity

Works independently with little supervision

Technical Skills/Knowledge

Strong interest in managing and validating data, understanding its attributes, characteristics and business value.

Hands-on experience in planning and executing general Extract-Transform-Load (ETL) data tasks*

Experience with Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems, in particular SAP (SAP ECC, SAP S/4 HANA)*

Strong interest in business processes and the way data interrelates to those processes

Interest in exploring data, performing investigation and analysis, and applying resolution and validation in complex data sets

Knowledge of Excel or equivalent productivity tools

Ability and interest in developing advanced user knowledge of specialized data management platforms and tools such as Syniti Advanced Data Migration (ADM), SAP Master Data Governance (MDG), SAP Utopia, SAP Asset Information Workbench (AIW)

Ability to present and communicate results clearly

Knowledge of Structured Query Language (SQL) statements and scripting, including SQL Server Management Studio*

*Any knowledge for any of the above would be considered as an asset

Organizational Impact

Decision Making & Impacts

The position performs data-centric tasks that are foundational to the SAP ecosystem roadmap and lifecycle

Level of Interaction/Influence

The Analyst, SAP Data Conversion and Governance interacts with business and Information and Technology (I&T) data experts, Coordinators, Data Technology Specialists, Solution Architects, enterprise-level data governance teams, as well as working closely with their business and functional counterparts in Finance, Procurement, Supply Management, Mechanical and Engineering organizations.

Employees Supervised/Organizational Structure

The Analyst, SAP Data Conversion and Governance reports to the Senior Manager, SAP S/4 HANA Transformation, Data Governance and Migration, Information and Technology. The role has no supervisory responsibilities.

Join us!

Role description:

The Data Movement Service Expert is responsible for designing, building, managing, and optimizing domain-agnostic batch and stream data pipelines, moving them effectively from the source/system of record, shaping the enterprise Source Data Product, and delivering it for consumption. This includes defining solution score and plan architecture, collaborating with Enterprise Architecture and other solution architects, and providing the direction in the delivery of the solution to designers & integrators. More precisely, the Expert builds the solution, drives alignment of the proposed solution with the Enterprise & Domain strategies, master plans & roadmaps, and manages risk mitigation, and as required drives issue escalation & resolution related to the architecture. The experts sign off on architecture where he/she does have the delegation authority and governs the implementation of the architecture during the design phase.

Main Responsibilities:

Data Engineering

¬∑ Ensure optimal data delivery architecture and processes are consistent throughout ongoing projects.

¬∑ Optimize CN‚Äôs data architecture to support the next generation of products and data initiatives.

¬∑ Build, manage, and optimize data pipelines, moving them effectively into production for key data and analytics consumers such as business or data analysts and data scientists.

¬∑ Build data and domain event models, implement business rules, and engineer scalable data pipelines.

¬∑ Ensure compliance with data governance and security requirements while creating, improving, and operationalizing integrated and reusable data pipelines.

¬∑ Enable faster data access, integrate data reuse, and improve time-to-solution for data and analytics initiatives.

¬∑ Integrate analytics and data science results with business processes.

¬∑ Promote effective data management practices.

Modernization

¬∑ Work with peers to improve architecture processes and deliverables with the trending technology.

¬∑ Participate in yearly product health assessment.

¬∑ Maintain solution architecture roadmap based on Enterprise Architecture & Business strategic direction.

Technical Leadership and Governance oversight

¬∑ Accountable to lead communication and to drive escalation & resolution with Stakeholders.

¬∑ Ensuring Standards are being published and evangelized.

¬∑ Ensuring the Enterprise Governance principles are being applied.

Requirements

Education & Experience

¬∑ Minimum 10 years of overall work experience (including in OT, IT, Development engagements, and Data Integration).

¬∑ Minimum 2 years demonstrating technical leadership qualities and/or overseeing deliverables

¬∑ Minimum 2 years in a similar role.

¬∑ Bachelor\'s degree in Computer science, Information Systems, Engineering or equivalent degree or relevant work experience.

Skills/Knowledge

¬∑ Strong architecture knowledge within numerous fields: business, application, information, and technology architecture facets.

¬∑ Hands-on experience in at least one of the Data Integration development technologies (Mulesoft, Kafka, Qlik Replicate, Azure Data Factory).

¬∑ Strong Informatica Intelligent Cloud Services (IICS) or IBM DataStage experience will also be considered.

¬∑ Good understanding of application design patterns (Dependency Injection, Microservices, and others) and modern platforms (API/Microservices, Mobile, MBaaS, Mulesoft, Container).

¬∑ Knowledge and working experience in Google Cloud Platform ‚Äì Big Query, Cloud SQL, Dataproc, Cloud Storage.

¬∑ Comparable working experience in Azure Ecosystem will also be considered.

¬∑ Strong experience with Agile/Scrum/Safe delivery methodology.

¬∑ Strong ability to bring a complex concept to actionable architecture deliverables.

¬∑ Strong capacity to learn new concepts and technology quickly with the capacity to coach, mentor, and develop others by teaching them.

¬∑ Strong ability to taking hard decisions by understanding and explaining trade-offs between business enablement and economic impacts.

¬∑ The role requires people skills to influence and orient business and technical audiences toward a common goal that is satisfying all stakeholders.

¬∑ Very good ability to build collaborative cross-functional relationships, pulling together and maintaining a cohesive and high-functioning team.

¬∑ Strong ability to lead the team on a mandate and to lead decisions.

¬∑ Ability to deliver mandate with great autonomy ‚Äì self-driven.

¬∑ Excellent written and oral communication skills.

About CN

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada‚Äôs Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.

CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

title: Senior Manager, Data Governance and Analytics
description:
Requisition ID: 173614

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Purpose of Job:

Working within Global Risk Management (GRM), this position will take accountability and drive the production of data driven analyses resulting in actionable insights that improve the Bank‚Äôs Operational Risk performance. Additionally, support Global Operational Risk (GOR)‚Äôs data governance process to ensure compliance with the Bank‚Äôs data standards.

Job Responsibilities:

Leverage your strong analytical and data management background to collaborate with various business partners to:

‚Ä¢ Lead the development, implementation, and monitoring of Global Operational Risk data strategies to mitigate Operational Risk events and support business line decision making
‚Ä¢ Act as a ‚ÄòSingle Point of contact‚Äô for key Analytics initiatives including partnering with analytics teams and enterprise data and analytics capabilities
‚Ä¢ Act as analytics expert on advanced analytics projects, challenging analytical thinking and methodology
‚Ä¢ Deliver on analytical projects that provide actionable insights to improve Operational Risk decision making
‚Ä¢ Ensure team collaboration with partners on business problems / issues and provide fact-based analytical advice that aligns to strategy and drives shareholder value
‚Ä¢ Recommend improvements to existing processes to support data analytics, including data collection in Source systems
‚Ä¢ Introduce changes under a test/control framework to help drive objective, evidence-based decisions
‚Ä¢ Work closely with leadership teams to create data strategies that support data modeling
‚Ä¢ Build strong and influential internal relationships (with stakeholders such as other Bank data and analytics teams, GOR teams, third parties, etc.) to help ensure business objectives are being met
‚Ä¢ Ensure all GOR‚Äôs data processes comply with the Bank‚Äôs data standards, including support with the monitoring of data quality processes.

‚Ä¢ Champions a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems and knowledge.
‚Ä¢ Understand how the Bank‚Äôs risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.
‚Ä¢ Actively pursues effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational risk, regulatory compliance risk, AML/ATF risk and conduct risk, including but not limited to responsibilities under the Operational Risk Management Framework, Regulatory Compliance Risk Management Framework, AML/ATF Global Handbook and the Guidelines for Business Conduct.
‚Ä¢ Champions a high-performance environment and contributes to an inclusive work environment.

Job Requirements:

  • Ability to be work independently and able to work on teams cross-functionally
  • Strong leadership, collaboration, and communication skills
  • Ability to present complex information in a simplified way to various audiences
  • Experience in statistical & quantitative analysis
  • Experience in programming ( SAS / Python /R) and databases (SQL,DB2) knowledge, ability to process and analyze large volumes of data
  • Experience in reporting automation through BI tools like Tableau, Power BI etc
  • Experience with statistical software packages such as R, Python, and SAS
  • Experience manipulating large and complex databases
  • Experience with Operational Risk platforms and methodologies, and their application in strategic decision making, is strongly desired
  • Results driven individual with high level of curiosity and ability to dive into details without losing sight of the big picture
  • Exceptional organization skills to prioritize, manage, and implement a variety of competing initiatives, on a concurrent or staggered basis
  • A University degree in Economics, Finance, Statistics, Industrial Engineer, Mathematics, Computer science, or Information technology related discipline
  • Fluency in Spanish is an asset

Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. If you require technical assistance, please click here. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Software Developer III, Infrastructure, Google Cloud Platforms
description:
2023-04-20T19:01:01.089Z
  • Share
  • Save

Software Developer III, Infrastructure, Google Cloud Platforms

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Waterloo, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 2 years of experience with software development in C++.
  • 2 years of experience with data structures or algorithms in either an academic or industry setting.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master\'s degree or PhD in Computer Science or related technical fields.
  • 2 years of experience building and developing large-scale infrastructure, distributed systems or networks, and/or experience with compute technologies, storage, and/or hardware architecture.
  • Experience developing accessible technologies.

About the job

Google\'s software developers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We\'re looking for software developers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software developer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google‚Äôs needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our software developers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google\'s product portfolio possible. We\'re proud to be our engineers\' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

Google Cloud accelerates organizations‚Äô ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google‚Äôs cutting-edge technology ‚Äì all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

Responsibilities

  • Write product or system development code.
  • Participate in, or lead design reviews with peers and stakeholders to decide amongst available technologies.
  • Review code developed by other developers and provide feedback to ensure best practices (e.g., style guidelines, checking code in, accuracy, testability, and efficiency).
  • Contribute to existing documentation or educational content and adapt content based on product/program updates and user feedback.
  • Triage product or system issues and debug/track/resolve by analyzing the sources of issues and the impact on hardware, network, or service operations and quality.

Information collected and processed as part of your Google Careers profile, and any job applications you choose to submit is subject to Google\'s Applicant and Candidate Privacy Policy.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google\'s EEO Policy and Know your rights: workplace discrimination is illegal. If you have a need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

To all recruitment agencies: Google does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Google employees or any other organization location. Google is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

To learn more about COVID vaccination requirements for US Google workplaces, read our Vaccination Entry Policy.

At Google, we‚Äôre committed to building a workforce that is more representative of the users we serve and creating a culture where everyone feels like they belong. To learn more about our diversity, equity, inclusion commitments and how we‚Äôre building belonging, please visit our Belonging page for more information.

We welcome and encourage people who are expecting and/or parents-to-be to apply to this or any other role at Google.

Google is a global company and, in order to facilitate efficient collaboration and communication globally, English proficiency is a requirement for all roles.

title: Director, Data Integration & Performance Platform
description:
Vision and Core Values

OMERS overall vision is to play a leadership role in the pension industry and be first of class, deliver superior services and to grow and attract investment partners. The core values are to be fair, have high integrity, respect for each other, provide superior service and work as a team.

The Corporate Objectives for OMERS is to provide secure pensions for all their constituents by:

  • Investing to earn outstanding returns with due regard for risk

  • Partnering with like-minded investment managers

  • Providing high quality service to our members and employers

  • Delivering value for money

  • Building a culture of excellence and pride in OMERS

OMERS Operating Principles are: Financial Strength, Accountability, Member Focus, Talent and Reporting.

Value Proposition

This is an opportunity to join a forward-looking leadership team to help design and lead a digital transformation that will enable OMERS Capital Markets, Total Portfolio Management, and Corporate Finance functions to deliver on our pension promise. Our team is at the early stages of defining a strategic roadmap, and the selected leader will be a key member of the team that will work with our internal partners to understand their needs and deliver outcomes, with excellence. This role joins a team on a journey, with significant future potential in a global, sophisticated, and complex enterprise.

Scope of Position

Reporting to the VP, Finance Platform, Capital Markets, the Director, Data Integration & Performance Platform leads a team of business system analysts and technical analysts that support and deliver change to data management and performance measurement products, as well as our investment data warehouse, and provide data integration services across mission critical investment systems supporting OMERS Capital Markets. As the lead product manager for this scope of services, the incumbent will be responsible for understanding and delivering against department objectives, and the needs of our internal partners.

This incumbent will drive strategic initiatives that will enhance the capital markets data & analytics capabilities at OMERS, and will be required to have a deep understanding of modern trends in data management, architecture, cloud infrastructure, and utilities, through continuous learning and industry engagement.

Responsibilities

  • Lead the execution of transformation initiatives to modernize OMERS‚Äô data management and performance measurement capabilities for Finance in support of Capital Markets.

  • Develop product strategies and roadmaps.

  • Manage the end-to-end delivery of changes to the investment data warehouse and performance applications.

  • Ensure the timely and accurate delivery of investment data, P&L and performance to internal partners. Includes assisting in the root cause analysis and resolution of data quality issues by tracing data lineage and analyzing technical processes.

  • Engage partners to identify and prioritize new features through pro-active engagement and maintenance of the product backlog.

  • Lead two layered teams, comprising of analysts to senior managers, with vision, clarity, and technical expertise, providing relevant coaching for professional development.

  • Partner with Capital Markets Finance and Data & Technology experts to deliver data integration and reporting solutions, including integrations between order and execution management, accounting, data warehouse, and performance systems.

  • Facilitate vendor governance processes to influence the product roadmap and escalate service issues.

  • Develop and institute solution design principles that are forward-thinking and optimize for efficacy, sustainability, and time to market.

  • Use metrics and feedback to improve organizational processes, implement best practices, and enhance performance, creating a culture of excellence and continuous improvement.

  • Mature change delivery processes and drive a transformation to Agile and DevOps.

  • Track and report on product roadmaps, completed work, capacity, backlog, KPIs, etc.

  • Document and maintain key processes and controls, for training, continuity, and audit purposes.

  • Develop relationships among partners by supporting a culture of transparency, collaboration, and service excellence.

  • Influence and represent the broader team‚Äôs leadership, to accomplish collective wins.

Qualifications

  • Minimum 9 years experience in data management and analytics roles managing data warehouse platforms, including production support, change initiatives and/or large transformation programs in the Financial Services industry

  • Minimum of 5 years experience leading, managing and coaching a team with diverse skills and backgrounds, with a demonstrated history of contributing to their development and success

  • Expert knowledge of SQL and cloud enabled data management solutions

  • Expert knowledge of ETL/ELT tools and design patterns

  • Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs Degree in a related field such as Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Accounting, or Finance

  • Knowledge of the investment lifecycle and data domains for exchange traded and OTC products, including exotic instruments

  • Hands-on experience with delivering complex data assets and a proven ability to manage multiple projects

  • Experience implementing and delivering change to leading investment applications, including but not limited to Eagle, Calypso, and Charles River

  • Experience with the Azure cloud platform and/or Snowflake are nice to have

  • Excellence in all types of communication and facilitation with colleagues at all levels

  • Self-motivated with strong, proven, analytical and problem-solving skills

  • Commitment to standards of professionalism, internal controls and compliance

  • Indications that you fit our desired culture, which mixes beautiful work with smiles and laughter

And you demonstrate:

  • High standards of business and ethical values including the ability to deal with confidential information

  • A people-first focus with a desire to develop meaningful, positive relationships across all levels of the organization

  • A teammate mentality coupled with servant leadership

  • A sense of urgency, optimism, and a desire to deliver excellence

  • A desire to drive debate, to speak candidly and to listen empathetically; and

  • Strong orientation towards strategy, change and results

#LI-Hybrid

Our story:

Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada‚Äôs largest defined benefit pension plans, with $124 billion in net assets as at December 31, 2022. OMERS is a jointly-sponsored pension plan, with more than 1,000 participating employers ranging from large cities to local agencies, and over half a million active, deferred and retired members. OMERS members include union and non-union employees of municipalities, school boards, local boards, transit systems, electrical utilities, emergency services and children‚Äôs aid societies across Ontario. Contributions to the Plan are funded equally by members and employers. OMERS teams work in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe ‚Äì serving members and employers and originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate.

OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives.

title: Manager, Modelling & Analytics
description:
Address:

100 King Street West

Job Family Group:

Data Analytics & Reporting

Supports the research and development of quantitative risk modeling methodologies and related strategies in support of the management of risks arising from business/group portfolios and products. Applies knowledge of analytics algorithms and technologies to develop forward looking models and analytic solutions that ensure risks are properly identified, understood and risk related strategies are enabled. Summarizes statistical findings, draws business conclusions, and presents actionable business recommendations used in the management of risks and related activities e.g. associated internal controls; enterprise-wide stress testing and scenario analysis; capital modelling; valuations. Drives innovation through the development of data products that can be leveraged across the organization and establishes best practices as well influences data governance guidelines and policies. May specialize in one or more risk categories e.g. Credit Risk, Market Risk, Interest Rate Risk, etc.

  • Acts as a trusted advisor to assigned business/group.
  • Influences and negotiates to achieve business objectives.
  • Recommends and implements solutions based on analysis of issues and implications for the business.
  • Assists in the development of strategic plans.
  • Identifies emerging issues and trends to inform decision-making.
  • Supports the execution of strategic initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.
  • Helps determine business priorities and best sequence for execution of business/group strategy.
  • Conducts independent analysis and assessment to resolve strategic issues.
  • Automates validation tests to improve quality and efficiency of the validation process.
  • Identifies emerging issues and trends to inform decision-making.
  • Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders.
  • Ensures alignment between stakeholders.
  • Cleanses, manipulates, and transforms data through programming/scripting for model training and validation.
  • Conducts various pre-implementation and post-implementation analyses to estimate/measure business impact caused by model adoption (e.g., revenue increase, cost reduction, corporate brand image).
  • Provides input into the planning and implementation of operational programs.
  • Executes work to deliver timely, accurate, and efficient service.
  • Develops analytical solutions and makes recommendations based on an understanding of the business strategy and stakeholder needs.
  • Provides advice and guidance to assigned business/group on implementation of analytical solutions.
  • Works with stakeholders to identify the business requirements, understand the distinct problems, and the expected outcome and models and frames business scenarios which impact critical business processes and/or decisions.
  • Works with various data owners to discover and select available data sources from internal sources and external vendors (e.g. lending system, payment system, external credit rating system) to fulfill analytical needs.
  • Applies scripting/programming skills to assemble various types of source data (unstructured, semi-structured, and structured) into well-prepared datasets with multiple levels of granularities (e.g., demographics, customers, products, transactions).
  • Develops agreed analytical solution by applying suitable statistical techniques (e.g., A/B testing, prototype solutions, mathematical models, algorithms, machine learning, artificial intelligence) to test, verify, refine hypotheses.
  • Summarizes statistical findings and draws conclusions and presents actionable business recommendations. Presents findings & recommendations in a simple, clear way to drive action.
  • Documents data flow, systems and processes in data collection to improve efficiency and apply use cases.
  • Performs experimental design approaches to validate finding or test hypotheses.
  • Uses the appropriate algorithms to discover patterns.
  • Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders. Ensures alignment between stakeholders.
  • Supports development of tools and delivers training for data and analytics.
  • Supports development and execution of strategic initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.
  • Leads/participates in the design, implementation and management of core business/group processes.
  • Focus is primarily on business/group within BMO; may have broader, enterprise-wide focus.
  • Provides specialized consulting, analytical and technical support.
  • Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules.
  • Works independently and regularly handles non-routine situations.
  • Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.

    Qualifications:

  • Typically between 5 - 7 years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • Data preparation, data analysis, and statistical tool sets including but not limited to Spotfire, Tableau, SQL, SAS, R, Python, MATLAB, SPSS.
  • Relevant experience in risk, capital, and/or treasury management is preferred.
  • A professional designation in Finance or Risk management is preferred.
  • Post-secondary degree in Finance/Economics/Math required.
  • Professional designation in Finance or Risk management required.
  • Deep knowledge and technical proficiency gained through extensive education and business experience.
  • Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth.
  • Collaboration & team skills - In-depth.
  • Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth.
  • Influence skills - In-depth.
  • Data driven decision making - In-depth.

We‚Äôre here to help

At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one ‚Äì for yourself and our customers. We‚Äôll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we‚Äôll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.

To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en.

BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other‚Äôs differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.

Note to Recruiters: BMO does not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Any unsolicited resumes sent to BMO, directly or indirectly, will be considered BMO property. BMO will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. A recruiting agency must first have a valid, written and fully executed agency agreement contract for service to submit resumes.

title: Senior Data Scientist (Health)
description:
You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you‚Äôll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

Job Description:

Role Summary

To support the vision of helping Canadians live healthier lives, Sun Life Health brings together Sun Life‚Äôs Group Benefits and Health Ecosystem businesses, including Lumino Health (an innovative platform launched in 2018). By uniting these two groups, Sun Life Health can deliver on transformative health solutions for both Clients and Canadians. If you‚Äôre passionate about improving health for Canadians, and like to take on big challenges in a supportive environment, the Data Science & Analytics (DSA) team in Sun Life Health is the right fit.

The DSA team is responsible for:

  • Being the analytics translators to identify and deliver high-impact data science use cases

  • Building dashboards and reports to monitor progress and help extract valuable insights from vast amounts of data

  • Partnering with other Analytics/IT groups to leverage expertise of Data Engineers/Developers to explore and solve complex business problems

  • Supporting various teams within Sun Life Health to leverage best practices associated with data management and develop processes that support data driven decision making

The Senior Data Scientist‚Äôs primary focus is to collaborate closely with the health product and strategy team to launch and test new ideas and solutions to generate innovation within Sun Life‚Äôs Health Ecosystem, and to identify data science use cases, create the project execution plan and to drive the project through its life cycle. As part of this life cycle, you will create/maintain data models, provide expertise in data interpretation to support strategic decision making, and leverage analytical skills to highlight trends and insights from data. You will also be responsible for feasibility study of use cases for production at scale and automation.

What Will You Do?

  • Identify potential data science/machine learning opportunities, create and execute end-to-end plan for implementation and delivery

    • Work closely with health product and strategy team to define use case and scope

    • Identify appropriate data sources relevant to the modeling application

    • Create data pipeline for extracting the data into AWS S3

    • Perform data preprocessing to ensure data quality

    • Apply feature engineering principles to create feature space

    • Create labels if known and appropriate to the problem at hand

    • Apply machine learning models to identify model with best performance

    • Perform cross validation and hyper parameter tuning to optimize model performance

    • Prepare model for deployment

    • Monitor deployed model for data and model drift

  • Participate in the technical design, development, and testing of models/analysis and in the creation of user documentation and processes

  • Create and maintain ETL processes and automated dashboards that can be leveraged to find insights

  • Develop and present reporting solutions to key stakeholders and partners

  • Learn about business processes to analyze, interpret, and advise managers on analytical findings

  • Collaborate with stakeholders to ensure effective use of reporting and analysis, and provide support if needed

  • Understand and incorporate technology best practices with a primary focus on Tableau and Python

  • Diligently perform quality assurance and risk assessment guidelines to minimize operational, reputation, and legal risk

What Do You Need To Succeed?

  • Coding experience preferably in Python (minimum 3 years)

  • Experience with developing machine learning, statistical and optimization models and creating/maintaining visualizations and dashboards in Tableau (minimum 2 years)

  • Experience in healthcare and familiarity with health data (1 year)

  • Familiar with data science project life cycle

  • Technical mindset with a degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, or other data science related fields, and 3-5 years of relevant experience. A graduate degree would be an asset, a combination of education and work experience will also be considered.

  • Strong problem solving and analytical skills

  • Demonstrated ability to produce meaningful results from data

  • Proven experience consolidating and analyzing data sources

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills with experience in relaying complex concepts to non-technical users

  • Comfortable learning new applications quickly with minimal direction

  • Proven ability to work collaboratively within a cross functional team environment

  • Ability to succeed in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, and quickly find alternative solutions to business and data challenges

  • Attention to detail and in-depth planning, organizational and time management skills

  • Experience working with relational databases and creating data models with efficient design

  • Experience with AWS SageMaker would be an asset.

Unique Requirements

  • The candidate selected for this role is required to attain Canadian Reliability Security Clearance (administered by submitting fingerprints to the RCMP, who then conduct min. 5 year history checks)

  • To see if you are eligible for this clearance, please review the section 201 on the Federal Government site (https://www.tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca/esc-src/personnel/pdcf-rsrp-eng.html)

What\'s In It For You?

  • Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data

  • 20 days vacation per year and an innovative sabbatical program

  • Great Place to Work¬Æ Certified in Canada and the US - 2022

  • Great Place to Work¬Æ award for Best Workplaces for #HybridWork - 2022

  • Flex hours and Flexible hybrid work model including in-country work-from-home if you prefer. #LI-Hybrid #LI-Remote

  • A friendly, collaborative and inclusive culture

  • Being part of our Analytics community, where we share best practices and broaden skill-sets

  • Flexible Benefits from the day you join to meet the needs of you and your family

  • Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security

  • Fitness and wellness programs that help you balance work and life and enjoy a healthier lifestyle

The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted. It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors. In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance. Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results.

title: Senior Business Data Engineer
description:
You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you‚Äôll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

Job Description:

At Sun Life, we work together, share common values and encourage growth and achievement. We offer many career paths that attract a wide variety of talent and skills. Follow a path that lets your talents shine.

Role Summary:

The Client Experience Office (CXO) is an important pillar of Sun Life‚Äôs corporate strategy and as such, is seeking experienced data engineering individuals with a proven track record working with data consumers to extract meaningful insights from enterprise data. Senior Business data engineers play an indispensable role in assembling the necessary data products that fuel myriad of analytical models used by our various business units across Canada.

Reporting to the Manager of Data Engineering, the Senior Business Data Engineer will be a key member of Data Enablement Team responsible for building enriched data products that provide deep insights about our Client, Advisor, Product, Transactions along with their intricate relationships. The Senior Business Data Engineer will work with data analysts and data scientists to help answer complex business enquires such as identifying new business opportunities, understanding our client behavior and optimizing areas of our sales cycles.

What will you do?

  • Obsessed with understanding our enterprise data and interpreting it in the best way possible to derive business value

  • Design and engineer data models that represent our key business entities such as our Advisor, Client & Product

  • Ensure high level of data quality and data integrity are maintained across data sources for business

  • Convert complex business and technical rules into logic for data flows and data pipelines

  • Work with our Data Science teams to implement data products for various use cases

  • Collaborate with stakeholders and incorporate into solution design for various use case requirements

  • Standardize metadata into a common glossary along with the necessary documentation for data consumers

What do you need to succeed?

  • 3-5 years hands-on experience working on AWS technologies for data processing and analytics

  • 2+ years experience with AWS Glue for ETL

  • 3 years experience in Pyspark and SQL

  • 5 years hands-on experience with relational database systems, relational models, dimensional models etc.

  • 3-5 years experience with engineering data products as input to various analytical models

  • 3-5 years building feedback loops between model deployment and its data ‚Äì i.e. tune & tweak data products to achieve scale, optimization, etc.

  • Sound understanding of data management principles (data warehousing, data quality, master data management, etc.)

  • Sound understanding of data modelling and a passion for analytics

  • Proven track record in leveraging SQL and SQL-based programming to solve business problems

  • Ability to translate complex business requirements into a set of data ingestion pseudocode

  • Proven ability to leverage knowledge of data engineering to extract, conform and integrate a variety of operational data sources into pro‚Äêduction-grade data products

  • Demonstrate blend of tenacity, creativity, and discipline required to develop ground breaking self-serve data models that data scientists can consume

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills; have executive presence and proven ability to partner with Data Scientists to articulate insights gleaned from the model and the underlying data

Education and Qualifications:

  • Undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, or equivalent

  • Graduate degree in business or quantitative science strongly preferred

Unique Requirements

  • The candidate selected for this role is required to attain Canadian Reliability Security Clearance (administered by submitting fingerprints to the RCMP, who then conduct min. 5 year history checks)

  • To see if you are eligible for this clearance, please review the section 201 on the Federal Government site (https://www.tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca/esc-src/personnel/pdcf-rsrp-eng.html)

What would be nice to have?

  • Understand and Embrace Agile Operating Model

  • Proven Experienced working as Product Owner in Scrum or Service Request Manager in Kanban projects

  • Experience working in a large financial services organization

  • Knowledge of fundamental statistical models & techniques

What\'s In It For You?

  • Great Place to Work¬Æ Certified in Canada and the US - 2022

  • Great Place to Work¬Æ award for Best Workplaces for #HybridWork - 2022

  • Named ‚ÄúBest Places to Work‚Äù by Glassdoor - 2021

  • Canada Award for Excellence for Mental Health at Work - 2021

  • Flex hours and Flexible hybrid work model including in-country work-from-home if you prefer. #LI-Hybrid, #LI-Remote

  • Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data

  • Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security

  • A friendly, collaborative, and inclusive culture

  • Be part of our continuous improvement journey in developing the next greatest digital enterprise experience.

  • Work and professional development that is united by our Purpose: to help Clients and Employees achieve lifetime financial security and live healthier lives

The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted. It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors. title: Manager, Data Engineering
description:
Description


Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together

We are searching for a talented candidate to become our team‚Äôs Manager, Enterprise Data Engineering. Reporting to the Director ‚Äì Enterprise Data Engineering, the successful candidate will be responsible for leading a team of accomplished data analysts, engineers and architects supporting our data and analytics platform transformation. This role will be an agent of change and support the evolving strategy, data and analytics roadmaps as well as provide overarching direction to support our TELUS Business Solutions Team (TBS).

The portfolio will focuses on continuous improvement to our GCP engineering practices (common ingestion framework), CI/CD pipelines, DevOps, SRE, real-time data ingestion, addressing technical debt and support the Business Master Data Management (MDM) and Revenue Generating Unit (RGU) workstreams. Our team is a cloud first team and leverages the latest technologies to fuel our mission and purpose.

What you‚Äôll do

At TELUS, we put ‚ÄòCustomers First‚Äô. With a broad set of responsibilities and a high degree of visibility across the TELUS organization, the successful candidate will have the opportunity to:

  • Lead a team of talented data platform Analysts, Engineers and Architects to drive the modernization of our data platforms
  • Foster internal and external stakeholder relationships, including managing senior executive participants
  • Provide guidance to establish standards and best practices for building enterprise grade data pipelines
  • Work with our preferred Cloud service providers to align our roadmap based on their release schedule for services and product offerings.
  • Construct comprehensive business cases and financial models leveraging various methods to support strategic projects and decisions with data driven insights
  • Utilize internal and external data points coupled with market research on marketplace dynamics impacting TELUS and the Data Strategy team to inform opportunities and risks for the team
  • Create technology roadmaps for business partners, executive management, and external audiences to enhance strategic decision making and support technology investment recommendations
  • Collaborate with key stakeholders to create, track and evolve the team scorecards and strategic imperatives
  • Support the annual strategic and financial planning process
  • Flex your communication, negotiation, and influencing skills, working with a broad set of internal stakeholders, executives and external partners
  • Mentor, lead, and support a diverse and very talented team

Qualifications


What you bring

You have experience in technical leadership, managing data platforms, business intelligence tools and setting architectural direction

  • You can communicate clearly and effectively in both technical and business matters able to translate technical considerations into business implications
  • You are analytical and outcome-oriented with a proven ability to translate business requirements into high-level design models
  • You have hands on knowledge of foundational cloud data architecture of lakes, warehouses, data modeling, and life cycle management
  • You have demonstrated experience with the governance and oversight of data privacy, security and the ethical use of data in previous roles
  • You have experience with cloud migration projects, agile methodologies, and DevOps practices
  • You have impressive people leadership track record with proven ability to recruit, coach, mentor and lead high performing teams in a fast-paced environment
  • You are a skilled relationship builder and skilled at prioritization, negotiation and influencing
  • You can pivot between supporting the urgent needs of the business and the long-term roadmap
  • You have experience working on and supporting large, complex technical projects that involve multiple stakeholders and business units
  • You have exposure to tools, technologies and programming languages including, but not limited to, Python, Airflow (composer), SQL, Apache Nifi, Hive, Spark, Dataflow (Apache Beam) and Kafka
  • You have experience creating a vision for and implementing a culture of change to drive CI/CD, DevOps and other opportunities for operational effectivenes

Great-to-haves

  • Bachelor of Computer Science or equivalent
  • 5+ years of progressive and relevant work experience with enterprise data
  • PMP certification is an asset
  • Experience with the data offerings in the Google Cloud Platform
  • Experience in the telecommunications industry
  • Excellent communication skills and ability to lead a large team

title: Research Director
description:
What‚Äôs the opportunity?

Borealis AI is looking for a Research Director. The role includes directing a team of machine learning researchers and managing other research team leads with the goal of delivering AI-based products for the financial services industry. In addition, you will provide leadership and deliver on initiatives that improve the effectiveness of the entire research organization.

Your responsibilities include:

  • To join the Borealis AI research leadership team and shape the research organization as a whole and contribute to its overall performance.
  • To work with the Borealis AI business development team to identify viable artificial intelligence products that will add significant value to RBC stakeholders.
  • To lead a team of machine learning researchers delivering cutting edge AI technology to support these products.
  • To partner with Borealis AI‚Äôs product and engineering teams to ensure the seamless delivery of these products.
  • To manage other research team leads and provide guidance and support.
  • To help recruit, mentor and retain a high-performing research team across Borealis AI.

You‚Äôre our ideal candidate if you have:

  • A Ph.D. degree in Computer Science or a related technical field;
  • 10 years of experience leading research teams in machine learning in a product-centric environment or equivalent experience;
  • A track record of successful people management including mentoring junior researchers and engineers, experienced high-performance researchers, and research managers;
  • Experience delivering successful high-impact machine learning products
  • Involvement across the research and development lifecycle, from prototyping to production, engaging with stakeholders to develop solutions that meet business needs;
  • Broad research interests and detailed knowledge of cutting edge machine learning techniques across multiple areas;
  • The ability to formulate and drive multiple research projects independently;
  • Exceptional communication and leadership skills;
  • A history of high quality academic publications (e.g., NeurIPS, CVPR, AISTATS, ICLR, ICML etc.) and community recognition for excellence;

What\'s in it for you?

  • Become part of a team that thinks progressively and works collaboratively. We care about seeing each other reach full potential;
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock options where applicable;
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact from a local-to-global scale

About Borealis AI

Borealis AI, a RBC Institute for Research, is a research centre dedicated to achieving state-of-the-art in machine learning. Established in 2016, and with labs in Toronto, Montreal, Waterloo and Vancouver, we support academic collaborations and partner with world-class research centres in artificial intelligence. With a focus on ethical AI that will help communities thrive, our machine learning scientists perform fundamental and applied research in areas such as reinforcement learning, natural language processing, deep learning, and unsupervised learning to solve ground-breaking problems in diverse fields.

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

RBC is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status, Aboriginal/Native American status or any other legally-protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the application process are available upon request.

title: Data Engineer
description:

We‚Äôre looking for an enthusiastic data engineer who‚Äôs excited by the opportunity of designing distributed systems to support applications at the forefront of machine learning technology. title: Data Scientist, Financial Crimes Risk Management Models and Analytics - 12 Month Contract
description:
Requisition ID: 179463

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Purpose of Job
We are seeking a highly analytical and skilled Data Scientist to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analysis, statistical modelling, and machine learning. The Data Scientist will be responsible for designing, enhancing, and implementing data-driven solutions supporting the Bank's AML/ATF Client Risk Rating models.
This role contributes to the overall success of Global Risk Management‚Äôs AML/ATF team by analyzing and improving client risk rating models thereby enhancing operating efficiency and is conducted in compliance with governing regulations, internal policies, and procedures.

‚Ä¢ Apply range of modeling techniques from basic statistical models to AI and Machine Learning, to develop, maintain and implement models for client risk rating case generation in support of Scotiabank‚Äôs AML/ATF program
‚Ä¢ Creation and maintenance of documentation for models and for the results data analysis
‚Ä¢ Collaborating and coordinating with teams from model validation, internal audit, and external audit to ensure that models meet all legal and regulatory requirements
