title: Senior Analyst, Environmental & Social Risk Analytics
description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you‚Äôre helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Analyst, Environmental & Social Risk Analytics

Job Description

What is the Opportunity?

As part of the Environmental & Social Risk team within Group Risk Management, you will play a role in the management, monitoring, and mitigation of environmental and social (E&S) risks at RBC. You will support the design and implementation of key climate and E&S risk initiatives by providing research and data analytics and insights. A significant focus of this role will be the calculation of RBC‚Äôs financed emissions across different asset classes within carbon-intensive sectors and setting and tracking progress on net-zero targets.

The role will report to the Director, E&S Risk Analytics

What will you do?

  • Gather and analyze data required for climate and social risk measurement and work with the Director, E&S Risk Analytics to use this data to inform actionable steps in the management and monitoring of environmental & social risk.
  • Identify opportunities to improve environmental & social risk data processes and take a leading role in implementing these changes;
  • Optimize data quality and results by seeking out public and private data sources and working with internal stakeholders to source RBC data to improve our climate risk measurement and management capabilities.
  • Collaborate with diverse internal stakeholders across business lines and functions to share E&S Risk data and insights, to inform risk management, business strategy, and ESG and climate disclosures.
  • Work with the Director, E&S Risk Analytics to assist in the advancement of RBC‚Äôs capabilities in measuring financed emissions, setting net-zero targets, and delivering carbon accounting insights across the enterprise.
  • Contribute to and lead development and delivery of presentation and reports.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Degree in a quantitative discipline such as accounting, statistics, economics, econometrics, finance, mathematics, physics, engineering and/or a relevant professional qualification, with concentration in quantitative methods
  • An interest in Environmental and Social Risk in general and climate change in particular
  • An advanced understanding of programming and querying languages, including SQL and python
  • Experience developing presentations, visualizations and dashboards for senior executives and an interest in developing advanced analytical capabilities
  • Demonstrated ability in mathematical, statistical, financial or economic analyses on large, complex datasets and in translating data into business insights
  • A desire and ability to build new and innovative approaches to complex problems.
  • Commitment to quality and accuracy with a high level of attention to detail.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Nice-to-have

  • Knowledge of climate change science with experience in the development and use of climate change and economic scenarios, models, projections and data.
  • Knowledge or familiarity with the climate risk and/or target setting guidance issued by PCAF, NZBA, TCFD, ISSB, and/or OSFI (B-15)
  • Experience with or knowledge of carbon-intensive sectors, e.g. agriculture; aluminum; cement; coal; commercial and residential real estate; iron and steel; oil and gas; power generation; and transportation
  • Experience with or interest in agile or design thinking methodologies or frameworks.
  • Prior Product Management knowledge/experience or an interest in Product Management.
  • Knowledge and experience in quantitative model development, testing and validation.
  • Knowledge of wholesale and retail credit risk rating systems with experience in parameter estimation, portfolio management, or risk appetite.
  • Experience working with a diverse range of stakeholders.

What‚Äôs in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable.
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities.
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact.
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team.
  • Opportunities to do challenging work.
  • Opportunities to building close relationships with clients.

Job Summary

This position will support the advancement of the bank‚Äôs Environmental and Social Risk data management, analysis and disclosure capabilities, and the integration of this data into our risk management framework.

title: TDI Actuarial Intern / Co-op I
description:
Company Overview

All companies are not the same. What makes TD special as a business is also, what makes us special as an employer.

Why TD?

TD‚Äôs Colleague Promise: A better you. A better us.

A more confident you means a stronger us. We empower you to grow your skills, gain new perspectives, and create impact at work and in your community. That‚Äôs our unique and inclusive culture.

Department Overview

TD Insurance is part of TD Bank Group, one of Canada‚Äôs largest financial institutions. TD Insurance helps protect clients from the ‚Äòaccidents of life‚Äô with a wide range of products including credit protection, life, health, travel, home and auto insurance. With more than three million clients, TD Insurance authorized products and services are available online, over the phone, and through a network of more than 1,000 TD Canada Trust branches.

In Canada, we have two lines of business, General Insurance and Life and Health. Our General Insurance business is one of the top home and auto insurance groups in Canada and the national leader in group insurance and affinity marketing. Our Life and Health business is the number one provider of critical illness insurance and direct life and health insurance in Canada.

At TD Insurance, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment. With a Canada-wide workforce of over 4,000 employees and offices in Atlantic Canada, Quebec, Ontario and Alberta, our company is always growing and can help you to grow. TD Insurance offers a stable and dynamic work environment where talent is appreciated and professional development is taken seriously. More than just a job, we offer rewarding careers.

Job Description

We are hiring for the position of Intern / Co-Op III to provide a range of operational and analytical support and perform transactions and other processing activities. This role will not only provide you introductory experience in a professional setting, you will also be equipped with skills and experiences that contribute to the completion of your studies and prepare you to build a career in your chosen discipline. In this role, you will:

  • Develop and improve the various actuarial models used
  • Help analyze experience results
  • Take part in the production of regulatory rate change submissions
  • Take part in the production and analysis of monthly financial results
  • Participate in various research projects and market studies
  • Maintain and develop the underwriting rules in place
  • Contribute to various underwriting analyses
  • Take part in reinsurance related tasks
  • Participate in the company‚Äôs budget process

Requirements

What You Bring to TD

  • Currently enrolled in an actuarial, math or related university program
  • Strong academic records and positive work term feedback
  • Detail orientated, Analytical and Critical Thinker
  • Quantitative proficiency and comfortable with large datasets
  • Proficient in Microsoft Excel (Formulas), and Microsoft Office Suite
  • Ideal candidate posses knowledge of R Shiny
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • High degree of personal initiative

  • Not required but would be an asset: Previous Actuarial work experience Pursuing actuarial exams Knowledge and experience with SAS/SQL, VBA, R, Emblem, Radar, Python, Moody‚Äôs Analytics/GGY Axis and additional programs & languages University courses in Property & Casualty, Pricing/Ratemaking, Reserving, Life & Health, etc.

Additional Information

Early Talent Requirements

  • This position is a 4-month work term and will commence May 5th- August 25th, 2023
  • Applications must include a transcript, cover letter (one letter-sized page or less) and a resume (maximum of 2 pages).
  • We welcome all applications; however, we will only contact qualified candidates chosen for an interview. Thank you for your interest.
  • TD requires employees to reside in the country where the role is located, irrespective of remote working arrangements
  • TD is committed to providing you with the best candidate experience and internship in these unique circumstances. As such, work location and start dates are subject to change.

Start Date

‚Äì Fall, ‚Äì Summer

Inclusiveness

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

title: Senior Analyst, Retail Risk Management (Data Analytics)
description:
Requisition ID: 174650

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Purpose of Job:

Reporting to the Sr Manager, Non Pre-Approval Origination, the Sr Analyst will assist the senior manager in monitoring new accounts origination trends for unsecured Lending portfolio, support on credit risk strategy initiatives and other ad-hoc analysis will be required as necessary.

The Sr Analysts generally works within the established framework to carry on responsibilities under the supervision of the Senior Manager of Non Pre-Approval origination. A high degree of self-assurance, initiative and business sense is required of the Senior Analyst in order to carry out the position responsibilities proactively in a timely and effective manner.

The Sr Analyst will also use in-depth portfolio analytics to optimize approval/decline decision criteria, automation decision, and limit assignment strategies for New and Existing customers, learn about shifts in consumer credit behavior, and identify risks/opportunities that will impact the Risk Appetite Framework. These tasks will be accomplished leveraging extensive consumer data, credit risk and lending business expertise and advanced analytics techniques including machine learning.

Job Responsibilities:

Portfolio Monitoring

  • Create and maintain reports and dashboards that provide actionable insights.
  • Execute on data requests accurately within a timely manner.
  • Owner of the end-to-end reporting process (from raw data in SQL tables to automated production-grade dashboards) and be the key point of contact.
  • Improve monitoring on new accounts acquired through different channels and special programs. Track vintage performance and ensure a healthy growth of the portfolio.

Origination Strategies

  • Analyze strategy effectiveness and proactively identify any emerging risks, make recommendations to support business growth while maintaining losses within risk appetite.
  • Ensure all new approved credit is aligned with risk appetite and regulatory requirements and will optimize risk/return over the long term.
  • Gain a deep understanding of various adjudication platforms and systems. Implement strategy changes across different technology platforms and channels.
  • Identify opportunities to improve/test new risk strategies with building a robust and competitive portfolio in mind.

Support Business Line Initiatives/Projects

  • Collaborate and communicate effectively with business partners (product, operation, customer growth etc.) on new acquisition initiatives.
  • Represent Risk‚Äôs point of view and liaise with stakeholders throughout the organization to listen actively, communicate, and explain risk measures clearly and as appropriate.

Job Requirements:

Required: Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher or equivalent work experience;

A minimum of 1-3 years with an organization in the risk/portfolio management field or data science ‚Ä¢ Prior experience in a retail lending environment or credit risk management is an asset.

Proficiency in programing and database (SAS/Enterprise Miner or similar statistical software including the ability to apply advanced statistical techniques, SQL, R, Python).

Able to translate data into digestible dashboards and business insights (Tableau, PowerBI). ‚Ä¢ Strong ownership mentality and can-do attitude.

Ability to work effectively within a team, able to multi-task and strong analytics skills. ‚Ä¢ Attention to detail with personal accountability to ensure accuracy.

Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Data Scientist - Customer Insights Data & Analytics
description:
Requisition ID: 174199

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Purpose:

The successful candidate will be part of a dynamic, innovative team that supports the Marketing Analytics & Product functions within Scotiabank‚Äôs Canadian Bank Analytics group. The individual will develop statistical models, data-mining and analytical solutions to solve a wide array of business problems, including how to drive acquisition, migration and engagement strategies across our customer base.

Scotiabank provides a collaborative work environment where you get to see end-to-end how your work can shape and define strategies. We will provide you the opportunities to gain exposure to different businesses across the organization, a wide variety of analytical tools that will allow you to build complex decision engines and predictive models, work with big data, structured and un-structured.

What will you do in this role?

  • Design and integrate customer segmentation, channel analytics, campaign optimizations and recommendation/decision engines to help elevate our customer‚Äôs experiences across various channels and move to a personalized 1:1 customer journey
  • Synthesize data across multiple platforms to identify trends and deliver key insights and business recommendations around a customer-first approach to driving engagement and results across our marketing channels and campaigns, to then bringing these recommendations to market through execution and measurement
  • Act as a modelling and analytics generalist, provide subject matter expertise on modelling/segmentation, advanced analytics, data mining and statistical analysis to internal stakeholders
  • Ability to validate and measure effectiveness of customer/channel/campaign strategies to continually make ongoing changes and improvements
  • Supporting key information technology initiatives, such as enhancements in single view of customer, customer/ channel data warehouse, CRM and campaign management tools
  • Effectively communicate results of highly technical projects to stakeholders and deliver high quality, high impact analytical solutions to business problem

Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed?

  • Analytical background: preferably Master or PhD degree with a quantitative focus, such as statistics, applied mathematics, economics, computer science
  • 5 years of related experience needed, preferably within a financial, retail or consulting industry, customer segmentation and channel analytics an asset
  • Demonstrated experience of developing and implementing statistical models (predictive & descriptive) and advanced analytics with hands-on experience with Python, SAS and Google Cloud Platform (BigQuery, Looker and Vertex AI etc.)
  • Experience with relational databases and solid SQL skills (SQL Server, DB2, MySQL)
  • Experience with Bash/Unix Shell Scripts with Python/Docker/Airflow used for automating tasks
  • Familiar with container-based deployments using Docker, working with Docker images, Docker Hub and Docker-registries and Kubernetes.
  • Familiar with Hadoop Big Data ecosystem (Hive, Spark, Pig, Sqoop) an asset.
  • Demonstrated experience developing and implementing recommendation engines in a multi-channel marketing environment an asset
  • Strong business acumen: understanding of business and financial models and ability to link communication tactics to strategic objectives from a financial perspective
  • Self-motivated, strong quantitative skills, attention to detail, a high aptitude for problem solving and a natural interest in understanding customer behavior

What's in it for you?

  • We have an inclusive and collaborative working environment that encourages creativity, curiosity, and celebrates success!
  • We provide you with the tools and technology needed to succeed
  • You'll get to work with and learn from diverse industry leaders
  • We offer a competitive total rewards package that includes a base salary, a performance bonus, company matching programs (on pension & profit sharing), 4 weeks of vacation, personal & sick days, paternity/maternity leave top-ups and much more.

title: Automotive Risk Strategy & Analytics
description:
Requisition ID: 175543

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Purpose of Job:

The Manager, Portfolio Insights, SDA Risk, GRM will monitor key risk performance of the Retail Automotive portfolio, and contribute to the
development and enhancement of business intelligence tools and provide actionable insight to the Automotive Risk teams as well as product and
business line partners.


The role is highly technical and requires expert SAS, data analytics and BI tools knowledge, as well as ability to optimize and maximize
efficiency of existing processes. The incumbent will deliver strategic analysis to senior management while working with multiple stakeholders
and partners to facilitate development of Risk-Reward opportunities. He/She will develop optimal analytical methodologies to assess the growth
opportunities, and monitor results.

Job Responsibilities:

Accountability 1: Automotive Credit Risk Portfolio Tracking


‚Ä¢ Use a variety of Business Intelligence analytical and reporting tools (ex. SAS, Python, Tableau) to provide dynamic reporting on key
performance metrics to various stakeholders in GRM and business lines. Lead new report creation and look for opportunities to optimize
workstream.
‚Ä¢ Provide actionable insights and meaningful messages from the reporting to drive credit risk decisions. Able to tell a story by synthesizing
vast amounts of data into coherent messages.
‚Ä¢ Proactively provide strategic analysis that will assist in optimizing risk rewards ratios and grow the portfolios
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with Strategy and Policy teams to provide measurement and reporting on strategic initiatives such as acquisition dynamics
and quality, line optimization and collections effectiveness
‚Ä¢ Analyze strategy effectiveness , leverage champion/challenger capabilities to confirm assumptions and recommend changes, identify if
any credit risks are or will become in excess of the risk appetite framework and make recommendations on how to mitigate.

Accountability 2: Customer Focus


‚Ä¢ Champion a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems and knowledge.
‚Ä¢ Understand how the Bank‚Äôs risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.

Accountability 3: Innovation


‚Ä¢ Explore opportunities for using latest innovative analytics and Business Intelligence tools to showcase portfolio dynamics, derive
insights and streamline processes
‚Ä¢ Aim to move from descriptive to prescriptive analytics by focusing on key drivers of portfolio risk and profitability

Accountability 4: Risk Appetite Framework alignment


‚Ä¢ Ensure all business line strategic priorities (i.e. life-cycle strategies, early warning triggers, provisioning, etc.) are consistent with Risk
Appetite Framework. Recommend changes to business line strategies to ensure the Bank does not take on more credit risk than
planned.
‚Ä¢ Actively pursue effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and
effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational risk, regulatory compliance risk, AML/ATF
risk and conduct risk, including but not limited to responsibilities under the Operational Risk Management Framework, Regulatory
Compliance Risk Management Framework, AML/ATF Global Handbook and the Guidelines for Business Conduct.

Job Requirements:

  • Bachelor's or Graduate Degree in Math, Engineering, Computer Science, Marketing, Economics or Statistics
  • 3+ years analytical experience required
  • Must be proficient with MS Office, SAS, SQL, Python, Power BI, Tableau
  • Strong communication skills essential with clients and management
  • Strong prioritizing, planning, analytical, presentation, project management, people management and relationship building skills
  • 1+ years‚Äô experience in Retail Products is a great asset

title: Solutions Architect, Conversational AI Technology
description:
NVIDIA‚Äôs Worldwide Field Operations (WWFO) team is looking for a Data Science focused Solution Architect with expertise in Machine Learning (ML), Deep Learning (DL) and Data Science platforms. In particular we are looking for a candidate with understanding of modern Natural Language Processing (NLP), Automatic Speech Recognition (ASR) or Text To Speech (TTS) workflows. Exposure to inferencing technology (e.g. understanding of model compression techniques, model compilation or model serving) in the above mentioned space would be an added value. In our Solutions Architecture team, we work with the most exciting computing hardware and software, driving the latest breakthroughs in artificial intelligence. We need individuals who can enable customer productivity and develop lasting relationships with our technology partners, making NVIDIA an integral part of end-user solutions. We are looking for someone always thinking about artificial intelligence, someone who can maintain synergy in a fast paced, rapidly evolving field, someone able to coordinate efforts between corporate marketing, industry business development and engineering.

You will be working with the latest HPC architectures coupled with bleeding edge NLP, ASR and TTS models, changing the way people interact with technology. As a Solutions Architect, you will be the first line of technical expertise between NVIDIA and our customers. Your duties will vary from working on proof-of-concept demonstrations, to driving relationships with key executives and managers in order to evangelize accelerated computing. Dynamically engaging with developers, scientific researchers, data scientists, IT managers and senior leaders is a meaningful part of the Solutions Architect role and will give you experience with a range of partners and concerns.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing:

  • Develop and demonstrate solutions based on NVIDIA‚Äôs state-of-the-art NLP, ASR, TTS and broader Conversational AI software and hardware technologies to customers

  • Work directly with key customers to understand their technology and provide the best solutions

  • Perform in-depth analysis and optimization to ensure the best performance on GPU architecture systems. This includes support in optimization of both training and inference pipelines.

  • Partner with Engineering, Product and Sales teams to develop, plan best suitable solutions for customers. Enable development and growth of product features through customer feedback and proof-of-concept evaluations

  • Build industry expertise and become a contributor in integrating NVIDIA technology into Enterprise Computing architectures.

  • Work closely with customer\'s data science and IT teams

What We Need to See:

  • Excellent verbal, written communication, and technical presentation skills in English.

  • MS/PhD in Computer Science, Data Science, Electrical/Computer Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, other Engineering fields

  • 5+ years work or research experience with Python, C++ software development

  • A proven track record of academic and/or industry experience in fields related to machine learning, deep learning and/or data science.

  • Work experience and knowledge or modern NLP, ASR or TTS.

  • You are excited to work with multiple levels and teams across organizations (Engineering, Product, Sales and Marketing team)

  • Capable of working in a rapidly changing environment without losing focus.

  • Ability to multitask effectively in a fast-paced environment.

  • Action-oriented with strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

  • Strong time-management and organization skills for coordinating multiple initiatives, priorities and implementations of new technology and products into very complex projects

  • You are a self-starter with attitude for growth, passion for continuous learning and sharing findings across the team

Ways to Stand Out from The Crowd:

  • Experience running large scale distributed DL training.

  • Background with working with larger transformer based architectures for NLP, CV, ASR or other.

  • Experience applying NLP, ASR, TTS technology and its deployment to production.

  • Experience using DevOps technologies such as Docker, Kubernetes, Singularity, etc.

  • Understanding of HPC systems: data center design, high speed interconnect InfiniBand, Cluster Storage and Scheduling related design and/or management experience.

title: Senior AI Solutions Architect
description:
NVIDIA‚Äôs Worldwide Field Operations (WWFO) team is looking for a Data Science focused Solution Architect with expertise in Machine Learning (ML), Deep Learning (DL) and Data Science platforms. Exposure to inferencing technology (e.g., understanding of model compression techniques, model compilation or model serving) would be an added value. In our Solutions Architecture team, we work with the most exciting computing hardware and software, driving the latest breakthroughs in artificial intelligence. We need individuals who can enable customer productivity and develop lasting relationships with our technology partners, making NVIDIA an integral part of end-user solutions. We are looking for someone always thinking about artificial intelligence, someone who can maintain synergy in a fast paced, rapidly evolving field, someone able to coordinate efforts between corporate marketing, industry business development and engineering.

You will be working with the latest HPC architectures coupled with the most advanced neural network models, changing the way people interact with technology. As a Solutions Architect, you will be the first line of technical expertise between NVIDIA and our customers. Your duties will vary from working on proof-of-concept demonstrations, to driving relationships with key executives and managers to evangelize accelerated computing. Dynamically engaging with developers, scientific researchers, data scientists, IT managers and senior leaders is a meaningful part of the Solutions Architect role and will give you experience with a range of partners and concerns.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing:

  • Develop and demonstrate solutions based on NVIDIA‚Äôs state-of-the-art AI and ML software and hardware technologies to customers.

  • Work directly with key customers to understand their technology and provide the best solutions.

  • Perform in-depth analysis and optimization to ensure the best performance on GPU architecture systems. This includes support in optimization of both training and inference pipelines.

  • Partner with Engineering, Product and Sales teams to develop, plan best suitable solutions for customers. Enable development and growth of product features through customer feedback and proof-of-concept evaluations.

  • Build industry expertise and become a contributor in integrating NVIDIA technology into Enterprise Computing architectures.

What We Need to See:

  • Excellent verbal, written communication, and technical presentation skills in English.

  • MS/PhD in Computer Science, Data Science, Electrical/Computer, or equivalent experience Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, other Engineering fields

  • 5+ years of academic and/or industry experience in fields related to machine learning, deep learning and/or data science.

  • You are excited to work with multiple levels and teams across organizations (Engineering, Product, Sales and Marketing team)

  • You are a self-starter with attitude for growth, passion for continuous learning and sharing findings across the team.

Ways to Stand Out from The Crowd:

  • Experience running large scale distributed DL training.

  • Background with working with larger transformer-based architectures.

  • Experience using DevOps technologies such as Docker, Kubernetes, Singularity, etc.

  • Understanding of HPC systems: data centre design, high speed interconnect InfiniBand, cluster storage and scheduling related design and/or management experience.

title: Senior Engineer, Analytics DevOps
description:

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

title: Software Engineer  ML Engine (Layer 6)
description:
Company Overview

Tell us your story. Don‚Äôt go unnoticed. Explain why you‚Äôre a winning candidate. Think ‚ÄúTD‚Äù if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.

Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here‚Äôs our story: jobs.td.com

Department Overview

Layer 6 is a leading Canadian machine learning applied research company, a fully owned subsidiary of TD Bank Group. Layer 6 develops advanced machine learning and deep learning systems that have the power to uplift large populations while advancing the field of artificial intelligence. Our research is supported by access to massive datasets, close collaboration with world renowned academic faculty, and a uniquely scalable machine learning platform.

Our technical capabilities have been publicly recognized through a number of wins in various international machine learning competitions, including the prestigious ACM RecSys Challenge (the only repeat winner in 2017 and 2018 and runner-up in 2019), Google‚Äôs Landmark Retrieval Challenge (2nd place in 2018, 3rd place in 2019), the Stanford Question Answering Dataset (2nd place in 2019), 3rd YouTube-8M Video Understanding Challenge (winner in 2019) and Open Images 2019 ‚Äì Visual Relationship (winner in 2019).

Job Description

The goal of the ML Engine team is to enable training and deploying robust and high-performing models by providing a solid foundation and allowing for fast iteration. We are looking for world-class engineers to take on the challenging problem of shipping core machine learning engine from 0 to 1. This Engine which will be used across the Bank. You will work with ML Product Engineers, Ops teams, and Research Scientist to ensure our framework can support use cases deployed on our computing infrastructure.

What are your main responsibilities?

  • Own and ship product features that enable ML engine capabilities
  • Work with product owners and tech leads to design, ship, and refine significant components of the product.
  • Work with research scientists and MLOps team to maintain service product.

Requirements

Must-Have:

  • Experience with building and scaling data-intensive software.
  • You value good software design and sweat over details in code and API design.
  • You enjoy learning new technology and also educating others.
  • You take great personal pride in building robust and scalable software.
  • You strive to communicate clearly and with empathy.
  • You are highly accountable and have a strong sense of ownership.
  • Ability to do detailed code reviews and give thoughtful feedback.

Nice to have

Experience building a library or a framework.
Experience with Big Data technologies and frameworks including but not limited to Hadoop, MapReduce, Spark, Cassandra, Kafka, Elasticsearch
Comfortable with statistics.
Knowledge of machine learning algorithms.
Knowledge of distributed systems.

Additional Information

title: Manager, Cards Analytics and Insights
description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you‚Äôre helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Cards Analytics and Insights

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

RBC is currently recruiting for a Manager role for the Cards, Payments and Banking team. Your responsibilities will include:

  • Providing end-to-end analytics advisory services including conceptualizing business questions, designing and executing analytics framework and recommending and influencing the credit card business for decision making purpose

  • Identifying underlying business trends using analytical tools and transforming them into actionable insights

What will you do?

  • Act as a subject matter expert regarding analytics / data science topics (e.g. data visualization, storytelling, KPI definition, statistical analysis, predictive modelling etc.).

  • Support business growth targets by understanding business needs and providing concise, insightful and timely analytics of key trends through interpretation of interplays between portfolio / business performance, costs and business strategy.

  • Assist Senior Manager and collaborate with business partners in rapid identification, prioritization and deployment of analytics to define new potential business opportunities and to support decisions through the provision of industry and competitor data.

  • Participate in cross-functional teams through the analytics process to make sound information-based decisions and develop robust measures to effectively identify, mitigate and monitor risks and opportunities.

  • Present and defend analysis and recommendations to a wide range of stakeholders and senior key decision makers.

What do you need to succeed?

Must have:

  • At least two previous work term experiences in clients, product, marketing or risk analytical or reporting role; Experiences in supporting credit card business and/or financial services industry an asset

  • Programming experience to extract data and complete complex analytics. SAS / SQL required. R, Python, etc. preferred

  • Instinctive curiosity and strategic mindset to drill into the analytics to understand business drivers and predict business growth and the technical ability to apply this knowledge to resolve complex business questions

  • Proven ability to communicate clearly and concisely to all levels of the company. Strong skills in presentation and story telling

  • A hunger for continued development and learning

Nice to have:

  • Knowledge in Hadoop, Google Analytics and Big Data environment

  • Advance degree in quantitative discipline

What‚Äôs in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • Opportunities to do challenging work

title: Bus Application Analyst III
description:
Company Overview

Tell us your story. Don‚Äôt go unnoticed. Explain why you‚Äôre a winning candidate. Think ‚ÄúTD‚Äù if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.

Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here‚Äôs our story: jobs.td.com

Department Overview

Business Application Ownership and Management at TD is part of an enterprise-wide data and analytics ecosystem. We strive to be the better bank, and in this role, we‚Äôll count on you to be our interface between business and technology.

We‚Äôre looking for highly analytical, collaborative and agile professionals who can merge and translate data to build business momentum and deliver results.

Using professional and experiential knowledge, the Business Application Ownership and Management team works in close partnership with corporate functions and technology, as well as aligns to project management, business analysis, business management, strategy and governance.

If you get business application management, its potential and power, we think you‚Äôll love working with like-minded and innovative experts at TD, where you can help drive the business forward and take your own career to new heights.

Job Description

About this Role

Are you a conceptual and analytical thinker, at ease working on your own or together with a team? In this professional role you will provide specialized business application management guidance and support for a designated functional area. You‚Äôll be responsible for gathering requirements related with the application lifecycle, business testing and process documentation as well as end-user support of the business applications.

As a Business Application Analyst III, you will:

  • Bring advanced knowledge of applications management, supported by your team, including system components, functionality, interfaces, data flows and business rules
  • Provide functional business application management program support within an area of specialty
  • Elicit, analyze, document, communicate, and manage requirements/user stories with stakeholders and pod members by applying a variety of elicitation techniques to probe, challenge, and understand requirements according to the requirements management discipline and alignment to TD standards/processes, industry best practices and NEW Agile @ Scale framework
  • Identify, document, and validate current state processes and work with stakeholders to design the desire future state
  • Lead requirements management from high level, mid level to detailed level business requirements (including business use cases/scenarios, business rules, business process maps, customer data flows, themes/initiatives) and translate business requirements into detailed functional specifications considering non-functional requirements and accessibility standards (i.e., epics, stories, tasks, etc.)
  • Support PO in the development of story map and creation of epics and spikes/enablers that require additional technical expertise
  • Lead and facilitate user story refinement ceremonies
  • Bridge the communication between PO and development/QE members, and lead the delivery of requirements/user stories across the pod
  • Active participation in all POD ceremonies including PI Planning, Sprint Planning, Daily Standups, End of Sprint Demo/showcases, and Retrospectives
  • Establish and maintain full requirements traceability (Feature > HLR > Epic > WFs > detailed level User Stories)
  • Collaborate with PO, DCX, risk and technology partners to refine, estimate, prioritize and break down user stories into consumable size (i.e., completed within one sprint)
  • Proactively identify, communicate, and track requirement risks, issues, assumptions, dependencies, constraints
  • Provide recommendation to support the development of system design, test plans, and necessary artifacts to ensure business needs are met
  • Adhere to Enterprise project governance controls to ensure projects meet all performance, quality and compliance standards and conforms to appropriate disciplines
  • Contribute to Quality Assurance activities by supporting the development of test scripts and testing of developed solutions, including communication of issues and resolution
  • Provide sound technical knowledge and foundational understanding of the various components of the applications, supported by the team in relation to system components, functionality, interfaces, data flows and business rules (ex. UI, native vs web based, API, mid-tier/backend)

Requirements

What can you bring to TD?

Share your most relevant experience, credentials and knowledge for this role, as well as these essential requirements and attributes:

  • Undergraduate degree or technical certificate
  • Three (3) or more years relevant business analysis experience
  • Expert knowledge of business-supported applications and PDLC/Agile methodology along with policies, procedures and practices, competitors, and market trends
  • Proficiency in using analytical software tools, MS Office, process modeling, data analysis methods and reporting techniques, and Atlassian (Confluence, Jira, and its installed add-ons)
  • Ardent to work multi-functionally and independently, communicate (both in speaking and writing), provide direction or assistance and build positive working relationships across teams and functions through strong analytical and problem-solving skills

Hours

37.5

Inclusiveness

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

title: Data Analyst, Alternate Solutions Group
description:
We‚Äôre building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what‚Äôs right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

CIBC ASG, the Alternate Solutions Group, comprises several direct, digital banking businesses, including Global Money Transfer and Simplii Financial ‚Äì CIBC‚Äôs Canadian digital banking brand. It is an innovative and fast moving branch of the CIBC Capital Markets group.

The ASG Analytics team supports these businesses by producing data analysis and modelling to increase operational efficiency, improve client experience and drive revenue.

You will work closely with our business and technology partners in ASG to understand the business initiatives and produce end-to-end analytics solutions, taking models from experiment to deployment.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role Details on your work arrangement (proportion of on-site and remote work) will be discussed at the time of your interview.

How You‚Äôll Succeed

Expertise: You will utilize your knowledge of machine learning and finance to frame and solve business problems using predictive and prescriptive analytics. You will draw on familiarity of multiple ML domains such as classification, regression, time-series forecasting, recommender systems, reinforcement learning and causal inference. You will grow in the role, keeping up to date with developments in the field of finance and machine learning. You will build analytics products by writing code that is reliable, reproduceable and maintainable

Communication: You will engage with business partners and asking the right questions to understand their challenges. You‚Äôll be able to formulate and communicate solutions in an accessible way, and answer questions and concerns brought up by our partners.

Partnership: You will collaborate with the other members of the analytics team and bring your own perspectives to their problems and be open to suggestions on the best approaches for your own work. Together we will drive the success of the team.

Who You Are

You have deep quantitative knowledge, preferably with a graduate degree in computer science, engineering, statistics or other scientific or mathematical discipline, or equivalent experience.

You have 3 years work experience in analytical roles, including experience with data wrangling and programming skills to access, transform and prepare large datasets.

You also have a forward-looking, results-oriented approach to building out insights from data and analytics, and a history and track record of end-to-end responsibility for growing businesses with those insights.

You have extensive knowledge of:

  • Writing complex queries in SQL and working with data warehouses

  • Python programming

  • Software development tools, IDEs and Git for version control

  • Knowledge of data visualization tools such as Tableau and Power BI

Also beneficial:

  • Understanding of Docker and Kubernetes

  • Exposure to big data frameworks (PySpark, SparkML)

  • Machine learning libraries (pandas, scikit-learn, xgboost)

  • ML/AI Frameworks (Pytorch or Tensorflow)

  • Exposure to financial data, especially foreign exchange data

What CIBC offers

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.

  • We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive compensation, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.

  • Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.

  • We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit.

Job Location

Toronto-161 Bay St., 4th

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer - Computer Vision (Remote)
description:
We are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer - Computer Vision to join our growing ML team. You will work on challenging computer vision problems to have an impact on the 31,000+ life scientists across the world who rely on BenchSci for their research. Reporting to the Engineering Manager, ML, you'll apply your domain expertise to select, train and deploy the best-suited machine learning algorithms, collaborate and experiment with scientists, and apply techniques to build solutions to shape the future of scientific discovery. You will have plenty of room for technical innovation and greenfield to explore and propose computer vision solutions to a complex area.

You will:

    • Improve the performance and scalability of ML models and pipelines that are at the core of BenchSci's products
    • Work on different stages of the problem from prototyping to production
    • Contribute to key components across the machine learning ecosystem defining BenchSci's ML Technical Roadmap
    • Investigate what technologies that will best enable BenchSci to identify experimental insights through proof-of-concepts
    • Work with diverse teams to correctly capture the nuances of biology, translating them into ML objectives
    • Advocate for code and engineering process improvements across your team, and help define best practices
    • Participate in sprint planning, estimations, and reviews
    • Work with teammates to ensure high-quality deliverables

You have:

    • 3+ years of experience working as a professional developer, with at least 2 years of this focused on machine learning and computer vision
    • A Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, or other related disciplines
    • Excellent software engineering skills in Python
    • Comprehensive knowledge in the end-to-end machine learning lifecycle, including the nuances of the infrastructure and operationsExperience with ML and/or Computer Vision fundamentals
    • Experience productionizing ML models Experience with PyTorch, TensorFlow, Scikit-learn, and image processing libraries such as OpenCV and Scikit-image
    • Experience with distributed and cloud-based data processing frameworks such as Apache Spark or Apache Beam
    • A constant desire to develop
    • A team player who strives to see teammates succeed together


Benefits and Perks:
An engaging remote-first culture
A great compensation package that includes BenchSci equity options
15 days vacation plus an additional day every year; plus company closures for 15 more days throughout the year
Unlimited flex time for sick days, personal days, religious holidays
Comprehensive health and dental benefits Emphasis on mental health with $2500 CAD* for Psychologist, Social Worker, or Psychotherapist services
A $2000 CAD* Annual Learning & Development budget
A $1000 CAD* home office set-up budget
A $2500 CAD*wellness, lifestyle and productivity spending account for employees
Generous parental leave benefits with a top-up plan or paid time off options
*Benefits are tied to Canadian dollar amounts and would be converted to local currency for those in other countries. Moving to local currency allotments in the future.

About BenchSci:
BenchSci's mission is to exponentially increase the speed and quality of life-saving research and development. We empower scientists to run more successful experiments with the world's most advanced, biomedical artificial intelligence software platform.
Backed by Generation Investment Management, TCV, Inovia, F-Prime, Golden Ventures, and Google's AI fund, Gradient Ventures, we provide an indispensable tool for scientists that accelerates research at 16 top 20 pharmaceutical companies and over 4,300 leading academic centers. We're a certified Great Place to Work¬Æ, and top-ranked company on Glassdoor.

Our Culture:
BenchSci relentlessly builds on its strong foundation of culture. We put team members first, knowing that they're the organization's beating heart. We invest as much in our people as our products. Our culture fosters transparency, collaboration, and continuous learning.
We value each other's differences and always look for opportunities to embed equity into the fabric of our work. We foster diversity, autonomy, and personal growth, and provide resources to support motivated self-leaders in continuous improvement.
You will work with high-impact, highly skilled, and intelligent experts motivated to drive impact and fulfill a meaningful mission. We empower you to unleash your full potential, do your best work, and thrive. Here you will be challenged to stretch yourself to achieve the seemingly impossible. Learn more about our culture.

Diversity, Equity and Inclusion: We're committed to creating an inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive. We believe that improving diversity, equity and inclusion is our collective responsibility, and this belief guides our DEI journey. Learn more about our DEI initiatives.

Accessibility Accommodations: Should you require any accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs. Please reach out to talent@benchsci.com.

title: Manager, Data Governance
description:
Requisition ID: 180410

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Scotiabank is currently seeking a Manager, Data Governance to join our growing team! This role contributes to the overall success of the GBM Data Office ensuring specific individual goals, plans, initiatives are executed / delivered in support of the team‚Äôs business strategies and objectives. This role would also ensure all activities conducted are in compliance with governing regulations, internal policies, and procedures.

Is this role right for you? You will be responsible for:

  • Champions a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems, and knowledge.
  • Ensures business stakeholder understanding, alignment and commitment to the objectives of the data governance and management program.
  • Understands business requirements and aligns them to the objectives of the data management program.
  • Design and document business requirements and functional requirements to support data-related initiatives for consumer data domains, including Finance, Credit Risk, Market Risk, Liquidity Risk, and other corporate functions (e.g., Compliance and Anti-Money Laundering) and their associated business areas/processes.
  • Conduct root cause analysis of data quality issues raised through automated validation rules and self-identified issues raised by data stewards, data consumers, and data producers.
  • Support data stewards in managing data governance and data management practices within their data domains and facilitate cross-domain initiatives and activities, as necessary.
  • Monitor data quality dashboards and exception reports, performing analysis to identify trends in data quality issues, perform root-cause analysis, establish data quality themes, and determine course(s) of action, creating action plans to resolve open items.
  • Supports business and regulatory initiatives driven by the Bank‚Äôs data management framework.
  • Assist with Data Office Annual Attestations and training requirements.
  • Prepare presentation materials for Risk working groups and committee meetings
  • Understand how the Bank‚Äôs risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.
  • Actively pursues effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas in accordance with Scotiabank‚Äôs Values, its Code of Conduct, and the Global Sales Principles, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational, compliance, AML/ATF/sanctions and conduct risk.

Do you have the skills you need to succeed? We'd love to work with you, if you have:

  • Bachelor's degree
  • Global Banking and Markets experience or Capital Markets experience an asset
  • Demonstrate curiosity and problem-solving abilities
  • Solid Data analysis ability to explore data and aware of current data analytics trends and technology
  • Excellent team player, working with cross-departmental business & IT stakeholders
  • Project management experience, able to drive initiatives from planning through to execution
  • Knowledge of regulatory/liquidity reporting and business processes (e.g., FR 2052A, Liquidity Stress Test, Reg YY, etc.) an asset
  • Knowledge of requirements gathering, design methodology, and building test cases - detail oriented, analytical, and capable of investigating complex / technical issue
  • Experience in Regulations and Matters Requiring Attention an asset

title: Sr Business Insights Analyst
description:
Hours

37.5

Pay Details

We‚Äôre committed to providing fair and equitable compensation to all our colleagues. As a candidate, we encourage you to have an open dialogue with your recruiter and ask compensation related questions, including pay details for this role.

Department Overview

The Business Banking Data & Analytics (BB D&A) group is responsible for stewardship of all analytics, reporting and data management requirements for Business Banking.

The group supports Business Banking product and sales teams in the areas of analytics, insights, performance measurement, business intelligence and reporting.

The group also develops and executes policies, practices and procedures that properly manage the business‚Äôs data needs and adhere to data governance standards as set out by the Enterprise Data Governance Office (EDGO) and Enterprise Data & Analytics (ED&A).

Job Details

About this Role

Reporting to the Manager (Data in Projects), the Senior Business Insights Analyst is responsible for the holistic identification of Business Analytics, Reporting and Data Management Requirements as part of several BB pods in Programs / Projects / BAU. They will work closely and take guidance from Business Bankers, Data Management Leads, and TS counterparts, while facilitating stakeholders in understanding the impact of business processes on the data, both net-new and existing.
The incumbent will also work together with project stakeholders to help drive several data activities, as defined by the BB Data in Projects Framework, including both the Enterprise Data Governance Office (EDGO) and Analytics capabilities as defined by Enterprise Data & Analytics (ED&A). The Senior Business Insights Analyst will help enable comprehensive analytics delivery within the project/pod, in a risk-managed approach aligned to the BB Data Strategy.

Accountabilities Include:

  • Responsible for 2-way scoping of Business Analytics, Reporting and Data Management Requirements for several BB projects / programs and Pods.
  • Facilitate a breakdown of business analytics requirements including to identify reporting needs both for implementation in both operational data stores as well as analytical platforms (i.e. Akora)
  • Collaborate across BB D&A Pillars to ensure appropriate development, business acceptance testing, rollout and transition to Day 2
  • Understand data structures being modified and created across the projects and conduct lineage / reverse-engineering to understanding impacts to existing BB D&A Artefacts (i.e. Reporting, Analytics)
  • Collaborate with project team to verify business data test cases scenarios covers data quality meeting data requirements; create new test cases if required. High level verification of the quality data in lower environments.
  • Ensure decisions and solutions are aligned with the BB Data in Projects Framework and the larger BB Data Strategy
  • Identify opportunities for process improvement and automation both across the entire data architecture, as well as within the project and the overall DIP Team
  • Conduct knowledge transfer with the project teams and with D&A Teams
  • Support the project team in quantifying the benefits to the Business bank through leveraging data
  • Facilitate and document current data state and future data target states to ensure effects of data are understood and communicated across all project stakeholders
  • Work effectively with multiple teams across a broad spectrum of initiatives and functional domains, influencing and aligning others as needed;
  • Provide functional / business level communications to ensure messages to stakeholders and / or employees are consistent, appropriate and aligned to business strategies and executive management direction;
  • Develop new standards for Data documentation for use by projects, and communicate these to both D&A, Business and Technology Stakeholders
  • Participate fully as a member of the Business Bank‚Äôs Data & Analytics team, support a positive work environment that promotes service to the business, quality, innovation and teamwork and ensure timely communication of issues;
  • Contribute to a fair, positive and equitable environment that supports a diverse workforce

Job Requirements

What can you bring to TD?
Share your most relevant experience, credentials and knowledge for this role, as well as these essential requirements and attributes:

  • Seasoned Business Analyst leader with proven ability to assess, facilitate and ensure deliver holistic analytics, reporting and data management activities, on time and on budget, aligned to business needs
  • Experience leading data related initiatives with specific emphasis on data retention and disposition expertise considered an asset;
  • Strategic mindset with the ability to understand implications of key decisions on policies, down-stream processes, etc.;
  • Knowledge of Business Bank data and systems considered an asset;
  • Knowledge of platform and data warehouse design and principles is considered an asset
  • Knowledge and experience in Agile projects, Jira and confluence tools is considered an asset
  • Knowledge of Cloudera Hadoop, MS Azure, SAS and OCDO Data Management Capabilities are considered an asset
  • Experience in working on data integration projects or large scale, complex technology projects using formal project delivery methodology;
  • Hands-on experience working with SQL language to carry-on daily data profiling and data quality is considered an asset
  • Hand-on experience working with Microsoft tools like MS Visio and MS PowerPoint
  • Excellent relationship management skills;
  • Excellent oral and written communication and presentation skills;
  • Strong organizational awareness;
  • Strong attention to detail and well-organized to manage large amounts of information and details
  • Superior negotiation and creative problem-solving skills

Additional Information

#LI-Hybrid

Company Overview

Our Values
At TD we're guided by our purpose is to enrich the lives of our customers, communities and colleagues, and share a set of values that shape our culture and guide our behavior. In exchange for how our colleagues show up to help TD succeed, we are committed to delivering a colleague experience grounded in Impact, Growth and a Culture of Care. No matter where you work across TD, we empower you to make an impact at work and in your community, explore and grow your career and be part of our caring and inclusive culture.

Making Your Well-being a Priority
A caring and supportive culture that promotes colleague well-being is core to who we are. At TD, we focus on total well-being with extensive programs to help colleagues assess, manage, and improve their well-being across four core pillars ‚Äî physical, financial, social and mental/emotional. In addition, we champion a safe, inclusive and supportive work environment to help colleagues feel a sense of belonging, and supported in their personal and professional growth. Through our focus on total well-being, we know that we can help our colleagues thrive, contribute to our culture of care, and support better business outcomes ‚Ä¶ because when colleagues feel their best, they're more likely to do their best.

Our Total Rewards Package
Our Total Rewards package reflects the investment we make in our colleagues to help them, and their families achieve their well-being goals. Total Rewards at TD includes a base salary, variable compensation, and several other key plans such as health and well-being benefits including medical, dental, vision & mental health coverage, savings and retirement programs, paid time off, banking benefits and discounts, career development, and reward and recognition programs.

How We Work
At TD, we believe in-person connections fuel collaboration and collective creativity. Our workplace experience empowers colleagues to do great work side-by-side at TD locations, while offering flexibility to work remotely where it makes sense for the work and team. Our teams work in one of three workplace models: hybrid, onsite and primarily remote. Wherever our colleagues are working, they‚Äôll always have access to the TD community and experience our culture of care.

Who We Are
TD is one of the world's leading global financial institutions and is the fifth largest bank in North America by branches. Every day, we deliver legendary customer experiences to over 27 million households and businesses in Canada, the United States and around the world. More than 95,000 TD colleagues bring their skills, talent, and creativity to the Bank, those we serve, and the economies we support. We are guided by our vision to Be the Better Bank and our purpose to enrich the lives of our customers, communities and colleagues. TD is a customer obsessed organization, and we are deeply committed to being a leader in customer experience, that is why we believe that all colleagues, no matter where they work, are customer facing. As we build our business and deliver on our strategy, we are innovating to enhance the customer experience and build capabilities to shape the future of banking. Whether you‚Äôve got years of banking experience or are just starting your career in financial services, we can help you realize your potential. Through regular leadership and development conversations to mentorship and training programs, we‚Äôre here to support you towards your goals. As an organization, we keep growing ‚Äì and so will you.

Inclusiveness

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion
At TD, we‚Äôre committed to fostering an environment where all colleagues are encouraged to bring their authentic selves to work, experience equitable opportunities, and feel respected and supported. We‚Äôre dedicated to building an inclusive workforce that reflects the diversity of the customers and the communities in which we live and serve.

How We're Helping Make an Impact in Communities
TD has a long-standing commitment to help drive progress towards a more inclusive and sustainable future. That‚Äôs why we launched the TD Ready Commitment in 2018, now a multi-year North American initiative. Under the TD Ready Commitment, we are targeting a total of $1 billion by 2030 in community giving four key, interconnected drivers of change: Financial Security, Vibrant Planet, Connected Communities, and Better Health. It‚Äôs our goal to help support change, nurture progress, and contribute to making the world a better, more inclusive place for our customers, colleagues, and communities.

Accommodation
Your accessibility is important to us. Please let us know if you‚Äôd like accommodations (including accessible meeting rooms, captioning for virtual interviews, etc.) to help us remove barriers so that you can participate throughout the interview process.

We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Director, Enterprise Model Risk Management
description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you‚Äôre helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Director, Enterprise Model Risk Management

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As Director, Enterprise Model Risk Management (EMRM) in our Group Risk Management (GRM) team, you will lead and execute the validation of the Bank‚Äôs enterprise-wide credit risk rating systems and methodologies, with focus on Wholesale credit risk systems including validation of Wholesale criteria paper models and replication to ensure integrity of ratings used for Basel compliance, capital accuracy, risk management, credit provisioning, and stress testing processes. You will develop and implement tools and methodologies required to underpin credit risk systems validation, and provide insightful robust analyses of credit risk systems validation.

What will you do?

  • Ensure efficient coordination and execution of Wholesale credit risk systems model validation processes and provide insightful and robust analyses of validation results
  • Ensure execution and documentation of appropriate qualitative and quantitative tests relating to Wholesale criteria papers, including review of logic and conceptual soundness of Wholesale criteria paper models and their inputs, accuracy, sensitivity, backtesting, benchmarking and analysis of the use of the criteria paper models
  • Develop and enhance approaches tailored to timelines and data availability, utilizing detailed or 80/20 solutions, and quantitative and/or qualitative approaches, as appropriate
  • Deliver validation findings and elicit feedback and remediation action plans / solutions from model stakeholders
  • Ensure project and risk objectives are accomplished within approved timeframes and complied with regulatory requirements, model risk policy and model operating standards
  • Perform a wide range of data reconciliations and analyses, e.g. organizing, interpreting and analyzing data using various statistical techniques catered for validation purposes
  • Lead a high performing team and provide focus and clarity in establishing individual goals, driving performance management, supporting career development and rewarding strong performance
  • Complete ad hoc analytical or empirical projects

What do you need to succeed?

Must-Have

  • 7+ years of analytical and quantitative experience with a financial institution, in a related role such as a risk manager, a model developer/validator or data miner/analyst
  • Strong familiarity with design, development, and/or application of credit risk rating methodologies
  • Graduate degree in a quantitative discipline such as computer science/information system, statistics, econometrics and/or a relevant professional qualification
  • Understand various data systems (e.g. Newton/CNB Newton, CCMS, CMS, Probe, Axiom, EBR, ESN, WCRD etc.) structures/processes and how they affect inputs and outputs of credit risk modelling/validation data
  • Strong interpersonal and teamwork skills
  • Strong conceptual, analytical, detailed oriented and problem solving skills
  • Strong computer skills (SQL, Python and Microsoft Office Suite required; SAS strongly preferred)
  • Execute with urgency while maintaining quality and efficiency
  • Adapt to shifting priorities, coupled with a sense of urgency

Nice-to-Have

  • CFA, CPA, or FRM designations
  • Ability to communicate, verbally and in writing, complex concepts to a non-technical audience
  • Exposure to credit risk system design and Basel parameter estimation is an asset
  • Ability to work in Unix, Teradata Data Warehouse and/or Data Lake environments
  • Ability to work with numerous data and IT infrastructures
  • Proactive learning and working skills

What‚Äôs in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits and competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Flexible work/life balance options
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work

Job Summary

Directs and coordinates risk management projects such as regulatory reviews, inspections, audits, etc. within the department. Manages activities through senior managers and managers and implements corporate and divisional strategic plans and budgets.
