title: Manager, Business Analyst, Models - Retail and Small Business
description:
Requisition ID: 182871

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Overview

The world is changing faster than ever and so are we!

‚ÄúBig data‚Äù fed by ‚Äúcomplex processes‚Äù representing ‚Äúmassive stakes‚Äù are not just buzzwords to us; they are a genuine reflection of our daily life. Our goal is to be nothing less than The Leading Bank in The Americas that puts Customers First. Achieving this will require us to assemble and retain a Winning Team that can both design and run highly-predictive decisioning and forecasting models that accurately reflect reality. To put things in perspective, our models underpin automated risk-management decisions and forecasts that impact millions of customers and keep hundreds of billions of dollars safe, every single day. We are fortunate to have a world-class team of Data Scientists and Model Operations personnel building and deploying incredible risk models. But they need your help.

Our Regulatory Capital Model Development team is responsible for ensuring that every part of the model lifecycle, from planning to data selection, development to implementation, deployment to monitoring undergoes rigorous analysis and as well documented, controlled, effective and efficient, as possible. Getting models to market quickly is important but getting them ‚Äúright‚Äù is even more so. That is where you come in:

You are capable of poking around ‚Äúunder the hood‚Äù, asking questions ad-nauseam (in a polite and collaborative way), mapping real world processes to technical logic, data flows and sources and accurately spec‚Äôing out how our modeling and technology teams should use what you discovered.

We are results driven, we work hard, we play hard, we nerd out and we bring service, smiles and solutions to every problem that we face; so should you.

What Are We Looking For?

We want talented, pragmatic, analytically-oriented business analysts who are equally at home mapping and translating operational and technical processes into business rules and data flows, and working collaboratively with a diverse range of stakeholders to develop scalable solutions in the interest of improving our automated forecasting models and capital allocation.

We want bright and energetic but disciplined minds who come armed with a bottomless sense of curiosity about everything, a passion for getting things done right the first time, the ability to prioritize, a knack for explaining complex issues in simple concise ways and a deep sense of personal and professional accountability.

The ideal candidate will be a consummate team player who is equally comfortable being a:

  • Business Analyst / Business Consultant / Financial Analyst
  • Data Analyst
  • Software Architect
  • Process Engineer

Make an Impact

As Canada‚Äôs only truly global bank, we offer the opportunity to work in markets and with teams you may not otherwise get exposure to. You will be a critical member of a team collaborating, on a near daily basis, with a wide range of cross-bank stakeholders and internal partners including Data Scientists, Project Management Office, Technology & Data teams, Finance, Model Operations, and internal challenge functions.

You will work, day-to-day under the direction of the Regulatory Capital team, leveraging your analytic thinking and approach to support Regulatory Capital Modeling initiatives:

  • Plan and manage initiatives,
  • Map and / or re-engineer key processes, data flows and / or business rules
  • Translate concepts into algorithms and architect implementation solutions in accordance with business needs, and internal / regulatory policies and guidelines.

Potential deliverables / outcomes may include (but not be limited to):

  • Business, implementation and project plans that get executed to completion
  • Business rules, financial formulae and algorithms
  • Newly generated and retrofitted automated reporting
  • Improved operational efficiency and effectiveness
  • Quantitative analysis to support ongoing decision-making
  • Recommendations of what else ‚Äúwe should look into / fix‚Äù next

Is This Role Right for You?

  • You believe, first and foremost, in always doing the right thing and doing things the right way
  • You are both deeply curious and highly pragmatic
  • You are comfortable with data, analytic / technical and business processes
  • You relish ambitious but realistic goals and are committed to achieving them
  • You are comfortable initiating conversations and collaborating with diverse personalities
  • You are social, engaging, not afraid to ask questions and relish the opportunity to both learn and challenge how things are done in a polite and respectful way
  • You can prioritize activities to deliver the right balance of ‚Äúquick wins‚Äù & lasting solutions
  • You understand and embrace the responsibility and weight that comes with the fact that your work will impact numerous high-level stakeholders
  • You look forward to sharing your ideas and insights through both high-quality effective and concise verbal & written communications
  • You are professional, motivated AND FUN. We mean it.

What Do You Need to Succeed?

General

  • Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Engineering, Information Sciences, Business / Commerce, Finance, or equivalent field
  • A demonstrated history of problem solving, technology implementation and sound judgement
  • Fluent English-language verbal and written communications: the ability to distill complex and ambiguous operational processes, business requirements / rules and data sets into process flows and analysis, concisely convey technical requirements and requests, prepare and edit high-quality documentation, and be accepted as a trusted advisor by peers
  • Experience as a Management Consultant, Business Analyst, Process Engineer, Financial Analyst or Data Analyst with a track record of accomplishments working on cross-functional teams
  • Able to work remotely and on-site on multiple activities simultaneously and meet deadlines

Technical

  • Strong fundamental understanding of business analysis, requirements definition, process mapping, data mapping and financial analysis
  • 3-5 years of overall experience in consulting, business analysis or process engineering roles translating complex human processes to mathematical algorithms
  • Highly proficient with business productivity (ex., Visio, MS Project, JIRA, Teams, Lists), data governance / lineage (ex. Informatica, Collibra) and data management (SQL, Excel, PowerBI) tools
  • Refined ability to translate data extraction, transformation and analysis into queries / code (SQL)

Nice to Have‚Äôs

General

  • Proficient reading, writing and speaking Spanish
  • Domain expertise with retail & small business banking products and / or risk management practices
  • Familiarity with credit risk models / scorecards
  • Lean, Six Sigma, TQM or other process management frameworks and/or expertise

Technical

  • An understanding of statistical prediction, estimation and forecasting models
  • Programming experience (Python, SAS) with both legacy / traditional (RDBMS) and big data (Hadoop / Hive / Spark) systems
  • An appreciation for advanced statistical approaches used to assess and address uncertainty

What‚Äôs in It for You?

  • We have an inclusive and collaborative work environment that values curiosity & ownership, encourages pragmatic creativity (i.e., true innovation), and celebrates success!
  • You'll get to work with and learn from an incredibly friendly and diverse group of accomplished leaders

You‚Äôll have fun. We do.

Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Product Owner, Data Enablement
description:
You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you‚Äôll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

Job Description:

This is an 18-month contract position.

We are looking for a bright, energetic, and ambitious individual to join our Data Engineering Team.

This is a fantastic opportunity to work with amazing teams and help them achieve their vision to deliver actionable information from data to enable business outcomes.

You will work with business stakeholders, IT, data science, and data engineering teams to develop a vision of what they want to achieve and the strategy and plans to get there, while at the same time working with cutting edge data technologies.

Your experience as a Product Owner means translating and prioritizing business needs to user stories and roadmaps. Your ultimate job is to ensure value comes out of your data product. You will take responsibility for the business success in terms of their dealings with your data product(s).

You are a passionate advocate for your stakeholders and will drive the deliverables to completion. Once completed, you will be responsible for data governance practices within your products, including metadata documentation and data quality, as well as facilitating resolution of those data issues. Your balance between technical and business knowledge and soft skills will be Key.

What will you do?

  • Develop a deep understanding of stakeholders‚Äô business needs and outcomes
  • Work in collaboration with Business, IT, Data Engineering, and Data Science teams to design and deliver products that provide business value and drive downstream efficiencies
  • Gather requirements and document them as user stories, epics, and themes
  • Maintain a prioritized backlog
  • Provide ongoing support to stakeholders and users of the data products
  • Accountable for end-to-end delivery of the product, in partnership with IT
  • Work in collaboration with the Director to develop and execute on long term roadmaps
  • Monitor ongoing use of the data products to help direct future investment decisions
  • Maintain metadata and data dictionaries
  • Resolve conflicts and find compromises
  • Ensure data quality and facilitate issue resolutions
  • Assist in developing business case justification for product development, creating budget requests and managing funding allocations for the data product(s)
  • Partner with ES and Architecture to evaluate solution and design options
  • Acts as the go-to Subject Matter Expert for the data product(s), partnering with other SMEs in the business stakeholders, IT and Data Engineering teams to ensure coverage of expertise across the domain(s).

What do you need to succeed?

  • Proven experience with product leadership, ownership, and development in data and technology; including planning, execution and coordination of delivery activities across multiple teams and stakeholders
  • 3+ years as a Product Owner in Agile environment
  • Self-started with Owners Mindset
  • Excellent communication and influence skills while working with diverse stakeholders; ability to interact with multiple levels of management across business, IT, and Data Engineering
  • Ability to translate business needs and processes to requirements and technology direction
  • Demonstrated ability to assess business needs and conceptualize a vision for the product with the added ability to develop a product strategy and roadmap. Ability to communicate a shared vision and establish buy-in.
  • Experience with preparing cost estimates, presenting budget requests and managing to a budget.
  • Outstanding problem-solving skills and ability to facilitate problem identification, resolution and escalation across multiple business and technology disciplines.
  • High business acumen

What will be nice to have?

  • BS in Computer Science, Computer Programming, Informatics or equivalent
  • Insurance and/or Wealth Data Domain Product Experience
  • Knowledge of AWS and Database technologies
  • Familiarity with Data Science, including modeling
  • Familiarity with Data Engineering concepts such as ETL
  • Data Storyteller
  • Experience with managing multi-year roadmaps and business cases
  • Agile certification

What‚Äôs in it for you?

  • Great Place to Work¬Æ Certified in Canada and the US - 2022
  • Great Place to Work¬Æ award for Best Workplaces for #HybridWork
  • 2022 Named ‚ÄúBest Places to Work‚Äù by Glassdoor - 2021
  • Canada Award for Excellence for Mental Health at Work
  • 2021 Flexible hybrid work model including in-country work-from-home if you prefer.

#LI-Hybrid #LI-remote

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
Please note: Invision AI is one of our participating employers in the upcoming Talent Meetup with Startups and Scaleups event hosted in a hybrid capacity on May 17, 2023, from 12.00-2.00 PM. Attending employers looking to meet and interview a captive audience of AI professionals who are actively seeking new opportunities now or by Fall 2023. For event registration, click here

About Us
Our mission is to see and understand the world. Invision AI offers deep expertise with respect to Artificial Intelligence (AI) systems in the intelligent infrastructure and transportation space.

We go beyond simple 2D detection by capturing details about the space in 3D, including volume, direction, position and speed. That enables us to provide high integrity 3D digital twins for real-time actionable insights across a variety of applications and use cases in both mobile (moving sensor suites on vehicles) and fixed (wayside) scenarios. We are the only company in the world that we know of that is able to track objects that move between different cameras to provide a full end-to-end view of a space.

We are looking for a motivated and skilled Machine Learning Engineer to join our team in Toronto.

  • Deep knowledge and experience with Machine Learning algorithms, especially for object detection and classification. Experience in object tracking is a plus.
  • Good coder in Python; willing to go through rigorous code reviews
  • Clear and concise communicator
  • Find solutions that are pragmatic; realize that cutting-edge methods from literature are risky in terms of how well they work and often not necessary to complete a task

Job Description:

You will be in charge of the following tasks:

  • Design and implement solutions in python; verify and test, go through MR process
  • Review other people‚Äôs code and give feedback
  • Participate in daily standup and other team meetings
  • Analyze model inputs and outputs; fix bugs and suggest where and how our solution can be improved
  • Occasionally annotate data - Design and implement solutions in python; verify and test, go through MR process
  • Review other people‚Äôs code and give feedback
  • Participate in daily standup and other team meetings
  • Analyze model inputs and outputs; fix bugs and suggest where and how our solution can be improved
  • Occasionally annotate data

Invision AI offers deep expertise with respect to Artificial Intelligence (AI) systems in the intelligent infrastructure and transportation space. We have developed a number of unique technical innovations incorporated into a central AI platform. We go beyond simple 2D detection by capturing details about the space in 3D, including volume, direction, position and speed. That enables us to provide high integrity 3D digital twins for real-time actionable insights across a variety of applications and use cases in both mobile (moving sensor suites on vehicles) and fixed (wayside) scenarios. We are the only company in the world that we know of that is able to track objects that move between different cameras to provide a full end-to-end view of a space.

As a company, we distinguish ourselves by taking an integrated hardware-software approach throughout all our products as we constantly iterate between sensors (cameras, LiDAR, radar), their geometries and the associated vision and artificial intelligence algorithms. This has consistently allowed us to achieve industry-leading accuracy and reliability. We build lightweight, cost-effective, edge solutions: we locate compute nodes close to the sensors (as opposed to in the cloud) and leverage distributed compute and wireless transmission where needed.

We enjoy finding principled and practical solutions that mix computer vision, machine learning and software engineering.

title: Data Steward I
description:
Company Overview

Tell us your story. Don‚Äôt go unnoticed. Explain why you‚Äôre a winning candidate. Think ‚ÄúTD‚Äù if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.

Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here‚Äôs our story: jobs.td.com

Department Overview

The TD Securities Chief Data Office (TDS-CDO) aims to operate, organize, govern and monetize TDS data assets. This is achieved through four strategic pillars:

  • Make Data Accessible
  • Secure & Govern Data
  • Create Tools & Enable Others to Use Them
  • Derive Value from Data

In doing so, the TDS-CDO enables the dealer with a focus on:

  • Grow: Service clients, monetize data & allocate resources
  • Protect: Manage Risk & Regulatory Compliance
  • Standardize: Achieve technology & operational efficiencies
  • Develop: Data Driven Culture

Job Description

About this Role

Reporting to the AVP, Data Governance in the Chief Data Office, the Data Steward I will be responsible to support the implementation of data governance and related data management activities for TD Securities.

Job Accountabilities:

  • Support the TDS-CDO in accordance with the Enterprise Data Policy, Standards and Strategy
  • Provides data governance expertise and executes data governance activities
  • Contribute to various operational activities and processes as assigned
  • Be knowledgeable of data management practices and procedures within own area of responsibility and keep abreast of emerging trends for own functional area
  • Assist and help drive the automation of the Data management practices including metadata, data lineage, authoritative sources, data usage, data quality rules, etc.
  • Be knowledgeable of data management tools related to metadata, lineage, data quality, etc. (e.g.: Collibra, Alation, Informatica, Ataccama, etc.)
  • Advises and consults with projects related to implementation of data management practices during system development (data impact analysis, quality controls, data lineage, etc.)
  • Develop and/or prepare applicable business metrics / standard / ad hoc reporting in collaboration with partners and stakeholders for data governance/management area to help inform or support decisions as appropriate
  • Conduct internal and external research projects; support the development / delivery of presentations / communications to management or broader audience
  • Conduct reporting and / or meaningful analysis at the functional or enterprise level using results to draw conclusions, make recommendations, assess the effectiveness of programs/ policies /
  • Support the development of presentations /communications and dissemination of information
  • Coordinate relevant processes /meetings /events that impact the TDS-CDO‚Äôs practices
  • Understand department objectives and contribute by recommending appropriate action to management based on analysis and review of results within assigned scope
  • Monitor service, productivity and assess efficiency levels within own function and implement continuous process / performance improvements where opportunities exist
  • Acquire and apply expertise in the discipline, provide guidance, assistance and direction to others
  • Adhere to internal policies/procedures and applicable regulatory guidelines
  • Keep abreast of emerging issues, trends, and evolving regulatory requirements and assess potential impacts
  • Maintain a culture of risk management and control, supported by effective processes in alignment with risk appetite
  • Consistently exercise discretion in managing correspondence, information and all matters of confidentiality; escalate issues where appropriate

Requirements

What can you bring to TD? Share your most relevant experience, credentials and knowledge for this role, as well as these essential requirements and attributes:

Education/Accreditations:

  • Undergraduate degree or technical certificate and/or
  • 5+ years relevant experience

Other Qualifications/Skills/Experience:

  • Solid knowledge of data governance/data management practices, enterprise data policy, standards &strategy
  • Solid knowledge of LOB data strategy, data risk management, and data life cycle management
  • Knowledge of current and emerging competitor and market trends
  • Skill in using analytical software tools, data analysis methods and reporting techniques
  • Skill in using computer applications including MS Office
  • Ability to communicate effectively in both oral and written form
  • Ability to work collaboratively and build relationships
  • Ability to work successfully as a member of a team and independently
  • Ability to exercise sound judgement in making decisions
  • Ability to analyze, organize and prioritize work while meeting multiple deadlines
  • Ability to handle confidential information with discretion
  • Knowledge of Basel Data Management Framework is desirable

Additional Information

#LI-Hybrid #LI-Post

Hours

37.5

We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. title: Manager, Data Engineering (MDM)
description:
Description

Our team and what we‚Äôll accomplish together

We are searching for a talented candidate to become our team‚Äôs Manager, MDM & Business Operations Insights. Reporting to the Director ‚Äì Enterprise Data Engineering, the successful candidate will be responsible for leading a team of accomplished data analysts, engineers and architects supporting our data and analytics platform transformation. This role will be an agent of change and support the evolving strategy, data and analytics roadmaps of the enterprise data engineering team. The portfolio will focus specifically on the Master Data Management (MDM) workstream while also driving continuous improvement to our GCP engineering practices (common ingestion framework), CI/CD pipelines, DevOps, SRE, batch and real-time data ingestion, and addressing technical debt. Our team is a cloud first team and leverages the latest technologies to fuel our mission of driving value for TELUS via data enablement.

What you‚Äôll do

At TELUS, we put ‚ÄòCustomers First‚Äô. With a broad set of responsibilities and a high degree of visibility across the TELUS organization, the successful candidate will have the opportunity to:

  • Lead a team of talented data Analysts, Engineers and Architects to drive the modernization of our data platforms
  • Foster internal and external stakeholder relationships, including managing senior executive participants
  • Provide guidance to establish standards and best practices for building enterprise grade data pipelines
  • Work with our preferred Cloud service providers to align our roadmap based on their release schedule for services and product offerings
  • Construct comprehensive business cases and financial models leveraging various methods to support strategic projects and decisions with data driven insights
  • Utilize internal and external data points coupled with market research on marketplace dynamics impacting TELUS and the Data Strategy team to inform opportunities and risks for the team
  • Create technology roadmaps for business partners, executive management, and external audiences to enhance strategic decision making and support technology investment recommendations
  • Collaborate with key stakeholders to create, track and evolve the team scorecards and strategic imperatives
  • Support the annual strategic and financial planning process
  • Flex your communication, negotiation, and influencing skills, working with a broad set of internal stakeholders, executives and external partners
  • Mentor, lead, and support a diverse and very talented team of data professionals

Qualifications

What you bring

  • You have experience in technical leadership, managing data platforms, business intelligence tools and setting architectural direction
  • You can communicate clearly and effectively in both technical and business matters able to translate technical considerations into business implications
  • You are analytical and outcome-oriented with a proven ability to translate business requirements into high-level design models
  • You have hands on knowledge of foundational cloud data architecture of lakes, warehouses, data modeling, and life cycle management
  • You have demonstrated experience with the governance and oversight of data privacy, security and the ethical use of data in previous roles
  • You have experience with cloud migration projects, agile methodologies, and DevOps practices
  • You have impressive people leadership track record with proven ability to recruit, coach, mentor and lead high performing teams in a fast-paced environment
  • You are a skilled relationship builder and skilled at prioritization, negotiation and influencing
  • You can pivot between supporting the urgent needs of the business and the long-term roadmap
  • You are flexible, adaptable and embrace ongoing change
  • You have experience working on and supporting large, complex technical projects that involve multiple stakeholders and business units
  • You have exposure to tools, technologies and programming languages including, but not limited to, Python, Airflow (composer), SQL, Apache Nifi, Hive, Spark, Dataflow (Apache Beam), Kafka, MDM, IICS & PowerCentre ETL
  • You have experience creating a vision for and implementing a culture of change to drive CI/CD, DevOps and other opportunities for operational effectiveness

Great-to-haves

  • Bachelor of Computer Science or equivalent
  • 5+ years of progressive and relevant work experience with enterprise data
  • PMP certification is an asset
  • Experience with the data offerings in the Google Cloud Platform
  • Experience in the telecommunications industry
  • Excellent communication skills and ability to lead a large team

title: Senior Analytics Consultant
description:
You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you‚Äôll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

Job Description:

Sr Data Analytics Consultant, Group Disability

Reporting to the Assistant Vice President, Group Disability Western Canada and National Mental Health Solutions, the Senior Analytics Consultant will lead the development of innovative analytics solutions including transformation processes and complex data models that form the core of a new generation of analytics services and self-serve solutions for Group Disability Operations and our clients.

Our growing mandate to deliver Data Analytics, Artificial Intelligence and Data Solutions requires an experienced data consultant to accelerate the development of our strategic analytics projects in support of our Group Disability stakeholders.

What will you do?

  • Work directly with Group Disability operations leaders, consultants and clinicians; Group Benefits Market Development, along with data engineers, business data analysts, and data scientists in Canadian Operations throughout the entire engagement life cycle including technical analysis, design, development, implementation and consulting efforts
  • Maintain best practice standards for analysis and reporting at all levels including data governance, documentation, testing and visualization techniques
  • Lead and drive data modelling and analysis related to disability claims experience in support of Group Disability and related projects including setting up data for test and learn initiatives for research and development of innovation in disability management
  • Lead consultants in the team on various analytics projects
  • Facilitate group meetings of various sizes for solution design, decision making, problem-solving and solution implementation.
  • Turn complex data into easy to understand visual insights that are aligned to business objectives
  • Enable visual storytelling through Tableau and visual analytics tools
  • Coach and grow new and interested community of developers and champions within the organization

What will you need to succeed?

Education and Experience:

  • Minimum undergraduate degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent
  • 3-5 years of experience in:
  • SQL and other languages used in data manipulation
  • Tableau or other BI development experience and designing dashboards / decision enablement tools
  • Experience leading analytics projects with stakeholders
  • Data warehousing principles and experience in design and/or development using dimensional modeling principles
  • Good Understanding of ELT/ETL processes and Microsoft SQL Server Analysis Services or equivalent technologies
  • Strong oral and written communication skills with experience in relating complex concepts to non-technical users, including presentation and storytelling with data
  • Visual design expertise with a solid understand of the best practices around dashboard and visual perception.
  • End-to-End development experience and ability to create complex calculations including Level of Detail (LOD) expressions, action filters, user filters and implement advanced dashboard practices in Tableau
  • Solid understanding of how to consolidate and transform data to meaningful and actionable information
  • Ability to draw out meaningful business insights by synthesizing information from multiple sources
  • Demonstrated experience in development of analytics applications or data analysis, including insights development and communication to senior leadership

What will be good to have?

  • Experience with AWS Data Lake
  • Experience with R, Python, AWS Sage Maker
  • Experience with Agile or design-driven development of analytics applications
  • PMP and/or Scrum Master certification
  • Experience with optimization and tuning of large data extracts for Tableau
  • Tableau desktop and server certification
  • Knowledge of Insurance or Financial Services industry

What‚Äôs in it for you?

  • Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data
  • 20 days vacation per year and an innovative sabbatical program
  • A friendly, collaborative and inclusive culture
  • Being part of our Analytics community, where we share best practices and broaden skill-sets
  • Flexible Benefits from the day you join to meet the needs of you and your family
  • Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security
  • Fitness and wellness programs that help you balance work and life and enjoy a healthier lifestyle

The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted. It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors. In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance. Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results.

Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.

At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Velocity - Data Scientist Internship/Co-Op - Fall 2023
description:
Requisition ID: 177545

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Term: September - December 2023
Application Deadline: 05/19/2023

There's no better way to find your dream job than to do a co-op or internship with Scotiabank! During your work term, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to be part of a winning team, build your network, and discover what you love ‚Äì all while getting paid to do it! There‚Äôs a place for every type of student at Scotiabank and all that we ask for is that you have passion and strong AOO (Attitude, Ownership and Opportunity).

The Velocity Program is not your average internship or co-op! This is a customized experience that focuses on providing you with the development and tools you need to grow your career. After successfully completing a co-op or internship with top performance, we will work with you to establish your future placements. As a result, you will get to learn, grow, and experiment within different areas of both Scotiabank and Tangerine!

Is this role right for you? In this role, you will:

  • Collaborate with business lines and other stakeholders and identify opportunities to drive business value by leveraging data science solutions
  • Leverage distributed computing tools (e.g., Spark, Cloud) for analysis, data mining, and modeling
  • Collaborate with data engineering, software developer, and other analytics teams to build analytical dataset and model
  • Create and apply model and algorithm testing strategies to measure, conduct testing to measure the effectiveness of models, and make ongoing changes
  • Prepare detailed documentation to outline data sources, models, and algorithms used and developed
  • Present results to business line stakeholders and help implement real data-driven changes
  • Work on challenging and research-based initiatives using advanced machine learning methods focusing on data-driven outcomes
  • Experiment & learn!

Do you have the skills and requirements that will enable you to succeed in this role? ‚Äì We‚Äôd love to work with you if:

  • You are currently enrolled in post-secondary education.
  • You love to learn and envision yourself working for an international organization that heavily invests in your future.
  • You enjoy being involved in extracurricular activities such as conferences, clubs, and hackathons.
  • You have knowledge/experience in:
  • Cleaning, transforming, and visualizing large data sets working with various data formats (e.g., unstructured logs, XML, JSON, flat files)
  • Big Data/Cloud ecosystem (e.g., GCP)
  • Experimental design, statistical analysis, machine learning
  • Python programming
  • Common machine learning libraries in Python, PySpark (scikit-learn, xgboost)
  • UNIX tools and shell scripting
  • SQL skills for querying relational databases (e.g., SQL Server, DB2, MySQL)
  • Visualization tools like PowerBI
  • Kubernetes
  • Git Workflows (Pull Request, Code Review, Branching)

What‚Äôs in it for you?

  • You‚Äôll be part of a diverse, collaborative, innovative, and high-performing team.
  • In-depth training to prepare you for the role, as well as ongoing coaching and feedback to help you succeed!
  • Exclusive student events such as Scotia Student Day, Lunch & Learns, leadership panels, and much more!
  • Bank-wide orientation to learn more about Scotiabank and gain exposure to senior leadership across the organization.

How do I apply?

For students applying to our internship/co-op or new graduate programs, we do not require resumes! We believe in evaluating you through relationships‚ÄØover resumes and are focused on learning about who you are and what you‚Äôre interested in to uncover your true potential.‚ÄØInstead,‚ÄØwe ask that as part of your application you complete the below:

  1. Complete your PLUM Profile here and save as a screenshot.
  2. Complete a short one-way video interview here.
  3. Once you have completed your Plum Profile and one-way video interview, apply to the role. Reminder: when the application asks for your resume, instead upload the screenshot of your PLUM Profile!

*To be considered for student opportunities at Scotiabank, Tangerine, and MD Financial you must complete all steps above.

Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

title: Senior Analyst, Reporting & Insights
description:
Requisition ID: 178001

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Contributes to the overall success of the Omni Channel Development team, taking effective ownership of developing data integration strategies, and creating various reporting streams that generate value-added actionable insights informing Retail Banking business strategies and objectives. Ensures all activities conducted are in compliance with governing regulations, internal policies and procedures.

The Sr. Analyst, Reporting & Insights, will play a key role in supporting the expansion of our reporting framework, improving our analytical processes, and sharing insights to multiple stakeholders and will be responsible for delivering value-added analytics aimed at creating sustainable business growth focusing on reporting, Insights and data visualization.

Is this role right for you? In this role, you will:

  • Design and develop new reports to support management including but not limited to - visualization tools such as Tableau & PowerBI, complex data and logic tools, SAS, SQL, and self-service dashboards

title: Analytics and Insights Co-op
description:
Company Overview

All companies are not the same. What makes TD special as a business is also, what makes us special as an employer.

Why TD?

TD‚Äôs Colleague Promise: A better you. A better us.

A more confident you means a stronger us. We empower you to grow your skills, gain new perspectives, and create impact at work and in your community. That‚Äôs our unique and inclusive culture.

Department Overview

TD Direct Investing is Canada‚Äôs largest direct investing brokerage, empowering 2 million self-directed investors and traders with its full spectrum of powerful solutions and innovative tools to manage their investments with ease and confidence. As a member of the TD Direct Investing Product, Strategy & National Office team, you have the opportunity to work with results-oriented, curious, innovative, and adaptable people who share your passion to help our clients, and one another, to succeed.

Job Description

Reporting to Senior Manager, Strategic Insights & Analysis, and working alongside a team of analysts, this role will help drive and support TD Direct Investing‚Äôs strategic client engagement and acquisition initiatives in analytical, process development, and execution capacities. This role will primarily focus on providing data-driven insights and decision support to various business initiatives, acquiring data in support of such work, as well as helping to develop robust processes and procedures, and executing thereon.

Key accountabilities include:

  • Perform and leverage DI‚Äôs client segmentation to create and support targeted organic growth initiatives, client engagement tactics, and business value proposition enhancements

  • Prepare structured data analyses, often in time-sensitive circumstances, and be able to summarize key insights into a coherent, concise communication suitable for executive consumption.

  • Collaborate with partners in Data & Analytics teams across Wealth, Marketing, and Phone Channel to understand complex business issues and develop innovative data-driven insights and solutions.

  • Support the Senior Manager, Strategic Insights & Analysis in the execution and control of regular reporting, campaign fulfillment, and non-standard pricing processes, ensuring proper documentation.

  • Contribute to a culture of continuous improvement (through process improvements, automation, improved documentation, etc.)

Requirements

  • Knowledge of and familiarity or hands-on experience with self-directed investing platforms

  • Experience with data extraction, manipulation, and visualization tools (e.g. SQL, Python, Alteryx, Tableau) preferred

  • Familiarity with Excel and PowerPoint, including experience developing business documents and leadership presentations with clear, compelling communications

  • Ability to communicate clearly and concisely

Additional Information

  • We welcome all applications; however, we will only contact qualified candidates chosen for an interview. Thank you for your interest.
  • TD requires employees to reside in the country where the role is located, irrespective of remote working arrangements.

title: Data Engineer, Finance Data
description:
Vision and Core Values

OMERS overall vision is to play a leadership role in the pension industry and be first of class, deliver superior services and to grow and attract investment partners. The core values are to be fair, have high integrity, respect for each other, provide superior service and work as a team.

The Corporate Objectives for OMERS is to provide secure pensions for all their constituents by:

  • Investing to earn outstanding returns with due regard for risk
  • Partnering with like-minded investment managers
  • Providing high quality service to our members and employers
  • Delivering value for money
  • Building a culture of excellence and pride in OMERS

OMERS Operating Principles are: Financial Strength, Accountability, Member Focus, Talent and Reporting.

Value Proposition

We‚Äôd be thrilled to have you join our team as we set up our Capital Markets Finance Data team for new and continued success! We‚Äôll focus equally on expertise and excellence, paired with culture and community. We will serve OMERS teams primarily in Capital Markets, Total Portfolio Management, and the Corporate function through understanding their needs, delivering against their expectations, and contributing our proficiencies ‚Äì to achieve collective wins. This role joins a team on a journey, with much future potential in a global, sophisticated, complex enterprise.

Scope: The Data Engineer is responsible for supporting the investment teams by enabling robust and reliable investment data, analytics, and reporting through investment technology and change management at one of Canada‚Äôs largest pension funds having assets exceeding $120 Billion.

Responsibilities:

  • Design, develop, and help maintain data assets to extract, transform, and load data from various data files, APIs, and databases, and to make them accessible to various client-facing applications as well as investment data warehouse and internal tools
  • Implement data strategies that prepare, transform, combine and manage structured and unstructured data (e.g. internal investment accounting systems as well as external third-party investment feeds) to integrate the data into an investment data warehouse and BI solutions
  • Develop and operate highly scalable data pipelines and infrastructure that enable investment analytics, and investment reporting use cases
  • Automate manual processes and optimize data delivery
  • Utilize modern technologies for designing and building data solutions to meet business needs
  • Partner with business analysts and reporting analysts to develop reports and PowerBI dashboards
  • Support and troubleshoot existing investment data applications and BI reporting solutions as needed
  • Work as part of a cross-functional agile team responsible for end-to-end delivery of business needs
  • Collaborate and work effectively with business analysts and reporting analysts team members, and other investment professionals and leaders in solutioning and support

Qualifications:

  • Track of record working in a fast-paced environment and multi-faceted role that intersects with business and technical analysts to support existing solutions, solution delivery, and contributions as a project resource for investment system implementations and upgrades
  • Strong experience with data management, investment systems, business intelligence, and other reporting technologies
  • Experience with Microsoft based BI/ETL tools (e.g. SQL Server, SSRS, SSIS, data factory) or similar
  • Experience with Cloud based data and analytics platforms (e.g. Snowflake, DataBricks, Azure Synapse)
  • Deep proficiency in SQL, Python, and similar languages
  • Good understanding of investment products
  • Demonstrated ability to handle multiple projects and tasks at the same time to support daily production issues
  • Critical thinking skills with the ability to independently solve problems with data and/or reference documents
  • Investment data modeling experience using the Kimball method is an asset
  • Experience with BNY Eagle PACE, Calypso, and Charles River is an asset
  • Data governance experience is an asset
  • Bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Finance, or a related field

And you demonstrate:

  • A people-first focus with a desire to develop meaningful, positive relationships across all levels of the organization
  • A teammate mentality coupled with servant leadership
  • A sense of urgency, optimism, and a desire to deliver excellence
  • A desire to drive debate, to speak candidly, and to listen empathetically
  • Strong orientation towards strategy, change, and results
  • A continuous improvement mindset

Our story:

Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada‚Äôs largest defined benefit pension plans, with $124 billion in net assets as at December 31, 2022. OMERS is a jointly-sponsored pension plan, with more than 1,000 participating employers ranging from large cities to local agencies, and over half a million active, deferred and retired members. OMERS members include union and non-union employees of municipalities, school boards, local boards, transit systems, electrical utilities, emergency services and children‚Äôs aid societies across Ontario. Contributions to the Plan are funded equally by members and employers. OMERS teams work in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe ‚Äì serving members and employers and originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate.

OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives.

title: Risk Management Intern/Co-op
description:
Company Overview

All companies are not the same. What makes TD special as a business is also, what makes us special as an employer.

Why TD?

TD‚Äôs Colleague Promise: A better you. A better us.

A more confident you means a stronger us. We empower you to grow your skills, gain new perspectives, and create impact at work and in your community. That‚Äôs our unique and inclusive culture.

Department Overview

Co-op and Internship opportunities allow you to gain valuable work experience across a number of the businesses at TD. You will work with experienced colleagues, receive world class training, and be part of a community of students across TD, where you will have an impact, grow as individual and experience our culture of care.

Our Co-op/Intern Programming is offered with select Co-op and Internship roles and is designed to help you better understand the TD business, build on critical career capabilities, and broaden your professional network. This program is designed to complement your on-the job experience and features:

  • Leadership talks with key Leaders from across the organization
  • Lunch and Learns on topics such as Innovation
  • Diversity and Inclusion and Personal Branding and so much more

For TD Bank Group to grow profitably, it must selectively take and manage risks. TD recognizes that a strong risk culture and approach to risk management is fundamental to our success.

TD‚Äôs risk management approach is comprehensive and proactive and combines experience and specialized knowledge of individual business segments, risk professionals, and the corporate oversight functions. It is based on enabling TD‚Äôs business to understand their risks and developing the policies, processes and controls required to manage these risks appropriately in line with the Bank‚Äôs strategy and risk appetite.

Job Description

Risk Management is a key Corporate Function supporting the front-line businesses within TD with over 1,800 employees in offices in Canada, United States, UK and Singapore. We partner internally with many different areas of TD as well as our business partners to ensure we exceed our client‚Äôs expectations, and employees to focus on a positive employee experience. We work externally with regulators to align with industry standards and benchmark ourselves against best practices.

As a student part of the TD Risk Management Co-op program you will have the opportunity to join different development workshops, seminars and lunch and learns. We will provide you the necessary tools, resources and guidance to achieve both business and personal goals.

Requirements

  • Currently enrolled in an undergraduate degree majoring in Business, Statistics, Mathematics, Financial Analysis, Risk Management, Computer Science or equivalent
  • Must be enrolled in an undergraduate degree with the intent of going back to school at of the start of your work term
  • Familiarity with SAS
  • Relational database SQL skills for data mining, extraction and statistical analysis.
  • Strong excel Advanced MS Excel and MS Access for data analysis (Pivot, Filter, Formulas, Vlookup, VBA)
  • Dedicated, detail oriented, and an ability to propose creative solutions
  • Written & verbal communication skills
  • Quick learner
  • High degree of personal initiative

Skills that are not required, but considered an asset

  • Knowledge of Financial Industry/Risk Management/Retail Credit products
  • Experience using Business Intelligence Reporting tools such as SAP Business Objects, Cognos or Tableau
  • Microsoft Visio would be an asset
  • Knowledge of R and HIVE
  • Knowledge of Basel Capital Frameworks Quality Center (HP ALM) Testing tool
  • MS Project

Additional Information

Please note that this is a general posting. If you are selected for an interview, more information regarding which business group and the specific job duties will be provided.

  • This position is an 4-month work term and will commence Sept 5th ‚Äì Dec 22nd, 2023
  • Applications must include a transcript, cover letter (one letter-sized page or less) and a resume (maximum of 2 pages).
  • We welcome all applications; however, we will only contact qualified candidates chosen for an interview. Thank you for your interest.
  • TD is committed to providing you with the best candidate experience and internship in these unique circumstances. As such, work location and start dates are subject to change.

LOCATION

  • Hybrid work model, centered in Toronto. TD requires employees to reside in the country where the role is located, irrespective of remote working arrangements.

Start Date

‚Äì Fall

Inclusiveness

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

title: Senior Associate, Research Analytics & Institutional Client Strategy
description:
Requisition ID: 174805

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

About the Team:
At Scotiabank, research is a key driver of our Global Equity platform. We specialize in the Canadian market, and we also supply targeted international research covering the United States and Latin America. Our top-ranked teams generate value-added equity ideas and themed publications. As well, we are constantly looking for ways to bring new products to market and provide clients with valuable research ideas and insights. Our products include daily company-specific investment views, monthly and quarterly sector updates, in-depth fundamental research reports, portfolio analysis and recommendations, and equity strategy commentary.

Position Highlights:
The Research Client Services Team (RCST) is responsible for supporting the Equity Research department by providing valuable internal analytical insights to management and research analysts for strategic decision-making and ensuring adherence to compliance requirements of the MiFID II regulation. As a member of the RCST, this position will assist in maintaining and developing the internal analytics capabilities of the team. This position will also assist with the administration of client research agreements and work closely with research analysts, senior management, and compliance teams as part of the overall MiFID II compliance framework.

Is this role right for you?

  • Produce periodical analytical summary reports for the Research Management team
  • Create analysis and reporting tools on an ad hoc basis to support internal data and analytical requests
  • Create and maintain dashboards and reports that can be leveraged by users to find insights
  • Analyze client accounts to identify outreach opportunities and gauge account profitability
  • Work with Research Analysts to improve the format and delivery of their product
  • Understand business processes to analyze, interpret, and advise staff on analytical findings
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to ensure effective use of reporting and analysis, and provide support, if needed
  • Understand and incorporate technology best practices with a primary focus on .NET and SQL
  • Liaise with other internal analytics teams to ensure data accuracy and consistency across the firm
  • Diligently perform quality assurance and assess operational and reputation risk
  • Monitor and analyze buyside client consumption of the research product
  • Respond to internal and external inquiries on the research product and agreements
  • Issue invoices for research clients and track payments with internal Finance teams

Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role? We'd love to work with you if you have:

  • Technical mindset with an undergraduate degree in Computer Science or Engineering is required
  • Excellent command of Microsoft Office, with an emphasis on Excel is required
  • Proven experience in SQL and .NET is required
  • Working knowledge of Angular and Python would be an asset
  • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Attention to detail and time management skills
  • Ability to produce meaningful results from data
  • Proven experience consolidating and analyzing different data sources
  • Ability to work collaboratively within a cross functional team environment
  • Ability to succeed in a dynamic and fast-paced environment

Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. If you require technical assistance, please click here. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

We‚Äôre here to help

At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.

To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en.

BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other‚Äôs differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
Description

Join our team

The Data Strategy & Enablement team is on a continuous journey towards helping TELUS become a world-class leader in data solutions, doing so by delivering data analytics capabilities built upon unified scalable platforms, advanced AI solutions, high-quality data, and a data-product-oriented culture while always keeping an eye on the horizon, preparing for the next big thing.

We are entrepreneurial and live by our AI Manifesto of failing fast and being outcome vs technology-driven, creating value for our customers, team members, communities, and the environment. The team takes pride in our Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning capabilities and takes ownership of each step of the process. From hypothesis generation, initial exploring of datasets, developing novel AI techniques to discover insights, to developing automation pipelines and web visualizations, we do it all!

Always wanted to work with a team of innovators touching all business units within TELUS, and be part of a culture that embraces creativity and collaboration? If so, we‚Äôd love to talk with you!

Here‚Äôs the impact you‚Äôll make and what we‚Äôll accomplish together

You‚Äôll be a part of the team and journey that will transform the way we do business across various domains. You‚Äôll collaborate with teams across the company, seeking out various data sources to help identify new business opportunities while championing data-driven decision-making and the accelerated adoption of AI.

As a Data Scientist on the team, you will combine your expert knowledge of data science with your strong software development skills to automate and facilitate data exploration, analytics, machine learning model development, training and deployment and will leverage your experience in building reusable algorithms, functions and libraries.

Here\'s how

  • Lead the iterative development, validation, and deployment of AI/ML models
  • Collaborate on end-to-end automation efforts required to bring models to production
  • Work with structured and unstructured raw data to design and develop innovative predictive models, metrics, and dashboards to uncover actionable insights
  • Visualize and report data findings creatively in a variety of visual formats that provide insights to the organization
  • Influence how we approach business challenges and opportunities by driving the adoption of a data-driven mindset
  • Develop re-usable code aimed at delivering on future goals faster and more reliably
  • Support and evolve the Advanced Analytics and Data Science roadmap by leveraging industry research, best practices and emerging tools/technology
  • Build and maintain a strong engagement with key stakeholders to understand business needs and priorities

Qualifications

You\'re the missing piece of the puzzle

  • You are recognized for addressing business needs via your application of data mining and analysis, predictive modeling, statistics and other advanced analytical techniques in which you have previous hands-on work experience
  • You are sought out for your skills in Machine Learning and AI, including regression, classification, clustering, time series analysis, NLP, and optimization and bring 2-4 years of hands-on work and practical business experience in the above areas
  • You are a master communicator capable of breaking down technical and complex concepts in a way that is understood by non-technical audiences
  • You have solid development experience with Python and you are comfortable using various data science libraries such as Scikit-learn, Pandas, Numpy as well as frameworks like TensorFlow, Pytorch, Keras and have applied these skills towards solving actual business matters
  • You are comfortable in and with a Jupyter environment and infrastructure, and familiar with GitHub
  • You possess advanced knowledge in SQL and distributed computing
  • You are familiar with at least one of the cloud computing platforms - GCP, AWS, Azure
  • You are well versed in software and AI development lifecycles, including ML Ops
  • You are agile and have a bias for action, removing roadblocks to get results fast

Great-to-haves

  • Masters or PhD degree in a quantitative field such as Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Engineering, or Data Science
  • Experience with agile methodology and work in a start-up environment
  • GCP or other cloud certifications

#LI-REMOTE

title: Software Developer - Machine Learning Platform (MLops)
description:
About Avidbots:

At Avidbots, we believe in solving real world problems with autonomous cleaning robotic solutions to unlock humanity‚Äôs potential. Neo is our current ground-breaking autonomous floor scrubbing robot that enhances facility cleanliness around the world empowering reallocation of human capital to higher priority focuses‚Ä¶and we‚Äôre just getting started!

Headquartered in Kitchener, ON, Canada, we are an employee-focused organization that has been certified a Great Place to Work¬Æ consecutively for the last 4 years and one of Deloitte\'s Fast 500 (2021).

Now is your opportunity to join a fast-growing technology company built on teamwork, innovation, and boundless ambition! Take a look at what Neo can do!

About the role:

The Machine Learning Platform (MLP) team is responsible for developing systems and tools that enable the development and deployment of machine learning solutions to a large fleet of autonomous robots around the world. This includes supporting all stages of the machine learning lifecycle, from data acquisition and transformation, to deployment and monitoring, and collaborating with other teams on model development and training.

You will join a small team with the opportunity to have a large impact on the technical decisions and development of large-scale machine learning initiatives that will shape the next-generation of commercial robotics.

How you will make a difference:

  • Design, develop, and test data transformation pipelines operating on large amounts of structured and unstructured data.
  • Deploy and maintain scalable cloud infrastructure that support machine learning and data engineering workloads.
  • Collaborate with members of various functional teams to scope, explore, prototype, and implement solutions.

Required Skills & Experience:

  • BE / B.Tech or higher degree in Computer Science / Engineering or equivalent
  • 5+ years of professional software development experience (Python, C++ preferred)
  • Experience building large-scale data transformation pipelines with technologies such as Apache Spark, Amazon S3, Dagster, and Airflow
  • Hands-on experience designing scalable infrastructure for machine learning applications
  • Experience with cloud services such as Amazon Web Services, and familiarity with tools such as Docker, Kubernetes, and Terraform
  • Knowledge of best practices in modern software development, such as git
  • Proficiency with Linux-based operating systems

Nice to Have:

  • Experience with Robot Operating System (ROS)
  • Experience working with a global team

Avidbots is an equal opportunity employer committed to building a diverse workforce. As a multicultural organization, we encourage individual achievement and recognize the strength of a diverse workforce. We offer a professional working environment and culture and believe that work/life balance is critical to ensure the happiness/well-being of our people.

Upon request, Avidbots will provide reasonable accommodation for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process

#INDAV

title: Applied ML Scientist, Health Lead
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION

Applied ML Scientist, Health

POSITION OVERVIEW

As an Applied ML Scientist - Health, you will provide technical leadership and contribute to focused research breakthroughs and applications to solve real-world health problems with machine learning and AI. You will provide guidance and work with some of the best and brightest data scientists and machine learning (ML) engineering staff from leading industry and health organizations. You will collaborate with some of the leading machine learning researchers, data scientists and AI engineering teams. Publishing research papers on applied research is a part of this role, but the greatest focus is on the impact of applications, not on the quantity or quality of publications. We are seeking a scientist with research experience in Responsible AI in a deep learning context. Experience in Fairness, Explainability, Privacy, AI Safety, Recommender Systems, and Natural Language Processing are all valuable areas of knowledge for this role. This position is an individual contribution position and focused on providing technical leadership in implementation focused applied ML in health settings.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Lead research and implementation of varied machine learning and deep learning techniques in the health domain;
  • Work in collaboration with Vector‚Äôs Health team, and health sector partners to identify challenges in the health domain that can be solved using advanced ML techniques such as NLP, Computer Vision, Generative Models etc.;
  • Provide technical guidance to AI Engineering team members and lead delivery of applied ML projects in health;
  • Provide scientific advice regarding overall machine learning application strategies and roadmaps for the health domain;
  • Work in collaboration with Researchers, Machine learning specialists, and Vector affiliates to build demos, minimum viable products (MVP), reference implementations, and prototypes;
  • Provide scientific oversight for Vector-led or co-led efforts to prepare and present machine learning research in the health domain;
  • Serve as the lead Vector scientific contributor for health, including contributing to or leading the authoring of peer-reviewed research papers;
  • Contribute to training sessions and other initiatives for Vector‚Äôs professional staff and stakeholders that help increase AI knowledge and capacity of the health system to recognize and act on opportunities to apply machine learning;
  • Serve as an expert and facilitate identification of experts among Vector‚Äôs research community for external stakeholders to advise on machine learning research trends and applications;
  • Perform other functions as required e.g., providing scientific advice and technical support to other members of Vector‚Äôs leadership team and corporate projects led by Vector.

PROFILE OF IDEAL CANDIDATE

  • PhD degree in computer science or computer engineering with a research focus on machine learning required;
  • Demonstrated expertise in one or more of: ML for health, Explainable AI, AI Safety, privacy for AI/ML, AI governance, Nature Language Processing (NLP), Natural Language Understanding and generation;
  • Demonstrated experience applying machine learning research to novel problems and data sets;
  • Experience with software engineering and/or data engineering is considered an asset;
  • Strong knowledge and experience of Python;
  • Experience with parameter and architecture tuning of deep learning algorithms;
  • Experience using open source deep learning software frameworks (e.g, PyTorch, Tensorflow, JAX); and,
  • Experience with recommendation systems is considered an asset.

KEY SUCCESS MEASURES

  • Vector is successful in implementing its health strategy (including the strategic goal to support the widespread application of Health AI) and the industry sponsor retention strategy
  • Stakeholders that would otherwise be unable to utilize machine learning techniques are supported in identifying problems amenable to AI, and in utilizing machine learning
  • Following interactions with the Vector team, external stakeholders are positioned to perform, or secure external resources to perform, their own machine learning deployment independent of direct Vector involvement

title: Autonomy Developer - Perception
description:
Description

Position: Autonomy Developer - Perception
Location: Kitchener-Waterloo, Ontario
Job Type: Full-Time Permanent
Experience: 3+ Years Relevant Work or Academic Experience
Education: Graduate Degree in Related Field
Division: OTTO Motors

About OTTO‚Ñ¢ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO‚Ñ¢ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company‚Äôs industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

We\'re looking for a driven, resourceful and motivated candidate for the Senior Perception Developer - Calibration and Sensors position. This person will take a leading role in the development of calibration and sensor algorithms for autonomous mobile robots.

The Perception Team‚Äôs primary responsibility is the development of the core robotics software responsible for environmental sensing and understanding on all of our vehicles. As a Senior Perception Developer - Calibration and Sensors, you will develop and maintain algorithms and processes for the complete continuous calibration and monitoring of robotic systems. You will be creating solutions to the challenging problems of high accuracy intrinsic and extrinsic calibration of heterogeneous sensor configurations and actuators, as well as online calibration and sensor processing and monitoring for a wide range of possible robotic platforms. You will be responsible for evaluating state-of-the-art ideas from academia and industry, and taking these ideas out of the lab and into the real world, identifying opportunities to improve, and developing high-performance software to run in real time on robots. As part of the Perception Team you will continue to advance the cutting edge of robotics research through collaboration with our academic partners and contributions to research publications and open source initiatives.

About You

For the role of Senior Perception Developer - Calibration and Sensors, we are seeking an experienced developer to develop, support, maintain, and extend robotic calibration solutions for real world applications.

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Creating robust innovative solutions to the problems of robotic calibration and perception
  • Developing custom calibration, sensor monitoring, sensor filtering, and perception algorithms
  • Evaluating new sensing technology and robotic platforms
  • Working with production and hardware teams to develop processes for sensor calibration methods
  • Supporting the deployment and testing of robotic systems
  • Collaborating with various internal teams, as well as academic and industrial partners
  • Staying up to the date with the latest developments from academia and industry

Skills and experience:

  • Graduate degree in engineering/CS or a related field, with applicable background.
  • Strong theoretical and practical understanding of the challenges and solutions to the problems of robotic system calibration.
  • Practical knowledge of sensing technologies including LIDAR, Cameras, IMU, and their error models.
  • Familiarity with robotic platforms and their motion models such as differential, ackerman, bicycle, etc.
  • Strong software development skills in modern C++.
  • Understanding of software development workflows, life cycles and development methodologies and tools.
  • Hands-on experience with real world autonomous systems.

Bonus points for:

  • Experience writing efficient, high performance code.
  • Experience with ROS, Gazebo, OpenCV and PCL.
  • Familiarity with linear algebra and nonlinear optimization techniques and libraries such as Ceres, GTSAM, g2o and Eigen.
  • Understanding of sensor error modeling, particularly laser rangefinders and vision systems.
  • Experience with manufacturing tolerances of robotic systems
